loans.name: Olinda Maruja

texts.es: Olinda, de 38 años, es una valerosa madre soltera de 2 hijos: Leonardo y Yamil. En unión familiar ellos viven en casa de su hermano Leonidas, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas.Hace 18 años, que se dedica a la elaboración de tapices, chompas, gorras y demás productos a base de lana; los hermosos tejidos con motivos diversos, los vende a los comerciantes que constantemente visita el lugar, pero en temporada de mayor venta los comercializa en la capital del país y en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde alquila un pequeño lugar en la zona céntrica de la localidad. Pero como mujer emprendedora, Olinda, también siembra papa y maca en grandes cantidades, en la localidad de Condorin; los cuales vende a los compradores que visitan sus terrenos agrícolas constantemente. Ahora Olinda, desea invertir más en el desarrollo de sus negocios, por ello más adelante desea invertir en la adquisición de una tienda, donde puedan encontrar los hermosos tejidos de Olinda, asimismo poder comercializar sus sembríos cada vez a mejores precios.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura de progresar con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Además de agradecer el dinero brindado. Olinda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales como lana de alpaca para realizar las hermosas carteras, bolsas, tapices y demás artesanía para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Olinda, age 38, is a courageous single mother with two children, Leonardo and Yamil.  They live together with family in her brother Leonidas’ house.  The house is located in San Pedro de Cajas.

She has been making tapestry, sweaters, hats, and other woolen products for 18 years.  She sells the beautiful weavings with varied motifs to the merchants who constantly visit the locale.  However, during the season of greater sales she sells them in the country’s capital and in the city of Huancayo.  That is where she rents a small place in the central zone.

Also, as an enterprising woman, Olinda also grows big quantities of potatoes and maca in Condorin.  She sells them to the buyers who constantly visit her fields.

Olinda now wishes to invest more in the development of her businesses.  Thus, she wishes to invest in acquiring a store later on.  The store is where Olinda’s beautiful weavings will be found.  Likewise, she  will be able to sell her crops for a better price each time.

She belongs to the “Corazón de San Pedro” (Heart of San Pedro) Communal Bank.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is sure to make progress with the support of her communal bank, and she is grateful for the money that was provided. 

Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to buy materials like alpaca wool to make the beautiful wallets, handbags, tapestries, and the rest of the handicrafts that she will sell.

loans.use: to buy materials like alpaca wool to make the beautiful wallets, handbags, tapestries, and the rest of the handicrafts that she will sell.

loans.name: María Rayda

texts.es: María, de 38 años, convive con Jesús, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Humberto y Jasmira. Viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas.Hace 6 años que la ingeniosa y muy astuta María, abrió su tienda de venta de lanas, de diferentes colores, los cuales vende a los pobladores de su localidad, que se dedican al arte de tejer pendas de vestir, como también tapices. En su negocio le va muy bien, según menciona obtienen una ganancias neta de 300 soles semanales promedio. Pero como buena sampedrana, también se dedica a la venta de telares, que con mucho esfuerzo y creatividad teje, los cuales comercializa en el país de Ecuador, donde viaja 2 veces al mes. Además de aprovechar la temporada donde cosecha maca, que es una vez al año, que según sus propias palabras; “este año le fue muy bien”. Por ello más adelante está planeando surtir su negocio de tapices, con nuevos y variados dibujos, asimismo quiere innovar en el material de lanas.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de San Pedro” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios fardos de lana de 35 kilos, que oscila entre 10 soles cada kilo. Con esto podrá tejer los hermosos telares que realiza.
texts.en:
María, 38 years old, lives with her husband, Jesús. They have two children: Humberto and Jasmira. They live in their own house, located in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. Six years ago Maria, who is clever and very astute, opened her shop offering different colored wool, which she sells to the inhabitants of her town who weave items of clothing as well as tapestries. Her business is going well and she earns an average net profit of 300 soles weekly. However, as a good San Pedran, she also sells woven goods that she herself weaves with great effort and creativity. She markets her fabrics in Ecuador where she travels twice a month. In addition she takes advantage of the season to harvest maca (an indigenous root vegetable) once a year, which in her words “went very well this year.” Later, she is planning to stock her business with tapestries of new and varied designs. She also wants to innovate in woolen material.

Maria belongs to the “Corazon de San Pedro” communal bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP. She is very grateful for the help provided and promises to be punctual with her repayments. If she receives your support she will invest her loan in the purchase of several 35 kilo bundles of wool, which are about 10 soles per kilo. With this she will be able to weave the beautiful fabrics she makes.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of several 35 kilo bundles of wool, at about 10 soles a kilo, with which she will be able to weave her beautiful woven goods.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La señora Andrea se dedica a la venta de medicamentos naturales, se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace tres años y con la tienda de su propiedad desde hace un año cuenta con buena clientela ya que las personas ahora quieren utilizar medicamentos que no tengan químicos, vive en domicilio de sus padres donde vive con  su esposo y su hija de tres años solicita el crédito para la  compra de  mercadería y de esta forma surtir su tienda e incrementar su capital de trabajo, le va muy bien con la venta de estos productos, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superacion.
texts.en: Andrea has worked selling natural medicines for three years and has had a store for a year.  She has a good clientele, as people now want medications that do not contain chemicals.  She lives at her parent’s house with her husband and 3-year-old daughter.  She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, as well as to increase her working capital.  She does well selling these products and is a young woman with a great deal of desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
La señora Asunción D. 47 años D. edad, está casada con el Señor Pedro hace 32 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos D. 27, 25, 11 y 7 años respectivamente, todos viven en la casa D. los hijos mayores, trabajan y aportan en la casa y los dos hijos menores estudian en la escuela. El señor Pedro es Tornero, trabaja en forma independiente, posee su propio taller.
La señora Asunción tiene a su cargo la explotación D. un comedor en donD. da D. comer a todos los personales, choferes, y guardia D. seguridad D. una empresa D. transporte D. la zona. Ella comenta que se levanta a muy tempranas horas del día para preparar los menús del día, ya que implica un gran trabajo. Comenta que está muy feliz con su trabajo, pues por medio D. esto pueD. ayudar con los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. los ingredientes para la elaboración D. los alimentos del comedor, como ser carnes, lácteos, hortalizas y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Asunción is 47 years old and is married to 32-year-old Pedro, with whom she has four children who are 27, 25, 11 and 7 years old. They all live at their older children’s house; they work and contribute to the household. Their two younger children are in school. Pedro is a lathe operator and works independently, as he has his own workshop.

Asunción runs a restaurant where she serves all the personnel, drivers and security guards from a transportation company in the area. She mentions that she gets up very early to prepare the set menu for the day, as it requires a great deal of work. She says that she is very happy with her job since it allows her to help with the household expenses.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of ingredients to make food for the restaurant, such as meat, dairy products, vegetables and other items. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity provided to her, since receiving the loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, dairy products and other items to prepare meals.

loans.name: Blanca Libia

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer emprendedora que tras su separación se dio a la tarea de trabajar como independiente para salir adelante, desde entonces se ha dedicado a la venta de comidas rápidas fuera de su casa, lo que hasta ahora le ha permitido cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Actualmente Blanca necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos insumos como salsas, carnes frías y algunos platos y vasos desechables para vender sus productos, así podrá ofrecer mayor variedad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is an enterprising woman, who following her separation took on the task of working for herself in order to move ahead in life.  Since then, she has worked selling fast food from her home, which so far has allowed her to cover her household expenses.

Currently, Blanca needs a loan to buy several supplies, such as sauces, cold meats, and several disposable plates and cups for selling her products.  In this way she will be able to offer more variety and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sauces, cold meats and disposable plates and cups.

loans.name: Esther Yolanda

texts.es: Esther, de 29 años, convive con Rafael, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Maryory, Naomi y Alison de 3 meses de edad. Ellos viven en una casa alquilada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas.Está hermosa y creativa mujer, se dedica al arte publicitario, donde pinta letreros, a las diferentes instituciones y entidades del estado Peruano, de la misma manera pinta cuadros artísticos a base de pintura oleo, los cuales vende a un intermediario que lleva los hermosos cuadros al país de Educador, donde son apreciados y bien pagados. Pero como buena artesana, ella también teje tapices, con diferentes dibujos, los que comercializa a los turistas que visitan la zona. Además de ser una mujer emprendedora, pues también tienen una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Por todos los logros adquiridos, para más adelante desea abrir, un negocio de publicidad gráfica, donde pueda explayar todo el arte que posee. Para así brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde promete direccionar con empeño y empuje el progreso de sus integrantes, ya que es presidenta de su banco comunal. Además de agradecer el apoyo que le brindan. Esther de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una máquina que le ayude a perforar los tableros publicitarios que pinta, además de comprar panaflex (especie de tela para pintar), para pintar los lindos cuadros que realiza.
texts.en: Esther is 29 years old and lives with her husband, Rafael, with whom she has three children: Maryory, Naomi and Alison, who is 3 months old.  They live in a rented house in San Pedro de Cajas.  This beautiful and creative woman works in commercial art, painting signs for different Peruvian institutions and entities.  In addition, she does oil paintings which she sells to an intermediary who then brings her beautiful paintings to Ecuador where they are valued and sell at a good price.  As any good artisan, however, she also weaves tapestries using different designs which she sells to tourists visiting the area.  In addition to being an enterprising woman, she also has a grocery store where she sells basic needs items.  Due to her achievements thus far, she wants to open a graphic arts business in the future where she can display all the art she has to thus provide her family with a better quality of life.  She is a member of the Corazón de San Pedro Communal Bank and this is her third loan with MFP, where she promises to work hard and encourage her fellow group members’ progress, as she is president of her communal bank.  In addition to being grateful for the support, upon receiving her loan, Esther will invest the money requested in the purchase of a machine that will help her to puncture the commercial panels she paints, as well as Panaflex (a type of fabric to paint) to make her beautiful paintings.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a machine that will help her to puncture the commercial panels she paints, as well as Panaflex (a type of fabric to paint) to make her beautiful paintings.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es: La señora Vanessa quien pertenece al ALCOM EL TRIUNFO, es natural D. Carabayllo tiene 25 años y es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos uno D. 07 años y el otro D. 10 meses, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza. Empezo poco a poco, al inicio era ayudante D. ventas y cuando ya tuvo sus clientes fijos se inscribio directamente, con este negocio a logrado apoyar a su pareja y tambien a ido creciendo sus ventas. Su deseo es poder tener una tienda granD. en donD. pueda vender todos sus productos D. belleza. El prestamo lo utilizara para la compra D. mas productos D. belleza.
texts.en: Vanessa, who is a member of the El Triunfo Group, is a native of Carabayllo, is 25 years old, and has a live-partner.  She has two children who are 7 years old and 10 months old, and works selling beauty products.  She began little by little and at the beginning, she was a sales assistant.  However, once she had regular customers, she registered herself.  With this business, she has been able to support her partner and she has also been increasing sales.  She wants to be able to have a large store where she can sell all of her beauty products.  She will use the loan for the purchase of more beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es: El señor Juan dedicado al servicio de transporte y también se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos junto a su esposa, de esta manera también  aprovechan el carro que tienen en este momento para entregar los artefactos que piden los clientes, llevando a su domicilio y cobrando cada mes una parte de del precio total acordado , ambos uniendo fuerzas y con mucho empeño realizan este negocio para sobrellevar la vida en este momento que todos los víveres incrementaron en un 50% , dar una buena educación a su pequeño hijo y llevar una vida modesta, siempre pensando en que algún día no muy lejano abrirán una comercial donde los precios no serán tan elevados como en las demás ese es el deseo del Señor Juan.
texts.en: Juan works providing transportation services, as well as selling electrical appliances with his wife.  This way, they take advantage of the car they currently have in order to deliver the appliances requested by customers.  They bring the appliances to their customers’ homes and each month, they collect a part of the established full price.  They join efforts and now that all supplies increased 50%, they put a lot of work into this business in order to get by so that they can provide their young son with a good education and live a modest life.  Someday in the not-too-distant future, Juan’s desire is to open a store where the prices will not be as high as other stores.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances.

loans.name: Las Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Chicas Super Poderosas se originó a través de promociones  que se hicieron la ciudad de San Ignacio. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del lugar. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
Ellas se definen como mujeres muy emprendedoras, trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy sacrificadas. Desean un futuro mejor para sus familias y es por eso que luchan día a día por la consecución de sus objetivos.
La señora Cynthia se dedica a la venta de ropa, con lo cual obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos que surgen en la casa. Tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre le solicitan todo tipo de ropas, le gustaría poder, algún día, tener un local donde exhibir todas las prendas que posee. En esta temporada de invierno ha recibido muchas demandas de abrigos, por lo que le gustaría comprar más prendas para ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de invierno, con lo cual podrá hacer frente a la demanda. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito.
texts.en:
The Las Chicas Super Poderosas [The Supergirls] Committee got started as a result of promotions that were done in the city of San Ignacio.  All the members are from the same area and are friends and neighbors.  The goal of each one of them is to work, promote the spirit of togetherness and make it to the highest level of the program.

They think of themselves as very enterprising, hard-working, and above all, very selfless women.  They want a better future for their families, which is why they struggle day after day.  

Cynthia makes her living selling clothing so she can earn enough to cover household expenses.  She has well established clientele that are always asking for all kinds of clothing.  One day, Cynthia would like to have a shop where she can display all her goods.  This winter she has gotten a lot of requests for coats so she'd like to buy more product to offer her customers.

Cynthia is seeking a loan to buy winter clothing to meet demand.  She is very hopeful about getting the loan.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is one of the members of the Group La Esperanza 1 & 2 (Hope), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. Altagracia sells all kind of fruits in a little stall next to her house. After two loans with Esperanza, she expanded has expanded her business. Now she is receiving her third loan.

With this new loan, she is planning to inveS.in more fruit and make some changes to her stand. She wants to attract more customers. She tells us that her challenge is to help her 3 children to grow with health and education, also to help her long-term partner by working hard and bringing extra income to their home. 

Altagracia´s dreams are to improve their lives with a better home, grow a bigger and sustainable business, and to see all her children become professionals and good people. She is planning to reinveS.her profits in the business and save. She wants to start building her house.

She thanks all of you for your support!!

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Rosalia 	Angelica

texts.es: La señora Rosalía es una joven clienta que vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija, viven en la casa de su mama donde tienen  su tienda de barrio donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, esta en buena ubicación por tal motivo es muy concurrida y la señora quiere aumentar y mejorar su capital con el cual trabaja y  la compra de mercadería para así surtir aun mas su tienda por este motivo solicito el crédito, su mama prácticamente le heredara la vivienda donde vive y con el tiempo ella quiere hacer construir una cancha de wali su sueño es tener su casa propia y hacerla construir para darles la comodidad que necesita su familia, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superación.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalía is a young client.   She lives with her husband and young daughter in her mother's house where they have a neighborhood store that offers a variety of basic necessity products.  It is located in a very busy location and Señora Rosalía wants to increase and improve her working capital by buying merchandise to stock her store even more.  

For this reason she is requesting a loan.  Her mother practically inherited the house where she lives and in time she wants to build a Wally court [a type of volleyball in Bolivia].  Her dream is to have her own house and to construct it with her family's comfort in mind.  She is a young person with a great desire to excel.

loans.use: purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Juan Roberto

texts.es: Juan, de 36 años, está casado con Delia. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que cría y educa en una casa alquilada la cual esta ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas.Los principales tejidos de Juan se basa en; tapices, mantas, gorras, ponchos. Desde que tenía 13 años, comenzó a descubrir las técnicas del tejido y bordados, los cuales gracias a su persistencia y creatividad, los comercializa a buen precio en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde viaja 2 veces al mes. Los momentos que más le gusta a Juan, son los días que comercializa sus tejidos, pues ve cristalizado los días y las noches de esfuerzo y trabajo. Según cuenta, al mes teje un promedio de 18 a 20 frazadas, donde gasta 5 kilos de dralón (variedad de lana). Además de trabajar en la ciudad de Oroya, donde realiza la pavimentación de pistas y veredas; ahí obtiene una ganancia extra. Ahora esté emprendedor joven desea, proyectar sus ingresos en la ampliación de su taller, invirtiendo en la compra de más telares, con los que pueda aumentar la cantidad de sus tejidos.Él pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente satisfecho con el trabajo realizado. Además de agradecer la oportunidad de progreso que le brindan. Juan de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 20 a 30 kilos de dralón (variedad de lana) a modo de inversión, con ello tejerá las hermosas frazadas que realiza.
texts.en: Juan is 36 years old. He is married to Delia. Together they have 5 children, all of them not yet adults, whom they raise and educate in a rented house located in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. Juan's main woven items are tapestries, blankets, hats and ponchos. When he was 13 years old, he started to discover the techniques of weaving and embroidery. Thanks to his persistence and creativity, he sells his weavings for a good price in the city of Huancayo, where he travels twice a month. The times that Juan enjoys most are the days when he sells his weavings, because he sees the concrete results of the days and nights of work and effort. He reports that each month he weaves an average of 18 to 20 blankets, using 5 kilos of dralon (a type of fiber). In addition, he works in the city of Oroya, where he installs pavement on paths and sidewalks, providing him with extra earnings. Now this enterprising young man would like to increase his income by expanding his workshop, investing in buying more looms which will allow him to produce more weavings. He belongs to the “Corazón de San Pedro” ["Heart of Saint Peter"] communal bank, and this is his second loan with MFP. He feels satisfied with the work being done there, and he is also grateful for the opportunity for progress that they provide him. Upon receiving his support, he will invest the funds he is requesting in buying 20 to 30 kilos of dralon (a type of fiber), as an investment, and he will use it to weave the beautiful blankets that he makes.

loans.use: to invest in 20 to 30 kilos of dralon (a type of fiber).

loans.name: Mujeres Sobresalientes Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inició gracias a una de las miembros, la misma contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona. El comité se denomina Mujeres Sobresalientes, actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, con 18 miembros. Todas ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que buscan el bienestar de sus familias.
La señora Hilda es una mujer muy sencilla, responsable, honesta y muy luchadora, está casada con el señor Francisco, quien se dedica a la fabricación de baldosas, tienen 4 hijos, todos dependientes de ellos. La Señora Hilda se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace ya muchos años, está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto, además por medio de esto puede ayudar a su marido en los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de temporada para la satisfacción de la demanda de sus clientes. agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The present committee was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members who contacted her neighbors and friends to form a committee in the zone.  The committee is called “Mujeres Sobresalientes” (Outstanding Women) and it’s currently in its second cycle with 18 members.  They all define themselves as hardworking, tenacious women seeking the wellbeing of their families.

Hilda is a very unassuming, responsible, honest and very tenacious woman.  She’ married to Francisco who manufactures paving stones.  They have four dependent children.  Hilda has been selling clothes for many years now.  She is very proud of what she does because it’s an honorable, proper job.  Besides, through it she’s able to help her husband cover household expenses.

She is asking for the loan to buy seasonal clothes to meet customer demand.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it’s giving her because getting the loan will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Nelva Marisol

texts.es: Nelva, de 38 años, está casada hace 15 años con Luis. Ambos tienen una hija, Guisel a la que quieren y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Ella es una mujer con iniciativa y empuje; hace tan solo 6 meses comenzó con la venta de petróleo y gasolina, en la calle principal de su localidad, donde alquiló un pequeño espacio. Según cuenta vende un promedio de S/. 480 nuevos soles como máximo, ya que no existen muchos grifos en la zona. Además de aprovechar sus tiempos libres en tejer pequeñas gorras de lana, que comercializa a los intermediarios que la visitan constantemente. Pero su principal objetivo es consolidar una empresa de trasportes, para ello está tramitando todos los papeles legales, además de comenzar con 6 carros, para seguir las rutas de la ciudad de Tarma-San Pedro de Cajas, San Pedro de Cajas-Las Vegas. Ya le falta muy poco para lograr su objetivo, pues con los 2 carros que posee y los que resta conseguir espera emprender este negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para concretar sus planes. Razón por la que promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Nelva de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 cilindros de golosina y petróleo, para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelva, 38, has been married to Luis for 15 years.  They have a daughter, Guisel, who they love and educate in their own home located in San Pedro de Cajas.  She is a woman with initiative and drive.  Just six months ago she started selling petroleum and gasoline on her town’s main street where she rented a small space.  According to what she relates, she sells an average of 480 new soles maximum because there aren’t many gas pumps in the area.  In addition, she takes advantage of her free time to knit small wool caps that she sells to middlemen who visit constantly.  But, her main objective is to set up a transportation firm and she’s in the process of making all the legal transactions necessary.  She wants to start with six cars to cover the Tarma-San Pedro de Cajas and the San Pedro de Cajas-Las Vegas routes.  She’s very close to reaching her objective because with the two cars she already has and the rest she expects to get she hopes to start this business.

She’s a member of the “Corazón de San Pedro” (San Pedro’s Heart) communal bank and this is her first MFP loan where she expects a small loan to realize her plans which is the reason behind her pledge to repay her installments punctually.  

If Nelva were to receive your support, she will use the requested funds to buy two gasoline cylinders and petroleum to supply her customers.

loans.use: to buy two gas cylinders and petroleum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large number of perfumes.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Señor Sergio es casado, se dedica a la reparación de autos y chapería desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Repara los autos de la mayoría de sus vecinos, por lo que se ha hecho de muy buena fama y reputación. Por medio de su buena atención ha logrado crearse una buena cantidad de clientes. Manifiesta que su oficio le genera muy buenos ingresos.
El comenta que gracias a la ayuda de su esposa e hijos logran progresar cada día, uno de sus sueños es poder tener un tinglado donde pueda tener almacenar mas cantidad de vehículos. Todo lo que el realiza es por darle a su esposa e hijos un futuro digno y un mejor estilo de vida.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para autos que va a utilizar en su taller de autos. Está muy esperanzado en el crédito, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sergio is married and has worked in auto repair and bodywork for quite some time. He repairs the majority of his neighbors’ cars, which is why he has become well known and has a good reputation. As a result of his good service, he has been able to generate a good amount of customers. He says that his work provides him with a good income.

He mentions that thanks to the help of his wife and children, they are able to progress each day. One of his dreams is to be able to have a shed where he can store more vehicles. Everything he does is to provide his wife and children with a decent future and a better quality of life.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of spare auto parts to use at his auto repair shop. He is very hopeful for the loan, as it will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to use at his shop.

loans.name: Esther Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos  se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Esther, ella tiene 34 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 9 y 5 años de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella ya que la mayor ya está comprometida, dos de sus hijos estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que para ayudar a su esposo con la dura tarea de  mantener el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y edredones, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta ya que recorre por toda la ciudad con su mercadería, la mayor parte de sus ventas son bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja tres días a la semana, ella deja a crédito  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita.  Empezó con su negocio desde que ingreso al banco comunal y nos cuenta que a pesar de la competencia le va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, sabanas y edredones. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
Jaime Roldos Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Canton of Jaramijo. This location is known for its scenic beaches that cover the coasts of this beautiful area. The majority of the residents there are very hardworking and are in fishing.

Esther lives in this area and is 34 years old, married, and has four children who are 17, 15, 9 and 5 years old. Three of their children still live with them and the oldest is engaged. Two of their children are in elementary school. Her husband works as a fisherman.

She is a very hardworking woman and in order to help her husband with the challenging task of supporting the family, she works selling all types of clothing, sheets and comforters. She makes her sales door to door and travels all around the city with her merchandise. The majority of her sales are from orders placed by her customers. She works three days per week, selling on credit and collecting payments every eight days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise whenever she needs to. She started her business upon joining the communal bank and says that it is going well despite competition.

This loan is for the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, sheets and comforters. She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the support the loans provide.

Her dream is to continue moving forward in life and in her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Don Santiago tiene 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Paraguarí y está acompañado con la Señora América hace aproximadamente 25 años. Don Santiago se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cerdos y vacas  en su propiedad, comenta que es un trabajo que lleva realizando por más de 30 años.
Comenta que todo el trabajo que realiza es muy sacrificado ya que implica mucho trabajo y cuidado, pues los animales que cría necesitan de constantes cuidados. Sueña con poder duplicar la cantidad de animales que tiene, para de esa forma generar un poco más de ingresos para la casa.
El señor solicita el crédito para la compra de más animales para la cría y posterior venta. Manifiesta que de obtener el crédito, este le será de mucha utilidad. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Santiago is 58 years old and lives in the city of Paraguarí. He has been with América for around 25 years. Santiago works raising chickens, pigs and cows on his property. He mentions that he has been doing this job for over 30 years.

He says that all of his work requires a great deal of sacrifice, which means that it entails a lot of work and care as the animals require constant care. He dreams of being able to double the number of animals he has in order to earn more for his household.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of more animals to raise and later sell. He says that the loan will be of great use to him and he is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity it has provided him.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es: Elio es un joven trabajador  y responsable vive en la urbanización virgen de la merced, vive con su papá y su hermana   y su mamá que  se encuentra por razones de trabajo en España hace poco retorno, pero por trabajo tuvo que retornar, Elio ya tiene su propio vehículo con el cual trabaja en una línea de taxi trufis, anteriormente estaba trabajando en el radio taxi por ser mas conveniente cambio, de línea el ayuda económicamente a su hermana que estudia en la universidad católica  por otro lado el también pasa clases por las noches, actualmente el solicita el crédito para el cambio de caja para su vehículo, el deseo del Joven Elio es el de terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Elio is a hardworking and responsible young man.  He lives in the Virgen de la Merced housing development with his father and sister.  His mother is currently working in Spain.  She returned shortly ago, but had to go back for work.  Elio has his own vehicle which he uses as a ‘trufi’ (a taxi with a fixed route).  He previously worked as a radio taxi but changed companies due to convenience.  He helps his sister out financially who is a student at Universidad Católica, and he also takes classes at night.  He is currently requesting a loan for a gearbox for his car.  Elio wants to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy a gearbox for his car.

loans.name: Bella Virginia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora Bella es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos  recibe mucha ayuda para salir adelante. Tiene 52 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, algunos están comprometidos pero aun viven en su casa, una de sus hijos sufre de diabetes al igual que su esposo el cual ya no trabaja.

Ella para ganarse su sustento diario y así con esto sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de fundas de hielo y helados los mismos que prepara o compra en una fábrica de la localidad, este pequeño negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace varios años y es con esto que se ha ayudado para salir adelante y mucho mas después de la enfermedad de su esposo lo cual es muy duro de llevar.
 
Este crédito es para comprar fundas plásticas y helados para la venta diaria.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante luchando día a día y que su hija y esposo se mejoren de sus enfermedades.
texts.en:
The “Jaime Roldos” communal bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton.  This place is famous for the beautiful beaches that bathe its coasts.  Most residents here are very hardworking and dedicated to tasks related to the sea.

Bella is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she gets a lot of help form the loans to get ahead.  She’s 52 years old, married and has six children who are all adults now.  Some are engaged but still living at home.  One of her sons has diabetes and so does her husband who no longer works.

To earn daily sustenance and move her family forward she sells bags of ice and ice cream that she either makes herself or buys at a local factory.  She’s had this small, home-based business for several years now and she’s used it to help get ahead and even more so since her husband’s illness which has been very difficult to overcome.

This loan is to buy plastic bags and ice-cream for her daily sales.  Her dreams are to continue struggling daily and that her daughter and husband recover from their illnesses.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream and plastic bags.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Manana 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Bibiana is the coordinator of her group "Trabajando para el Manana" 1, 2 & 3 (Working for tomorrow). Bibiana is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 3 years, starting to work out of her house after her partner in love gave her money to start her business. She plans to use this loan to buy ingredients like meat, flour, seasoning, cooking oil, vegetables and a gas oven for her "empanada" sales business. An empanada is a round of flour filled with meat or vegetables and fried, a popular snack or food. 

Bibiana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 4 children. She says that her biggest challenge is to help her children to become professionals. She said her most favorite activities are attending to her family and spending great moments with them. Her challenges are to develop her business, to proviD. extra income for her family, and to save. She says, "with all of this I will be giving steps forward to make change for me and my family future. Thank you all for helping me to improve my family´s life, myself and all the members from this group!!!"  Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Samana. 

The group pictures are separated to show as many faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, flour, seasoning, cooking oil, vegetables and a gas oven

loans.name: Jessenia Patricia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 24 años,  mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años el mismo que es la razón de su vida. El marido se dedica a las faenas del mar.
 
Ella al ver que los gastos cada vez eran más grandes y que a su marido no le alcanzaba con lo que ganaba hace tres años emprendió un negocio, al principio empezó con la venta de zapatos, zapatillas y sabanas pero después con el paso del tiempo fue aumentado su negocio y ahora también vende pañales desechables, bebidas,  sodas, energizantes entre otras cosas, esto lo realiza en su casa en la cual tiene un pequeño local aunque de vez en cuando también se va a ofrecer de puerta en puerta sus productos. Ella gracias a los créditos ha podido ir aumentando su negocio. 

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, sabanas, zapatillas, energizantes, sodas y otros productos que vende en su local. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la tesorera y le gustan las charlas educativas y porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jessenia, 24, lives here.   She’s in a common law relationship and has a three-year-old son who is her reason for living.  Her husband does sea-related tasks.

Seeing that expenses were higher every month and that what her husband earned did not suffice, she started a business three years ago.  At first, she started out selling shoes, sandals and sheets but as time went by she started adding to the business and now she also sells disposable diapers, beverages, soft-drinks and energy drinks, among other things.  She does this from home where she has a small locale although sometimes she also goes out to sell her products door to door.  Thanks to the loans she’s been able to gradually enlarge her business.

This loan is to buy shoes, sheets, sandals, energy drinks, soft-drinks and other products that she sells in her store.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and is its Treasurer; she enjoys the educational chats and likes that the group is very united.  Her dream is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Francisca Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora Francisca es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la Fundación Espoir con los créditos. Tiene 63 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y aún viven con ella.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida desde hace 12 años emprendió un pequeño negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda  en su casa, además de víveres también vende cosas de bazar, helados que algunas veces ella misma prepara o que compra en una fábrica de la localidad, allí trabaja todos los días, empezó con poco y que con el paso del tiempo la  ha ido mejorando y mucho mas después que empezó a  recibir los créditos ya que estos le han ayudado mucho.

Este crédito es para surtir aun mas su tienda, quiere comprar varios quintales de arroz y azúcar así como también bisutería y artículos de bazar.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud ya que esto es lo más importante.
texts.en:
The “Jaime Roldos” communal bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton.  This place is famous for the beautiful beaches that bathe its coasts.  Most residents here are very hardworking and dedicated to tasks related to the sea.

Francisca is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the help she gets from Fundación Espoir with the loans.  She’s 63 years old and her husband died several years ago but she has five children who are all adults now and still live with her.

To earn a living, our friend started a small business 12 years ago.  She has a small, home-based store where besides selling foodstuffs she also sells kitchenware and ice-cream that she makes herself or sometimes buys from a local factory.  She works there every day.  She started out with very little and in time has been improving it and even more so once she started to receive the loans which have been of great help to her.

This loan is to stock the store even more.  She wants to buy several quintals of rice and sugar as well as costume jewelry and kitchenware.  Her dreams are to continue making progress and to enjoy good health which is most important.

loans.use: to buy quintals of rice and sugar and to buy costume jewelry and kitchenware.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix vive en la zona de bajo Huayrapata su familia integra de su esposa Leticia y sus dos hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar, el trabaja con su vehículo trasportando materiales de construcción, y su esposa trabaja en una tienda que se encarga de vender medias deportivas como encargada de ventas, ambos aportan a la familia, el sr.  Félix como padre responsable se encarga también en llevar y recoger a sus hijas ya el trabajo de la esposa le impide hacerlo. Él necesita el préstamo de dinero para la reparación de su vehículo ya que para esta reparación tiene que comprar una nueva caja, motivo por el cual se pide el financiamiento con la institución.
texts.en:
Félix lives in the Bajo Huayrapata zone.  His family consists of his wife, Leticia, and their two daughters who are school age.  He works with his vehicle transporting building materials.  His wife is employed as a salesperson in a store selling athletic socks.  They both share the family’s support. Félix, as a responsible father, is also in charge of taking his daughters to school and picking them up since his wife can’t do it because of work.  

He needs this loan to repair his vehicle because he needs to buy a new transmission for this repair and this is why he’s asking the institution for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a transmission and for general maintenance.

loans.name: María Jacqueline

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos  se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de  22, 16, 12, 11 y 4 años  de edad, uno de sus hijos estudian en escuela y todos viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace tres años atrás emprendió un pequeño negocio, ella tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan cuando ellos pueden. Ella con la ayuda de los créditos espera ir mejorando en su negocio con el pasar del tiempo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le han sido de gran ayuda.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Jaime Roldos” communal bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton.  This place is famous for the beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Most of its residents are very hardworking and dedicated to tasks related to the sea.

María, 40, lives here.  She’s married and has five children who are 22, 16, 12, 11 and 4 years old.  Some of her children go to school and all of them still live with her.  Her husband’s a fisherman.

She is a very good housewife who, wanting to help her husband cover household expenses, three years ago started a small business.  She has a small, home-based grocery store where she sells all sorts of products like: rice, sugar, oil and detergent, among others.  She works daily from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her when they can.  With help from the loans she hopes to gradually improve the business over time.

She will use this loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic need items.  She’s been in the communal bank for five cycles and she likes it because the loans have been of great help to her.  Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nayla Johanna

texts.es:
Nayla de 32 años camina mucho ofreciendo su mercadería, ella recorre todos los dias de 7:00 am a 20:00,  vende ropa de damas, caballeros y niños con la dificultad que amenaza a su barrio que es la delincuencia y la competencia aunque piensa que para todos hay mercado.Su esposo Edicto es albañil pero cuando la demanda está baja se dedica a hacer fletes en su camioneta, tienen 2 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela, los que dice son su orgullo.
Ellos quieren comprar cemento, hierro y fierro para terminar de construir su casa que es mixta, motivo por el requieren un préstamo para seguir con su negocio y hacerles un dormitorio a cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nayla, 32, walks a lot to sell her merchandise.  She wanders daily from 7am until 8pm.  She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes despite her neighborhood’s high crime rate and competition, although she believes that there’s market enough for everyone.  Her husband’s a bricklayer but when demand is low he does delivery services with his truck.  They have two children going to school and she says that they are her pride.

They want to buy cement, iron rods and metal to finish building their house, which is mixed, which is the reason why they need a loan to stay in business and to build bedrooms for each of their children.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron rods and metal.

loans.name: Obdulia Maria

texts.es: Obdulía deseaba tener un negocio pero en su propia casa, y con el cual poder atender a sus hijos, ella sabía coser pero no le abastecía los ingresos de esta actividad. Así es que ahorró algo de dinero y decidió poner un negocio de Venta de bebidas como jugos, colas y helados. Su trabajo lo realiza en horario de 8:00 a 6:00 pm sin ayuda ya que sys hijos son mayores de edad  y cada cual realizan sus actividades. Lo que mas quiere es ver su casa terminada y por eso solcitará un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Obdulia wanted to have a home-based business so that she could watch her children.  She knew how to sew but that activity didn’t quite produce enough income so she saved up a bit of money and decided to start selling beverages like juices, colas and ice-cream.  She works from 8am until 6pm without any help because her children are all adults now and each does his own thing.  What she most wants is to see her house finished and this is why she’s asking for a loan to buy building materials to reach this goal.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Edgar Patricio

texts.es:
Hace 11 años Edgar empezó con la venta de cd y solo hace 3 se asoció a ASECOPAC del Mies con los cinestas ecuatorianos, les gusta mucho su negocio ya que con la asociación crearon una película y actualmente vende los cd originales. Por eso recalca su gusto por este negocio ya que le agradan los temas de películas y videos.

El trabaja en el centro de Progreso (localidad de Playas Villamil- Guayaquil), en las afueras de una escuela, hace su trabajo desde las 7h00am hasta las 6h00pm junto a su esposa, a veces viaja a Libertad por cuestiones de reuniones o inversiones de su negocio.

Indica que aún no ha tenido dificultades que le impidan hacer su trabajo, él está casado con Verónica quien se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y a cuidar a su hijo de 5 años, aunque tienen otra niña de 12 años la cual es cuidada por su abuelita que vive en libertad.
Edgar está necesitando un préstamo para comprar una copiadora de cd originales Y así ahorrar mucho con lo cual establecer un gran local de cd originales de artistas ecuatorianos, además tener una casa grande para poder vivir feliz con su familia.
texts.en:
Edgar started selling CDs eleven years ago and three years ago joined ASECOPAC (Ecuadorean Audiovisual Products Merchants and Mutual Aid Association) with Ecuadorean filmmakers.  He likes his business very much because together with the Association they made a film and he sells the original CDs.  He stresses that he enjoys his business because he likes movies and videos.

He works in downtown Progreso (a locality in Playas Villamil-Guayaquil) outside a school.  He works from 7am until 6pm together with his wife.  Sometimes he travels to Libertad for meetings or business-related investments.

He indicates that he’s had no difficulties that have kept him from doing his work.  He is married to Verónica who does domestic chores and cares for their five-year-old son although they also have a 12-year-old daughter who is cared for by her grandmother who lives in Libertad.

Edgar needs a loan to buy a CD copier.  With it he will be able to save quite a bit and be able to set up a large store with original CDs from Ecuadorean artists as well as to have a large house to be able to live happily in with his family.

loans.use: to buy a CD copier.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
La señora Timotea tiene ya más de once años dedicándose a su negocio de belleza. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar  equipo más moderno (sillones y espejos) y  cosméticos de belleza como es (maquillaje, sombras de colores para los ojos, labiales, lápiz labial, tratamientos para el cabello y tintes para el cabellos) y así también tener a la venta estos productos ya que sus cliente le están solicitando. 
Doña Timotea es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad dos de ellos están estudiando la preparatoria y el mas pequeño es en la primaria, desea que sus niños tengan el estudio necesario para que puedan salir adelante en su vida futura. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio pagara el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Quiere mejorar el negocio para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y así la puedan recomendar con otras personas.
texts.en:
Timotea has operated her beauty salon for more than eleven years already. 
 
She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more modern equipment (chairs and mirrors), as well as beauty products such as makeup, eyeshadows in different colors, lipsticks, hair treatments and hair dyes. She will also have these products for sale, since her customers are asking for them. 

Timotea is a single mother with three children in her care. Two of them are studying in secondary school, and the youngest is in primary school. She wants her children to have the education they need to get ahead in their future lives. 

She will pay off the loan with part of the earnings she obtains from her business, since this is the source of income she has for her family. She would like to improve her business to provide better service to her customers, and thus they will recommend her salon to other people.

loans.use: to buy professional equipment and beauty products.

loans.name: María Asunción

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
La Señora María tiene 65 años, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 12 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, vive con dos nietos quienes trabajan y le hacen compañía, su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad. 

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, cría y vende vacas, borregos, cuyes, gallinas y lleva 10 años en este negocio.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y pollos para continuar con su negocio.

Su meta es tener más vacas para vender la leche.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir [New Future] community bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish.  It has a cold climate and charismatic, friendly people who maintain their culture and tradition. They work raising animals and farming. 
 
María is 65 years old. She is married and has 12 children, all of whom are adults. She lives with two grandchildren who work and keep her company. Her husband works in agriculture and she owns the house she lives in. 

María works in agriculture. She raises and sells cows, sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens. She has done this for 10 years.

She has been a member of the community bank for 13 years. She is going to invest the money from the loan in buying pigs and chickens to continue her business.   

Her goal is to have more cows to sell milk.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: María Guillermina

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
Doña María tiene 60 años, es casada y ha concebido 7 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados, dos están en la universidad y tres de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan en la economía del hogar. Su esposo labora como latonero (enderezada de latas vehículos), labora en su taller propio,  la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de comida, esta actividad  la realiza hace 20 años, labora todos los días sin un horario fijo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y cerdos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 15 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ollas, licuadora, cubiertos y más productos para su negocio de comida.
 
Su meta es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir Communal Bank.  She lives in the Cumbe parish.  This place has a cold climate, its people are very charismatic and friendly, and they maintain their culture and traditions.  They are merchants, they raise animals, and they farm.

María, age 60, is married and has seven children.  Two of her children are married, two are in the university, and three of them work and help her with the household finances.  Her husband works doing auto body repair.  He works in his own shop.  The house they live in is their own.

María has been selling food for 20 years.  She works every day without a fixed schedule.  She raises guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs at home.

She has been in her communal bank for 15 years.  She will use her new loan to buy pots, a blender, cutlery, and other products for her food business.

Her goal is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy pots, a blender, and cutlery, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
La Señora Rosa tiene 54 años, es viuda en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 25, 24, 23, 20 años de edad, dos de sus hijos estudian en la universidad, una es casada e  independiente, otro trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Rosa labora en un restaurante que es de su propiedad, esta actividad la realiza hace 25 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. También se dedica a la cría de cerdos, cuyes y gallinas.
 
En el banco comunal es socia fundadora encontrándose más de 15 años en el mismo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  ollas, vajillas, cubiertos y otros productos para su negocio de comida.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir [New Future] community bank. She lives in the parish of Cumbe. It has a cold climate and charismatic, friendly people who maintain their culture and traditions. They work as merchants and in farming and raising animals.
 
Rosa is 54 years old. She is a widow and a mother of 4 children, aged 25, 24, 23, and 20. Two of her children go to college, one is married and on her own, and another works and helps her financially. She owns the house she lives in.   
 
Rosa works in a restaurant that she owns. She has done this for 25 years. She works every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. She also raises pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.  
 
She is a founding member of her community bank and has belonged to it for more than 15 years. She will invest the money from the loan in buying pots, dishes, cutlery and other products for her food business.   

Her goal is to keep growing the business.

loans.use: to buy pots, dishes, cutlery, etc.

loans.name: El Camino Del Exito Group

texts.es: L. SRA JUANA D. 35 AÑOS D. EDAD,CONVIVIENTE ,CON  UN HIJO  EN ETAPA ESCOLAR,ES SOCIA D. GRUPO EL CAMINO DEL EXITO.L. SRA JUANA EN L. ACTUALIDAD SE DEDICA  A L. PREPARACION D.  DIFERENTES PLATOS TIPICOS  D. L. REGION ,PARA L. PREPARACION D. ESTOS ALIMENTOS  SE TIENE QUE LEVANTAR MUY TEMPRANO ,PARA LUEGO VENDERLOS  EN  L. CALLE . L. SRA JUANA SOLICITO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA PODER  COMPRAR UNA REFRIGERADORA .ELL. QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO  PODER  CONTAR  CON SU PROPIO RESTAURANTE  EN UN LUGAR ADECUADO PARA ASI PODER TENER MAS INGRESOS Y ASI PODER SACAR PROFESIONALES  A SU HIJO MENOR .L. SRA JUANA SE ENCUENTRA  SENTADA UBICADO A LADO IZQUIERDO ,JUNTO A L. SRA QUE VISTE UN POLO COLOR ROSADO Y BUZO CELESTE .L. SRA JUANA VISTE UN POLO COLOR BLANCO Y VERD.  ,UN CHALECO COLOR VERD. CLARO Y UN PANTALON JEANS
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has a son who is of school age. She is a member of the group “El Camino Del Éxito” (The Road to Success). Sra. Juana currently prepares different dishes that are traditional to the region. In order to prepare these foods, she must wake up very early so that she can sell them on the street.

Sra. Juana is requesting this loan so that she can buy a refrigerator. In the future, she wants to open her own restaurant in a suitable place that will allow her to generate more income. She also wants her young son to become a professional.

In the photograph, Sra. Juana is seated on the left-hand siD. next to the woman wearing a pink shirt and a light blue sweater. Sra. Juana can be seen wearing a white and green shirt, a light green vest, and jeans.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosanna is 38 years old and has 5 children who are in school.

Rosanna has an arts (framing crucifix) business in the Philippines. Rosanna has requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her crucifix framing business.

Rosanna has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Rosanna would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her crucifix framing business.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
To alleviate poverty, Adelina works hard to generate income. She is 43 years old and has 3 school-age children. She engages in vegetable vending while her husband manages their farm land. She has been in the business for almost 15 years now and usually earns a net profit of 7,000 PHP a month. Her income goes to supporting the family's needs and for the school fees of their children.

Adelina wants to improve the business in order to increase her income so she can continuously send their children to school and save for future emergencies. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy tomatoes, onions, beans, cabbage and carrots to sell in their village. She believes that her patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, beans, cabbage, squash and carrots to sell in the village

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 51 years old and married with 1 child.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Variety Store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Milagros has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Variety Store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Milagros aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her child to college and buy land.

loans.use: to purchase more variety store items to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her snack foods business.

Josephine has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from selling jewelries.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack foods business.

loans.name: Clemencita  Group

texts.en:
Clemencita is 52 years old, married, and has two children.  They live in the Philippines.  Clemencita is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She is requesting a loan for 14,000 PHP to purchase feed for pigs. Clemencita has been a member of PMPC for one year. 

Clemencita is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase feedsfor pigs.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 37 years old and has four children. Eusebia is married and has three children who are in school.

Eusebia is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Eusebia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eusebia has been farming vegetables for 6 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eusebia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. Emily is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Emily has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft-drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Emily has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Emily would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soft-drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Irilee

texts.en: Irilee is 35 years old, married, and has two children.  They live in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental.  Irilee sells  shampoo, soap, canned goods, and noodles to earn a living. She has had this business for two years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell .  Irilee has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Irilee hopes to have a bigger grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, a 56-year-old mother of four grown children, believes that "strong faith and determination" will make it possible for her to achieve her goals. The operator of a dress-making business for almost 10 years to generate additional income for the family, Merlita usually earns a monthly profit of P7,000 which she uses for food, clothing and allowances for the children.

Now requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy threads, needles, textiles and other materials needed in making dresses, Merlita hopes that she will be successful in working out her business plan. She aims to improve her enterprise to earn a higher income in order to reinvest it and renovate their house to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles and textiles for dress-making.

loans.name: Toquero Luzviminda Group

texts.en:
Luzviminda, a 48-year-old married mother of three, lives in Dumingag where she has been selling a variety of products to earn a living for 10 years, earning a monthly profit of PHP 3000. A member of PMPC for two years, she has requested a loan of PHP 14000 to purchase more products for her general store.

Luzviminda is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 54 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Bolibol,Oroquieta City. To earn a living, Gloria has a business selling snacks. She earns about 3,000 PHP a month. Gloria is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks. Gloria has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snacks.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs. Han is 40 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has three children. She lives in her own home in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Because she lives in an urban zone, she has basic water and electricity services. Mrs. Han has a store in her home. There she sells various daily use products, such as basic staples and groceries, to her neighbors. She has a fixed and loyal customer base. She also sells beauty products from a catalogue, which she sells in her home and by traveling to various nearby hamlets. Thanks to these businesses, she has been able to help her husband and children maintain the family and get ahead. 

Mrs. Han is requesting a loan of $1,000 so that she can purchase merchandise to stock her store and purchase more beauty products so that she will have the necessary merchandise in her home. She thinks that this is an investment that will allow her to continue expanding her business. Han is a very diligent and hardworking person. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store and purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 57 years old and lives in Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with 4 children.  To earn a living, Benita has a retail business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Benita has requested a loan of 5,000PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Benita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Benita would like to own a stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is married, with 8 children.  She is 53 years old and lives in Zamora, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  Marciana sells products such as rice, coffee, milk, sugar, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.  Marciana has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um, the mother of five grown children, lives in the district of Prey Chor, located in Kompong Charm Province. Two of her children are married, and her other two daughters are sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh, where they earn an adequate monthly salary.

Um, a farmer who mainly cultivates rice and corn, sells her products in the market near her homeland. To improve family living standards and agricultural activities, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds, manure and fertilizers. Um faces challenges including price fluctuations for her products and the middle-women with whom she deals.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is married, with 5 adult, married children. Rachel is 50 years old and lives in Embargo, Ozamis City.
Rachel has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP2,000 a month doing this type of work. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 to buy feed and piglets.  Rachel has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Rachel hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married.   Her husband works as a travelling salesman.  Though Ni Putu often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Ni Putu is the head of this group, which is made up of 15  neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s fourth loan with MUK.  With the Rp.1.400.000 that Ni Putu receives, she will purchase two piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to pay school fees

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Charley

texts.en:
" To be successful in life" is the main goal of Charley, a 55 year-old mother of five. To attain her goal, she engages in selling frozen foods to earn additional income. She has been in this business for almost 9 years and usually earns P6,000 a month. Her income was used for their food and for necessities for their children.

She aims to improve the business to make it more profitable. She is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy longanisa (pork sausage), tocino, ham and hotdogs to sell in their village. She believes that hard work and strong determination are the keys to gain success.

loans.use: to buy longanisa (pork sausage), tocino, ham, and hot dogs to sell in the village

loans.name: Perlibeth

texts.en:
Perlibeth is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Perlibeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.  Perlibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Perlibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children.  Hazel has a balut shop that sells balut (boiled duck eggs). She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy balut (duck eggs) to sell.  Hazel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hazel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy balut (boiled duck eggs) to sell

loans.name: Shella Mae

texts.en:
Shella Mae is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.  Shella Mae has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & detergents.  Shella Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Shella Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & detergents

loans.name: Ma. Eliza

texts.en:
Ma. Eliza is a 49 year-old widow. Fortunately, she has 3 grown children who have helped her in business operations. The family lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past ten years, Ma. Eliza has owned and operated a retail store to earn enough for day-to-day expenditures. Every month, she receives a total of PHP 5,000 from the business.

In 2008, Ma. Eliza joined GDMPC to have an easy access to financial services. Her previous loan transactions were paid in full. For the 5th time, as expected, she was permitted by the cooperative to borrow PHP 15,000. This is to purchase products to sell, such as cereals, rice, checheria, bath & laundry soap, etc. The future revenue from this investment is intended, partly, for store renovation. The remainder will be for business expansion in order  to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell, such as cereals, rice, checheria, bath & laundry soap, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 53 years old. She is married, with 2 adult children. The family resides in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Two years ago, she cultivated the abandoned area she owns and turned it into a profitable one. She planted a type of mango and sells it in the marketplace. Every month, she makes approximately PHP 1,666.

Earlier this year, Marina joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She has applied for a loan of PHP 3,000 from the cooperative. The money will be used to purchase manure and young mango trees of another type. Having plants grow in fertile and productive soil, Marina hopes for a good harvest to gain more income. She plans to expand the cultivated area where she will plant more of these fruit trees.

loans.use: To purchase manure and a young mango tree of another type.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 9 children.  Fe has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & noodles.  Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & noodles

loans.name: Jemarie

texts.en:
" Doing your best is better than doing nothing" is a principle of Jemarie, a 29 year-old mother engaged in selling AVON products in her village. She has done this business for almost 3 years and made it possible to help her husband to satisfy their basic needs and save for the future of their young daughter. 

She aims to improve the business to increase her income and put up a grocery store someday. She is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy face powders, lotions, roll-ons, body sprays, jewelry and underwear to sell in the village.  

She believes that her faith and dedication to her business will make it possible for her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy face powders, lotions, roll-ons, body sprays, jewelry and underwear to sell in the village

loans.name: Flory Mae

texts.en:
Flory Mae is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 1 child.  Flory Mae has a food cart that sells snacks, like tempura, fishballs & kekiam. She has had this business for 2 years.
