She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy frozen snacks to sell.  Flory Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Flory Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen snacks to sell

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 54 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Epefania has a food vending (pork rind) business in the Philippines. Epefania requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more pork rind to sell to customers.

Epefania has been in this business for 24 years. Epefania would like to save money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pork rind to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 5 children.  Margie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.  Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Esnang

texts.en:
Esnang is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying & selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her buying & selling of dried fish business.

Esnang has been in this business for six years. Esnang earns more income from food vending.

Esnang has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Hog-raising is a business Imelda chose to manage in their village. She is 45 and has two school-age children. She has been in this business for almost 10 years and usually earns 8,000 a month. She utilized their income to sustain their family needs and pay the school fees of their children. She aims to improve the business to be able to continue sending their children to college. 

To improve the business, Imelda is asking for a loan of P 9,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for hog-raising. She is hoping that the loan will help in the improvement and expansion of their business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for  hog-raising

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en:
Ma. Emma works hard to support her family. Ma. Emma is married and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Ma. Emma requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Emma has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Ma. Emma would like to save enough to build a new store.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children.  Mary Jane has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.  Mary Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Men, who was born in 1963, lives in Lo Giao village, Viet Hung commune where she has two children who are going to school. Her husband is a carpenter, and for many years she has been a tailor and a seller of groceries, with a store in her home.  She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). Men, who has participated in SEDA since 2006 and always repaid punctually, is now requesting a loan of 5.014.000 VND to buy more goods to sell.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Tan, a 30 year-old father of three children, wants to borrow 6758000 VND to buy wood to make funiture.

T. is 49 years old and wants to borrow 6758000 VND to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar works hard to support her family. Pilar is single and has a motorcycle-for-rent business in the Philippines.

Pilar requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle.

Pilar has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Pilar would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro, age 47, operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy sack bags (colorful bags usually used for shopping) and paper bags from wholesalers and sells them per piece with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy her bags due to her low selling prices. She earns a minimum of Philippine pesos (PHP) 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Socorro is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of bags to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Socorro lives with her husband Abraham and their children in Malibay, Pasay City. Abraham is a construction worker. Like most Filipino parents, Socorro and Abraham believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Socorro hopes to have her house fully paid up as soon as possible because she dreams of being able to provide her children with a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of bags to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and is married with 3 children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Helen has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income buying and selling rice.

Helen aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Juanita has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Juanita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juanita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell for her buying and selling of vegetables business.

Marlene has been in this business for 11 years. Marlene earns more income from buying and selling of crabs.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling Avon products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her buy and sell Avon product business.

Marilyn has been in this business for eight years. Marilyn earns more income from electronic reloading.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Sol is providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Sol has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sol hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the transport service.

loans.name: Nar Ana

texts.en:
Nar Ana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell for her buying and selling of dried fish business.

Nar Ana has been in this business for seven years. Nar Ana earns more income from selling bananas and coconuts.

Nar Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Mercedita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Mercedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mercedita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou, age 29, runs a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has operated this business for four years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks to offer for sale.

Analou and her husband have two children.

Analou has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Analou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks to offer for sale

loans.name: Robelina

texts.en:
Robelina, age 40, runs a retail shop where she sells daily-use products. This creative woman has been in business for nine years. She and her husband have four children who are now nearing the end of their schooling years. They assist her in selling products from the store, which is located in front of their house. Robelina is very happy because her business is going very well for her. 

Robelina makes her payments to the micro-finance institution every week. She really enjoys her work, and she does it with pleasure because her customers like her store.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 in order to buy more products to sell, such as drinks, milk, coffee, spices, and different kinds of soap. 

One of her dreams is for her daughters to finish their education because she herself only went to elementary school due to the lack of resources. That is why she works hard, hoping to help them with what they need. She also plants and harvests corn in order to have a little extra income.

loans.use: to buy soap, canned goods, coffee, sugar, and spices for her store

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma, age 61, operates a dress-making business. She primarily offers curtains, but she also offers clothing items such as dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, and skirts. Neighbors come to her to request made-to-order clothes or curtains. In addition to her business, Lerma offers rooms in her house for rent as a dormitory. She earns a minimum of 8,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

Lerma and her husband Maximo have two children and live in Malibay, Pasay City. Maximo is a carpenter. At this time, Lerma is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Lerma believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children, particularly as she herself has been an undergraduate. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. A portion of the loan will be used to renovate a room to prepare it for rental. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lerma dreams of being able to give her children a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business, and hopes to have her own shop for her clothes and curtains. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita, age 56, maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct sales brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer, and then the purchased items are given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Jovita's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aside from direct sales, Jovita earns additional income through her accessories business. She uses her creativity to make jewelriy items out of precious stones. She earns a minimum of 2,250 Philippine pesos (PHP)  in sales every week.

Jovita and her husband Rodolfo have two children, now both grown and in the work force, and live in Malibay, Pasay City. Rodolfo works as a porter at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport. At this time, Jovita is working hard in order to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers as well as to purchase materials for the jewelry items she makes, such as Swarovski stones, beads, and nylon cord. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Jovita faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for direct-sales merchandise items and products needed for her jewelry-making business

loans.name: Azizbek

texts.ru:
Азизбек родился 12 августа 1975 года. Его отец рано покинул их, и он остался сиротой. Его мать не могла обеспечить их необходимыми вещами, поэтому он рано начал бизнес. Он помогал своим родным, реализовать товары и зарабатывал денег. Кроме этого он научился выращивать сельскохозяйственных культур и скотоводством. Данный момент он занимается купля продажей продукты питание. Для увлечения капитала он уже третий раз запрашивает кредит. Те займи, который он получил раньше, дал большой эффект, он намного расширил свой бизнес и улучшил свое жилищное условие. Азизбек хотел бы получит кредит в размере 1500$ США для покупки сельскохозяйственных культур. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Azizbek was born on August 12th, 1975. His father has left their family early and he became on orphan. His mother was not able to provide them with all the necessary things and this is why he started to do business early. He was helping his relatives by selling merchandise and making money. Besides that he learned to grow agriculture crops and animal husbandry. At this time he buys and sells food products. To increase his working capital he has been taking out the loan for the third time. His previous loans gave a big effect as he has grown his business a lot and improved his living conditions. Azizbek wants to get a loan in the amount of $1,500USD to buy agriculture crops.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy agriculture crops

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a businessman from Novaya Kahovka. He owns a small business selling office appliances, related components, and expendable materials in one of the local malls called "Central." He launched this business about 12 years ago. Currently, his business has grown up to 20,000 UAH in monthly turnover. His monthly net profit is about 7,000 UAH.

Andrei has used microloans before and found them very instrumental for his business development. This time, Andrei is requesting a loan of 18,000 UAH to purchase parts, expendables, and other inventory items. A portion of profits generated will be invested in his business while some of it will be used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase parts, expendables, and other inventory items

loans.name: Ainur's Group

texts.en:
Ainur, who leads this loan group, is 39 years old and married to a farmer. She and her husband are raising four children, one daughter and three sons. Her oldest son works in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) while the other children study in school. In order to earn enough money to meet their family's needs, Ainur and her husband raise clover. They earn about 4,000 soms per month, which has allowed them to buy household appliances and improve their living conditions. She is applying for this loan to buy fuel which they need to run their farm.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and see a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy fuel needed to run a farm.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 33 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Her husband is a farmer in the Philippines and makes a living by planting  vegetables, corn and rice. Gina’s main priority is to prepare her children for school so they can become professionals someday, but for the last two years she has also earned money by raising pigs. Her dream is to expand her business so she can earn enough money to send her children to college. Gina is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more piglets to raise because she hopes that will allow her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electric tools, supplies and more car spare parts

loans.name: Ishenbubu's Group

texts.en:
Ishenbubu, who leads this loan group, is 48 years old and married to a farmer. She and her husband have two sons, one of whom helps his father raise livestock while the other pursues his studies. Four years ago, the family started to breed livestock with an initial investment of 20,000 soms. They now earn about 12,000 soms a month by selling the animals they have raised. These profits have allowed Ishenbubu to buy furniture for her home and start building a shed for her livestock. She will use her portion of this loan to buy more livestock to breed. Her long-term goal is to build a house in Bishkek for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and see a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with one sibling and one cousin. One year ago, he opened a small shop where he started to sell mobile phones and watches. This young man has newly started his business and needs so much support to move forward. So today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory. He notes that the loan will help him fulfill his objectives and will positively impact his business growth and development.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his children's education fees

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: For the last year, Visitacion has made a living by running a bakery where she makes many different kinds of bread and pastries. She is 44 years old, married, has three children and lives in the town of Ilagan. Visitacion has lots of experience in her line of work and is well known in her area. She is applying for a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy flour, baking soda and sugar. Her goal is to increase her income to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking soda and sugar for her bakery.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 45 years old, married and lives with her family in the village of Ilagan. For the last eight years, she has made a living by running a shop where she makes and sells doors, windows and kitchens. She has lots of experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in her area. Carolina is applying for a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy an aluminum-cutting machine and make new items to sell. Her goal is to increase her profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for a metal shop.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en: Erwin is 27 years old, married and has one child. Ever since he was very young, Erwin has learned how to make a living by breeding pigs. After he married, he continued working in this business and has increased his income and ability to support his family. Four years ago, he went into business for himself and is committed to improve and grow his company so that he can have a better life. Today, he earns about PHP 2,000 a month but would like to increase his income to PHP 5,000 a month. He is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to expand and improve the size of his herd.

loans.use: to expand and improve his livestock business.

loans.name: Joyce Ann

texts.en:
Joyce Ann is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Joyce Ann has a pigpen and sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Joyce Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joyce Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a responsible mother of four children. From the time she was young, she learned the honorable work of raising livestock, an activity that was passed down from her parents and that today brings her satisfaction. Thanks to her valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, she has been able to obtain good results from her sales. She has been running her own business for nine years.

Josefina's wish is to invest more capital in young animals. She hopes to continue her dedication to her work, believing that by improving her stock and feed, her livestock will bring better prices. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. This support will permit her to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz is 65 years old and widowed with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Paz has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. Paz requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables and spices. She has been in her business for 11 years. In the future, she wants to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teodora is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Teodora has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. In 2009, he got the idea of starting a new business. So, he opened a small store where he began car spare parts trading. He only purchases and sells used products. In parallel, he works as a car dealer. He works hard in both jobs to be able to help his father cover the high costs of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more car spare parts. He expects that the coming year will be successful and he will noticeably increase his business income.

loans.use: to purchase more car spare parts

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is single. He is doing interior design, which is a mobile kind of business. He has been running this business for eight years. 

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he intends to use it to buy materials for his trade like tiles, carpets, paint, wallpaper, etc.
 
He desires to establish his trade in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his trade like tiles, carpets, paint, wallpaper, etc

loans.name: Zalfa

texts.en: Zalfa is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children who are still attending school. She has been selling clothes from her home since 2008. She only sells woman and children's clothes. She always presents the newest collections to her customers in order to satisfy their demands. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her purchases of new clothes. She’s certain that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to open a formal clothes store.

loans.use: to increase her purchases of new clothes to sell

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Jovy has a pigpen and sells grown & matured pigs. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Jovy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Зафар целеустремленный и добросовестный человек.  Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей.  Его отец является бизнесменом и помогал отцу по бизнесу и многого научился. В настоящее время он имеет свою торговую точку, и он продает продукты питание.  Кроме этого он реализует сельскохозяйственных культур, потому что начался сезон заготовки и большой спрос на рынке. Он вместе с другом занимается в данном бизнесе. Они покупает сельскохозяйственных культур из других районов и продает их на местном рынке. Зафар хотел бы получит кредит в размере 1500$ США для покупки сельскохозяйственных культур.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Zafar is a purposeful and honest man. He is married and the loving father of four children. His father is a businessman, and he helped his father in business and learned a lot. He currently has a shop, and he sells food products. In addition, he sells seed for crops, and because it is time to sow the fields, there is much demand.  He and his friend work in the business. They buy seed from other regions and sell it locally. Zafar would like to receive a loan of $1,500 to buy seed.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is 31 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Mastula has a small retail shop business that sells spare parts. She has had this business for 7 years.         

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mastula hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Mastula hopes to expand her business. Mastula is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He has been employed in a locA. company since 2009 where he operates as a security agent. In parallel, he has been working as a freelance carpenter since 1990, serving clients upon their request. He works hard to provide a better life for his family. Today, due to his limited income, Ibrahim is requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his son's education fees before the beginning of the new school year.  This borrower’s main purpose in life is to insure a good education level for his son until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay his son's education fees

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetables selling business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 14 years.  She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Vilma is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her business.   She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

Vilma dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Segundina has a food eatery that sells viands like chicken and pork adobo, afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes (or viands) for sale.

Segundina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Segundina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes (or viands) for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 59-year-old married man with six children who lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels of learning. Joseph distills alcohol (local Gin). He has been in this business for 25 years. His major challenge has been price fluctuations of the gin due to competition. Joseph needs the loan to distill alcohol.

loans.use: to distill alcohol.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Бахром умный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 3 детей. С детства он интересовался скотоводством. Его дед и отец занимались этим бизнесом, он научился и   изучал все тонкие стороны бизнеса. Уже более 40 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и у него очень богатый опыт. Он ездит дальним кишлакам за перевозки стока, а затем продает их на местном рынке. Этот бизнес является единственный источникам дохода в его семьи, и он хочет, расширит данный бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль. Бахром хотел бы получит займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Bahrom is an intelligent and conscientious man. He is married and the father of three children. Since childhood he has been interested in animal husbandry. His grandfather and father were in the business. From them, he studied and learned all of the finer points of the business. He has been in business for more than forty years, and thus has extensive experience.  He travels to distant villages to buy their stock, and then sells it at the local market. This business is the sole source of income for his family, and he wants to expand this business to maximize his profit. Bahrom would like to take out a loan for $1,000 to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a scanner

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has one child and earns a living by running a store that sells animal feed and medicine. She has been in this business for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional feed and supplements to sell to her customers. Nena joined HSPFI earlier this year because she is committed to improving her business.

loans.use: to buy additional animal feeds and supplements to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals like lentils, rice, beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Oliva in a patient and hard worker who is committed to provide her family with the necessities of life. She is 27 years old, married, has one child and is married to a farmer who grows rice and corn in the Philippines. For the last three years, she has earned a living by raising pigs. She has encountered many challenges in her work and life, but did not lose her hope to survive and prosper. Oliva is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more piglets to raise and feed for them to eat. Her goal is to increase her income and become even more successful, because this will allow her family to have a good, rewarding life.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 44 years old and is a married man with five children. The oldest and youngest are 17 and 5 years old, respectively.

Jerry has been a farmer for 18 years. He grows rice and corn crops to sell. Jerry earns about 8,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Jerry has requested a loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, one quart of herbicides and three sacks of rice seeds. He hopes to buy farming equipment and expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and rice seeds

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a 41-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents. He has 15 years of experience working in the car mechanic field. In 2008, he opened his own garage. Recently, he hired a full-time employee to help him with the work. He works hard, as he is the only income provider of the family. And today, Tony is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new mechanicA. tools and supplies. He intends to improve his work by enlarging his business operation and satisfying his customers' demands. In the future, he is planning to earn more Kiva loans to support his business.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en:
Pascalia is 30-year-old single woman blessed with one child. She runs a retail shop. She has been doing this business for the last five years and gets a monthly income of KES 13,000. 

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. She is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy a fridge for the business and add stock for the current business and open a butchery.

She will use the anticipated profit to add more stock and probably open another kiosk. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and more stock for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 43-year-old married woman. She has two children aged 17 and 13. Jocelyn and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Jocelyn works hard to support her family and keep them in good health.

Jocelyn has requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of rice seeds, 4 sacks of fertilizers and 2 quarts of herbicides. She hopes to have a stable business that would help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 58 years old, married and has two children.

Jamila has been an owner of a food market since 2006, selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

She decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to buy a large fridge for her market and to add more foodstuffs. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a large fridge for her market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 30-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and two siblings. He started his career working as a female hairdresser. And in 2010, after 10 years of experience, he opened his own female beauty salon. He provides his customers with top quality services and knows how to make women feel comfortable in his salon. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his shop and make new decorations to attract more customers. In the future, Henry looks forward to further improving his business by adding new types of services.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jovy has a retail shop that sells snacks and provides karaoke services, which is the main source of income. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for the utilities for her services.

Jovy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the utilities for his services

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, single and lives with one family member who works.

He has owned a barber shop since 2006. He has good experience and he has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has three children, all of whom work.

Faysal has owned a store since 2001, selling men’s clothing and accessories. He has good experience and he has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to enlarge his store and to buy a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to enlarge his store and to buy a generator.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Lucia has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages, charcoal & firewood. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. In the picture is Lucia and her husband.

Lucia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anis

texts.en: Anis is a 51-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent. Despite his older age, he is still running his business, which he established in 1988. He is a professional car mechanic and has more than 25 years of experience in the same field. His work specializes in car electric repairs.  Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed equipment for his shop. He confirms that thanks to the loan, he will be able to serve more customers and therefore, earn a higher income. This will be his third Kiva loan and it’s positive to learn that he has indeed increased his business productivity and income since taking the previous loans. He was a very punctual client, paying on his scheduled dates.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his shop

loans.name: Ihssan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. Ihssan has had a blacksmith and welding workshop since 2005. He is 22 years old, single and lives by himself. He has good experience in his field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Ihssan decided to apply for a $1200 loan in order to buy a hydraulic pressure machine. He is aiming to gain more profits, so he can have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a hydraulic pressure machine.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean is 39 years old and lives in Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia. She lives with Dara, age 41, and their four children whom they care for and provide a good education for.  

Sean strives to provide the best for her family.  She works hard for them in her fields, which is planted with rice, corn and bananas. She has been doing this farming work for many years on her own land. She feels very committed to her work because thanks to her daily efforts she can now enjoy seeing her farming business developing and she is obtaining good profits from it. 

To put the family's living in a good situation, Sean would like to request a loan in order to purchase a cow for raising.

loans.use: purchase a cow

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Ailyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ailyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad has owned a barber shop since 2010. He is 24 years old, married and has one child. This borrower is from Iraq. He has good experience and a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Mohamad decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to buy a generator and to make an outdoor ceiling and a lighting ad board. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a generator and to make an outdoor ceiling and a lighting ad board.

loans.name: Toufaha

texts.en: Toufaha is 45-year-old married woman living with her husband. When the life expenses exceeded the family income, Toufaha decided to start her own business to support her family.  So, in 2008 she opened her own store where she started to sell women's accessories and perfumes to customers from her community. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory. In the future, she is willing to add more items to sell in her shop such as women's bags.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Evelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, bread, and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy bread, noodles, and detergents. Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, noodles, and detergents

loans.name: Suzane

texts.en: Suzane is a 39-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband and four school-aged children. She has been running a successful bakery since 2000. She produces tasty Lebanese pastries.  With her requested loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will invest in purchasing additional equipment in addition to buying the necessary quantity of flour. In the long term, she is planning to continue expansion of her business and she is positive about the coming years. Her bakery is an important source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and flour

loans.name: Mong

texts.en:
Mong has been spending her life cultivating crops in Kompong Cham Province. This is a skill she learned from her father when she was young. She is now married and has three children. One of them is school-aged and two of her children are working in Phnom Penh city where they can earn a suitable salary each month. Her husband works as a machine repairer in the village. 

Mong’s husband faces difficulties with his traveling needs because he always has to pay a lot of money to a taxi driver when he wants to go to his work place and other places. Therefore, Mong hopes to reduce the amount her husband has to spend on transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Barcelisa

texts.en:
Barcelisa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Barcelisa has a retail shop that sells used clothing like jeans, blouses & t-shirts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock of used clothing.

Barcelisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Barcelisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing

loans.name: Idriss

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has four children, one of whom works.

Idriss has owned a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of the local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to make a lighted Ad board, to buy two fridges and a tricycle truck and to add more foodstuffs for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a lighed Ad board, to buy two fridges and a tricycle truck and to buy more fooddstuffs for his market

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim is a 62-year-old Lebanese married man; He is living with his wife and two children. He is the only income provider of the family. In 2001, he bought a special truck to be used for vegetables distribution. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 16 years. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his shuttle in order to continue his business operation properly. In the future, and because of his older age, Nazim is planning to hire a part-time employee to help him with the work and keep his truck a stable source of income.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his shuttle

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Elvira has a retail shop that sells detergents, beverages, snacks and breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elvira is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more poultry birds and expand her poultry unit

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has two children.

Haydar has been an owner of a workshop since 2008. He repairs paint scratches on cars. He has good experience and he has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,700 loan to renovate his shop and to make sliding doors. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to make sliding doors.

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is married and her husband is a salesman by profession. He sells different spices and edible items in different shops.  He is very fair at his rates and makes reasonably good profits every month. 

Humaira is very supportive and does sewing for her neighboring customers for profits. She is also an embroidery expert and works on order. She is the mother of three children. All of her children are getting their education.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy stock such as spices, candies & chips in bulk quantity to be able to sell in larger quantity and make higher profits. He has been operating his business for the past two years and Humaira is confident that an investment will be more productive for his business and will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy spices, candies & chips to sell

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Marcosa has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marcosa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marcosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has three children.

Moustafa has owned a barber shop since 2005. He has good experience and a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,800 loan to make a lighted Ad board and to purchase two barber chairs for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To make a lighted Ad board and to purchase two barber chairs.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is 46 years old and lives in Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia. She lives with Thorn, age 50, and their four children.  One of her children is married and lives in a separate house, and the other three are single. 

Heng strives to provide the best for her family.  She works hard for them in her fields, which is planted with rice and bananas. She has been doing in this farming work for many years on land that she owns. She feels very committed to her work because thanks to her daily effort she can now enjoy seeing her farming business developing and she is obtaining good profits from it. 

To put her family living in a good situation, Heng would like to request a loan in order to purchase two cows for raising.

loans.use: buy two cows

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Genara has a food shop or eatery that sells viands like escabeche, pork adobo & bulalo. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making dishes or viands for sell.

Genara is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Genara hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making dishes or viands tosell

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children. One of his children works.

Alaa has owned a workshop since 2006. He repairs all kinds of cycles (motorcycles and bikes). He has good experience in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1,800 loan in order to enlarge his shop and to make sliding doors. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to enlarge his shop and to make sliding doors.

loans.name: Abdel Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old and married.

Abdel Hussein has owned a workshop since 2001. He repairs all kinds of generators. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan to purchase a machine for repairing generators, to make a sliding door and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for repairing generators, to make a sliding door and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Mechelle

texts.en:
Mechelle is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Mechelle has a retail shop that sells school & office supplies & snacks. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of office & school supplies.

Mechelle is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mechelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy office & school supplies

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan is 45 years old and has been living in Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia for a long time.  Nhan strives to provide the best for her family. She works hard for them in her fields, which are planted with rice and bananas. She has been in this line of work for many years on land that she owns. She feels very committed to her work because thanks to her daily effort she can now enjoy seeing her farming business developing and she is obtaining good profits from it.  

Nhan lives with Phan, age 46 and five children. One of her children is married and lives in a separate house, and other four are single.  Presently, three of her children are employed in Phnom Penh city where they earn a salary each month. To improve the family's living, Nhan would like to ask a loan from Kiva in order to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Jeenbubu's Group

texts.en:
Jeenbubu is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and two daughters. The first son and the older daughter are married and live separately with their families. The second son works in construction and the youngest daughter studies at school. In order to earn money to meet the daily needs, Jeenbubu breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after fattening. With money received from the loan, Jeenbubu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she wants to repair the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Elvie has a retail shop that sells charcoal per kilogram, firewood & snacks. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of charcoal & firewood to sell. In the picture are Elvie & her husband.

Elvie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elvie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal & firewood to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto's dream is to improve his hog-raising business to have a stable source of income and provide his family needs. He is 55, married and has seven adult-age children. He has been a farmer for almost 15 years and usually earns a profit of PHP 9,000 a month that he uses for their basic necessities.

In farming, he can't avoid experiencing hardships due to problems and natural calamities, but Roberto has the strong faith and determination to pursue his business to achieve his goals. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for hog raising. He hopes that the loan will help a lot to sustain the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 47 years old. He is married and has five children to educate. To generate income, he raises crops primarily planting and harvesting rice for future merchandise. He usually merchandises it to local traders in the village. He earns a yield twice a year during the months of May and November. Profits earned are used for the education of his children, daily meals and bills at home.

Manuel is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming. Through his patience, determination and help of this loan, he will be able to improve his crop production. 

In the future, Manuel would like to earn consistent profits and make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elvira has a retail shop that sells food seasonings, charcoal per kilograms & coconuts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of charcoal & coconuts to sell.

Elvira is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Reonel

texts.en:
"If there's no pain, there's no gain" is an inspiring quote of Reonel, a 20-year-old single man who has been engaged in rice farming for almost four years. Every harvest season he only earned PHP 20,000 net income. To improve his crop production, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and to pay labor costs for transplanting rice.

His plan is to have a plentiful harvest to increase his income, save for future emergencies and to help his parents send his younger brothers and sisters to school. He hopes that through hard work and strong determination, he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and pay for labor

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en:
Salameh is a 52-year-old man, who is married and has six sons and four daughters. He works as a taxi driver and also, one of his sons works in the field of telecommunications. Salameh has one of his sons studying in the university, and he needs to cover his son's university fees, but the money he has is not enough to cover them. So Salameh needs to take a loan of $600. 

As Salameh gets a FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay the fees and his son will able to continue his university education smoothly.  Salameh is keen to have all of his sons educated, so they can have a better social level in the community, improve the family sources of income, and live in better conditions.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his son.

loans.name: Joederick

texts.en:
Joederick, who lives with his parents in the village, is now 24 years old and still single. Joederick wasn't able to finish his college education, the reason he finds it difficult to secure employment with a government organization.

Being a responsible son, he therefore began raising crops to generate income, planting and harvesting rice twice a year, usually selling his harvest to local traders in the village. Joederick earned about P30,000 from the last harvest in May, money he used to pay labor costs involved in preparing the farmland for the next planting season. He also pay credits and bills at home.

Joederick wants to improve crop production and achieve bountiful harvests every crop season. Due to insufficient capital, he is now requesting a loan of P12,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to ensure a good crop. In addition to aspiring to a bountiful harvest, Joederick also hopes to have his own family someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann is a 55-year-old village woman who has a job as a vermicelli seller. She has run this business since she was single. Currently, she buys vermicelli from other villagers for a low price and resells it. She runs her business next to her house and earns approximately $1.25 a day. Her husband is a radio repairer in the village. This humble couple has four children, three of them are married and live in their own separate houses, and the other one is of school-age.   

To improve her family's living, Vann wishes to borrow some funds from Kiva in order to purchase additional radio materials. She and her husband are very grateful to all lenders who help her family.

loans.use: buy materials to repair radios

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
As a responsible father, Virgilio aims to increase his rice production to satisfy his family's needs. A 58-year-old father of four grown children, he has been engaged in rice farming for almost 35 years, earning a net income of P 25,000 per harvest.

Virgilio is requesting a loan of P 20,000 to buy insecticides, fertilizers and seeds to sustain his rice production. He hopes that he can yield a plentiful harvest to increase his income for his family and become capable of paying the school fees of their grand children. He also plans to improve their house to live more comfortably and to erect a general store someday for his wife to manage.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers and seeds for rice production.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Bubualiy's Group

texts.en:
Bubualiy is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and three daughters. All the children, except the youngest son, work in Russia.

 In 1990 after the collapse of the USSR, Bubualiy started to sell fruits and vegetables with an initial investment of 5000 soms. She has a lot of experience in this sphere and at the moment her business is running well. She earns 15,000 soms per month. 

Bubualiy applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing more fruits and vegetables. In the future she wants to build a house for her younger son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 27 years old, married, and has two daughters aged 6 and 13. He owns a small shop selling "unga" (flour), sugar, cooking oil, and rice to residents around his business. He has been running this business for a year and hopes to continue expanding it. Evans intends to use his loan to purchase a "posho" mill that he will use at this shop. 

This is Evans’ second loan with SMEP. He is a good client who pays back his loans on time. Evans hopes to own a wholesale business some day. He describes himself as extremely focused.

loans.use: to purchase a "posho" (cornmeal) mill to use at his shop.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is 53 years old, married, and has five children aged 12 to 23. He has been running a transportation business for two years and employs one person. He provides transportation for all types of customers along Kambi-Kambiri road. Jack intends to use this loan to purchase more spare parts for his vehicle. 

Jack intends to use the profits from his business to buy another vehicle so that he can expand his business. He also dreams of being able to buy his own plot of land one day so that he can build a house. Jack describes himself as visionary.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Kulmira's Group

texts.en:
Kulmira is the leader of this group. She is 48 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised a son and three daughters. The son works as a policeman, the older daughter is a teacher, the second daughter is a retailer and the youngest daughter studies at school.

 In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, Kulmira, together with her husband, breeds livestock. They started this activity in 1994 and now their monthly profit from reselling livestock is 8000 soms. This profit made it possible for them to purchase a vehicle. 

Kulmira wants to purchase four livestock animals for breeding, but she doesn’t have enough funds, thus she has applied for the loan. In the future she wants to see all her children get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 37ans, célibataire, mère d 'un enfant de 15ans, elle s’est lancé dans la vente  des vêtements pour enfants depuis 13 ans au marché.
Le choix des vêtements, sandales et chaussures pour enfants, lui a permis d’augmenter ses revenues durant les 2 cycles passés.Ses ventes ont largement augmentes, elle a des recettes en moyenne de 35.000frs a 120.000frs par semaine
Avec ce troisième prêt elle va renforcer son stock en achetant : des sandales et baskets mixtes pour  enfants, 4 douzaines des robes, 3 douzaines de pantalons, 2 douzaines de jupes, 3 douzaines chemisiers, 2 douzaines des polos, 10 douzaine des chaussettes, 10 douzaines des slips mixtes.
Sauf pour rupture de stock, ses prix sont abordables et ses articles hors concurrence  car elle a un bon choix.
Elle veut importer des articles d’ailleurs pour diversifier la qualité et elle fera la différence.
Elle lutte pour  l’épanouissement et le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
The client is 37, single and mother of a 15 year old child. 13 years ago she started a business selling children's clothes at the market. The selection of clothes, sandals and shoes for children has enabled her into increase her revenue in the past two loan cycles. Her sales have increased significantly. On average she brings in between 35.000frs to 120,000frs each week.
With this third loan she is going to strengthen her stock by purchasing: sandals and sports shoes for children, 4 dozen dresses, 3 dozen pairs of trousers, 2 dozen skirts, 3 dozen blouses, 2 dozen polo shirts, 10 dozen pairs of socks, 10 dozen undergarments.
Excepting stock shortages, her prices are affordable and given the quality of her selection the items are without competition.
She wants to import items from elsewhere to diversify the quality.
She fights for the development and wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: Buy clothing and shoes for children

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor, who is 23 years old, married, and has a six-month old son, has been in the grocery business for the past three years, selling mangoes and oranges to customers at the Kakamega market. Victor intends to use his loan to purchase more mangoes and oranges to resell.

This will be Victor’s third loan with SMEP, his previous ones repaid on time. He hopes to use his profits to expand the business, and when he has enough money, aspires to buy a pickup truck to transport mangoes to nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von, age 50, is an experienced farmer. She has been involved in farming since 1983 on her own farm, which is near her village.  From this work, she is able to earn about 2 dollars daily. 

Von is married to Chan, age 47, who is also a farmer. The couple has four children, one of them is already married and lives away from her parents, and the other three children are all single.  Presently, two of her kids are employed as blacksmiths in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia.   

Because Von's children work far away from the village, they face difficulties with their traveling needs because they must always pay a lot of money to a taxi driver when they want to go to their workplaces and other places. Therefore, Von hopes to reduce her children's expenses for transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Saadat's Group

texts.en:
Saadat is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she is raising two daughters and two sons. The first son and the daughters are at school and the second son is of preschool age (under seven). At the moment Saadat works as a cook and earns a monthly salary of 6,000 soms. In order to earn additional income to meet her family's needs, Saadat, together with her husband, cultivates agricultural products; she grows 0.1 hectares of cotton and 0.07 hectares of tomatoes.
