By selling part of the harvest, Saadat earns an additional 5,000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for her family to repair their house and install iron gates. With the money received from the loan she would like to purchase fertilizers for cultivating cotton. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers, as well as society); Planet (keeping environmentally friendly); and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Shokir

texts.ru:
Шокир добросовестный и трудолюбивый муж. Он очень старается, содержат свою семью в хороших условиях жизни. Он занимается перевозкой пассажиров более 2 лет. Шокир также занимается скотоводством. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Шокир хотел бы получит кредит в размере 2800$ США для покупки автомашины. Он хочет заранее благодарит Кива и Кива кредиторы за их поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Shokir is an honest and hardworking man. He is trying very hard to support his family well. He has driven a taxi for two years.  Shokir also works breeding cattle. He wants to expand his business and maximize his profit. Shokir would like to receive a loan of $2,800 to buy a vehicle. He wants to thank Kiva and Kiva lenders in advance for their support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en: Amiran is from the village of Dimi in the Imereti Region of west Georgia. He is 51 years old and lives with his wife, Dariko, his 27 year old son and his 73 year old mother. Amiran actively helps his son on the family farm despite his health problems, for which he receives a relevant pension from the government. They have four cows and two calves. Dariko produces approximately 80 kg cheese per month and sells it on the local open market. The family also owns two, 400 square meter greenhouses. In the greenhouses they grow cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. Once harvested, these products are sold locally as well. The family's total average monthly income is 580 Laris, including the pensions of Amiran and his mother. Amiran has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, which will be used in the greenhouses. By fertilizing the land, the family will ensure a high quality harvest, which can be sold for a good price. The additional income will be used for the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the greenhouses.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David runs a little business that sells calendars and washing nets to residents around his home. He has been doing this for two years and finds theft to be his largest business challenge. David intends to use his loan to buy more washing nets and calendars in larger quantities and therefore at a lower price. David describes himself as a visionary. He hopes to open a wholesale shop some day. He would also like to expand his business by purchasing a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: to buy more washing nets and calendars.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
This lady is May, 31, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Michael, a waiter, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

May operates a little school supplies business where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, and the like, without going to a bookstore. May gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP)  in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for school supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

May dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of school supplies.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is hard-working hairdresser. She is married and has three children aged 10 to 15 years old. Christine has been running a salon for five years. She often does not have enough stock to run her business effectively. Christine intends to use this loan to buy more materials needed to run her salon. 

This is Christine’s first loan with SMEP. She dreams of being able to open a big company that supplies all the materials needed by salons. Christine describes herself as honest.

loans.use: to buy more materials needed to run her salon.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
Иброхим добросовестный и ответственный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Он занимается купля продажей продукты питание. Он имеет свой собственный магазин в центре города. Его жена помогает ему, когда он ездит за товарами. Более 4 лет он занимается в данном бизнесе.  Иброхим всегда старается получить максимальной прибыли и улучшить свое жилищное условие. Он запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки продовольственных товаров. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ibrohim is a conscientious and dependable man. He is married and a loving father of 2 children. He sells groceries at his own store at the center of his town. His wife helps him in the store when he leaves to purchase groceries in bulk. Ibrohim has been managing his store for the last 4 years. He is always trying to maximize the profit from his business in order to improve living conditions for his family. Currently he is requesting a loan of 3000 US dollars to purchase various grocery staples for his store. He hopes that lenders will support this loan.

loans.use: to purchase bulk groceries for his store

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 45 years old, married, and has two children aged 7 and 9. He is a grocer and sells cabbage to all types of customers near his home. He has been running this business for over 25 years. In addition to selling cabbage, Edward also farms. He intends to use his loan to add more stock. 

Edward hopes to keep expanding his business. He dreams of becoming a cabbage wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more cabbage.

loans.name: Lucia Mubone

texts.en:
Lucia is a married lady with nine children. She operates a small food kiosk where she sells "mandazi" (a fried pastry) and other snacks to local people in Mombasa. She has been running this business for five years now. She says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has are financial constraints. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy flour for making doughnuts.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a restaurant. She describes herself as ambitious.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Nasibahan's Group

texts.en:
Nasibahan is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a truck driver. Together they have raised two sons; the first son works as a driver and his monthly salary is 4000 soms and the younger son is a carpenter who earns 3000 soms per month. 

At the moment Nasibahan works as a teacher in a kindergarten. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing a fridge. With money received from the loan she wants to improve her family's living conditions. In the future Nasibahan plans to start repairing their house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
David is 29 years old and from the village Kontuati, Imereti District, West Georgia. He is unmarried and lives with his family which includes his parents, a 31-year-old brother, and a 20-year-old sister. David works in a local carpentry workshop as painter. Along with his regular job, he is also involved with his family’s farm activities. His family owns three cows and David’s mother produces cheese and sells it on the open market. David’s family also grows maize and cultivates nut trees on their 1.25 hectare plot. The corn that they raise primarily goes to the dairy and they sell approximately 200 kilograms of nuts locally. 

David is requesting a loan to renovate his kitchen which is old and uncomfortable. Once the renovation is complete and the kitchen is equipped with better appliances, the family will enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a kitchen renovation

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 55 years old and married with five children. He runs a private school and provides educational services to students in his area. Patrick has been working in the education sector for the last 21 years. He describes himself as honest and as a person who always keeps his promises.

Patrick is requesting a loan to repair his school’s matatu (mini-bus). This will be his third loan with SMEP. Patrick is a good borrower who repays his loans on time. He plans to use the profits from his loan to build a secondary school. In the future, Patrick hopes to run the leading school in the district.

loans.use: to repair his school’s matatu (mini-bus)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old and single. For the past two years, she has owned an electronics shop. Elizabeth earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Elizabeth is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase more stock for her shop. This will be her third loan. She plans to use the profit from her loan to open another shop. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her electronics shop

loans.name: El Hadji Mansour

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur est un vulcanisateur marié sans enfant. Il a ouvert en même temps à coté de son atelier une cantine pour vendre des pièces détachées auto et moto. Il a appris son métier pendant 6 ans avant de s’implanter à son propre compte. Aujourd’hui, il s’approvisionne en gros en pneus, en chambre à air et d’autres produits divers qu’il revend au détail auprès des usagers de sa localité. Il habite dans une ville dont l’une des principales caractéristiques est la présence de milliers de motos « jakarta » qui assurent l’essentiel du transport urbain. C’est pourquoi, face à la forte demande en pièces détachées, il sollicite auprès de l’IMCEC un prêt de 250000F pour acheter 50 pneus, 50chambres à air, 50 paquets de colle, 10 caisses d’acide  et d’autres pièces diverses.
Les bénéfices tirés de la vente de ce stock lui serviront à supporter les dépenses d’entretien de sa famille et de prise en charge de ses propres besoins .Il ambitionne de créer un grand magasin de vente en gros de pièces détachées et de pneus.
texts.en:
The borrower is a tire repairman, married with no children. He also opened a little store next door to his workshop where he sells spare parts for cars and motorcycles. He learned his trade for six years before setting up on his own. 

Today he buys wholesale tires and inner tubes and various other products that he sells retail to customers in his locality. He lives in a town that is principally characterized, among other things, by thousands of "Jakarta" motorcycles that take care of urban transport. This is why, in view of the strong demand for spare parts, he is asking U-IMCEC for a loan of 250,000 francs  to buy 50 tires, 50 inner tubes, 50 tubes of glue, 10 cases of acid and various other spare parts. 

The profit from the sale of this stock will allow him to support himself and his family. His ambition is to open up a big store selling spare parts and tires wholesale.

loans.use: to buy various spare parts and other supplies for cars and motorcycles.

loans.name: Simba

texts.en:
Simba is 61 years old and married with four children. For the past 16 years, he has been running a small washing and ironing business and providing laundry services to residents in his area. Simba describes himself as respectful, friendly, and faithful.

Simba is requesting a loan to purchase a table and an ironing board. He plans to use the profits from his loan to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to be able to afford an electric washing machine and to hire someone to help him. Simba also hopes to continue paying for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a table and an ironing board

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 35 years old and married with two children, ages four and 16. For the past three years, she has been running a small cosmetics boutique where she sells cosmetics and beauty products to all types of customers around her shop. Rachel describes herself as obedient.

Rachel is requesting a loan to purchase additional cosmetic and beauty products. This will be her sixth loan with SMEP and she is a wonderful client who repays her loans on time. Rachael hopes to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Мунира имеет среднее образование. Она уже два года как открыла пекарню, где печет лепешку. В этом ей помогает ее муж. Она берет кредит для приобретения угля.
texts.en: Munira lives in Khujand. She is 36 years old. She is married. She has two children. Munira has a secondary education. Two years ago, she opened a bakery where she makes flat bread.  Her husband helps her in this. She is taking out a loan to buy coal.

loans.use: to buy coal

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old, married and has three children aged 3 to 9. She owns a small clothing business in the Mombasa area and has been running this business for three years. Irene intends to use her loan to purchase more clothes for her business. 

Irene describes herself as hardworking. She is often happy and always has a smiling face.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
Ислом талантливый и образованный человек.  Он женат и ответственный отец 2 детей. С детства он хотел иметь свой собственный бизнес и стать богатым человеком. Он идет вперед по этой линии, который он представил и нарисовал для себя. Постепенно он открыл свой маленький собственный бизнес с мизерными капиталами. Теперь он расширил и занимается купля продажей продтоварами и промтоварами. В настоящее время Ислом хочет расширить свой бизнес и добавит новый ассортимент продукции, чтобы клиенты могли найти то, что искали. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Islom is a talented and educated man. He is married and is a responsible father of 2 children. Since his childhood Islom wanted to have his own business and become a rich man. Islom is still working towards that goal which he has envisioned for himself. At first Islom opened his own little store using meager personal funds. Now he has expanded his venture and sells groceries and office supplies at his store. Currently Islom wants to grow his business and purchase an expanded inventory so that his customers would always be able to find what they were looking for at his store. With this goal in mind Islom is requesting a loan of 2000 US dollars.

loans.use: to purchase bulk groceries and office supplies

loans.name: Fady

texts.en: Fady is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has worked as a gas station supervisor since 1995. His business income is very important because he is the main one responsible for paying the family expenses, especially the children's education fees. With his requested loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to pay the school registration for his children. It’s required at this time for all the school management to start student registration procedures, which only last for a couple of weeks. So Fady has to move fast and gather the needed sum of cash to be able to allow his children to proceed with their educational path.

loans.use: to pay school registration for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional tools

loans.name: Fotima's Group

texts.en: Fotima is the leader of this group. She is 37 and married. Her husband works in Russia as a constructor. Each month, he transfers to Fotima 5,000 soms. Fotima takes care of four sons; the youngest son goes to a kindergarten, and the other three sons study at school. In order to earn additional money, Fotima breeds cattle. At the moment, she keeps a cow and two calves. Selling the dairy products and cattle, she earns 10,000 soms per month. This profit made her able to pay for her children’s education. Fotima applied for the loan because she needs financial funds for purchasing feed for cattle. In the future, she wants to give her children a good education. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and only child. He is from Lebanon. He has 15 years of experience working in the agricultural field. In 2009, Ahmad purchased land and started cultivating different types of vegetables according to the season. He has two part-timers helping him accomplish the work tasks. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fertilizers and seeds. He will also perform the needed maintenance on the water canal to help the products grow. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his business productivity and profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and perform maintenance on the water canal

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man living with one cousin. He has been working as a private teacher since 2006. He receives students at his house where he has prepared a special education room. He also teaches some students at their domiciles. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his car to help him with his transportation and facilitate his business operation since he works in different places and areas. He is expecting to expand his business and he’s very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming years.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: make much needed repairs on her car.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Анвар целеустремлённый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 2 детей. Он старается, чтоб его дети выросли образованными и культурными людьми, и чтоб работали в хороших кампаниях и открыли свой собственный бизнес. Он очень хочет, чтоб его дети не знали бедности и были счастливы. С этой целью он начал заниматься купля продажей аксессуаров для мобильных более 4 лет. Анвар мечтает о том, что когда-то он расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальной прибыли. С надеждою он обратился к Имон Интернэшнл, чтобы поддерживать его и запрашивает 3000$ США. Он заранее благодарит всех, кто поддерживает его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Anvar is a goal-oriented and conscientious man. He is married and is a father of 2 children. He is doing his best to assure that his children grow up educated and cultured people, so that they can work for good companies and open their own business. Anvar wants his children to grow free of poverty and be happy. With this goal he has been managing his own mobile phone business for the last 4 years. Anvar dreams about expanding his business and maximizing his profits from it. With hope he has turned to Imon International to support him and loan him 3000 US dollars. Anvar wants to thank everyone who will support him in advance!

loans.use: to purchase new inventory

loans.name: Souriyeh

texts.en:
Souriyeh is a 53-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband. She has owned a tailoring shop since 2000 and has a previous experience of 30 years in the same field. She cooperates with her husband who works as a farmer to maintain the family's financial level at a good level. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new tailoring machine. She stated that this machine will help her increase her business productivity and thus her income. In the future, she is hoping to enlarge her shop and expand her business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Syré

texts.fr: Monsieur Syré est un jeune âgé de 25 ans. Il habite au Sénégal. Il évolue dans le secteur de l’infographie. Il a une deuxième activité qui consiste a vendre des fournitures et des accessoires de couture aux tailleurs. Il a choisi ces activités dans le souci de se ^procurer des revenus  qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge financièrement mais aussi de soutenir ses ^parents. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’articles de mercerie en vue de renforcer le stock de sa boutique. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociales ainsi que celle de ses parents.
texts.en: Monsieur Syré, 25, lives in Sénégal. He is developing a business in informatics. His second business is selling supplies and sewing notions to tailors. He chose these activities in order to make a living and support himself but also help out his parents. He is a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to be used to buy sewing notions in order to bolster the inventory in his shop. The increased income will permit him to improve living conditions for himself and his parents.

loans.use: to buy sewing notions for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 27-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has 10 years of experience working as a blacksmith. In 2006, he started running his own business. He works independently, but on overloaded workdays, he gets help from a part-timer to get the work done.

 Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by purchasing needed materials. He is optimistic about his business prospects and he is certain that with the help of the loan, his business income will augment.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing added blacksmith's materials.

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en:
Zhora is 69 years old and lives in the village of Tskaltubo. He lives with his wife, Fatula, and their son, daughter-in-law, and 20-year-old grandson. All of the family members are involved in the family agricultural business which is their only source of the income, along with the pensions received by Zhora and Fatula. 

Zhora’s family has four cows and Fatula produces approximately 80 kilograms of cheese each month that is sold at the local open market. The family also operates a small pig farm with one pig that provides piglets that they sell. Zhora and his family also have a plot of land with 80 peach trees that are harvested and the fruit is sold locally on the open market. The family’s total average monthly is 672 GEL.

Zhora is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and chicken feed. The family owns a hen house, which is currently not in use but is well-equipped and able to be used. Zhora will sell the hens and eggs at the local market. 

This new business initiative will significantly increase the family’s income and have a positive impact on their living conditions. For the first year, Zhora plans to reinvest the entire profit received from his new poultry farm back into the same business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Latyr

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un père de famille polygamme qui vit avec ses trois épouses dans son village, en milieu rurale.C'est un paysan qui exploite chaque année un champ de mil dont la production est essentiellement destinée à la consommation et un autre d'arachide dont la récolte est vendue pour rapporter des revenus à la famille.Parallèlement à cela, il achète chaque année trois veaux qu'il revend au terme de 6 mois de stabulation. Avec ces deux activités, il parvient à assurer correctement l'alimentation de sa famille et à pourvoir aux besoins quotidiens de ses enfants et épouses.Toutefois, depuis trois ans, il a arrêté l'élevage à cause du vol de ses deux bœufs à quelques jours de leur vente.Aprés avoir sécuriser son étable, il a décidé de reprendre cette activité et sollicite ainsi un prêt de 300000f auprès de l'IMCEC pour l'achat de 2 veaux. Leur vente lui apportera des revenus supplémentaires pour continuer à s'occuper de sa famille. Il ambitionne de construire une clôture assez élever et d'augmenter ainsi le nombre de ses animaux.
texts.en:
The borrower is the father of a polygamous family; he lives with his three wives in his rural village. He is an agriculturalist who plants a field of millet every year whose produce is essentially destined for home consumption and another of peanuts that are sold to bring in income for the family. Besides that, he buys three calves every year and resells them after six months of fattening. With these two activities, he manages to feed his family appropriately and cover the daily needs of his  children and wives. However, in the last three years, he has not raised any cattle because two cows were stolen a few days before they were destined to be sold. 

After having made his stable secure, he has decided to take up this activity again and is therefore asking for a loan of 300,000 francs from U-IMCEC to use to buy two calves. Their sale will bring in supplementary income so he can continue to care for his family. His ambition is to build a corral so that he can continue cattle-raising and add to the number of animals he raises.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Gulshanoi's Group

texts.en:
Gulshanoi, 34, is the leader of this group. Her husband went to work in Russia to make money and Gulshanoi takes care of their three children, all of whom are at school. In order to earn money and meet the family’s needs, Gulshanoi breeds cattle. She has been engaged in this business since 1994, and currently has two bull calves. 

Gulshanoi has a great deal of experience breeding cattle and is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed. In the future, she plans to use the profits from her loan to repair her house. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиер активный и целеустремленный молодой муж. Его жена домохозяйка и он сам кормит свою семью. Он так старается обеспечить свою семью тем, что они нуждаются. В районе, который он живет развита скотоводства и он с детства научился в этом. За последнее 4 года он начал заниматься скотоводством и успешно продолжает данный бизнес. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свое жилищное условие. С этой целью он запрашивает займ на сумму 1300$. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is an energetic and goal-oriented young husband. His wife is a homemaker and Bakhtiyor supports his family on his own. He is doing his very best to provide for his family's needs. His home region is famous for raising cattle and Bakhtiyor has been doing it since childhood. In the last 4 years he has acquired his own herd and his cattle sale business is doing well. Bakhtiyor wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1300 US dollars.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 60 years old and is from the village Pirveli Obcha. She is retired and lives with her husband, Chichiko, and their 25-year-old son. Lili and Chichiko work together on their family farm. They have 600 grape vines and sell the harvested grapes locally. Some of the grapes are also used for wine-making and they sell wine at the local open market. The family also owns a milk cow and Lili produces and sells cheese. Demand for cheese quite high and Lili could sell more of this product. 

Lili is requesting a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. This will allow her to double her cheese production and the increase in sales will significantly improve the family’s income. Lili and Chichiko plan to use the profits from their loan to purchase household goods to improve their family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.fr: L'empreuteuse a la cinquantaine d'age.Depuis le décès de son mari en 2002 avec lequel elle n'a pas eu d'enfants, elle vit seule dans la famille de son frère.Elle y a implanté une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires .Elle pratique simultanément l'aviculture avec une trentaine de poulets destinés à la vente mais aussi à l'auto - consommation.Les bénéfices de ces deux activités sont réparties en quatre parts; une part part pour participer à l'entretien de la famille de son frère;deux parts pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et une dernière déposée dans son compte d'épargne à l'IMCEC.Avec ses bénéfices, elle est parvenue à construire sa propre maison qu'elle compte mettre bientôt en location après avoir terminer les travaux de finition.C'est d'ailleurs pour cela qu'elle sollicite un prêt de 100000f afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce et accroitre ainsi ses revenus.Elle compte acheter 25 sacs de "café touba" et 15 sacs de riz parfumé. Toute son ambition est de continuer à aider son frère et sa famille surtout les enfants qui sont à l'école.
texts.en:
This borrower is around 50 years old. Since the death of her husband (with whom she had no children) in 2002, she has been living alone in the family of her brother. There, she has set up a little shop selling foodstuffs. She also raises poultry with some thirty hens intended for sale or for her own consumption. The profit from these two activities is divided into four parts: one part goes as her share of costs to her brother's family, two parts go to add to her working capital, and the last part into her savings account with IMCEC. 

With her profit, she has managed to build her own house that she is intending to rent out after she has made the finishing touches. It is for that reason that she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to add to her working capital and thus grow her income. She intends to buy 25 bags of "Touba Coffee" (a spiced coffee beverage) and 15 sacks of jasmine rice. Her great ambition is to continue to help her brother and his family, especially the children who are attending school.

loans.use: to buy 25 bags of "Café Touba" (a spiced coffee beverage) and 15 sacks of jasmine rice.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old and married to Jeniffer. The couple is blessed with one child. For the past 18 months, David has run a boda-boda (motorbike transport) business. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. David works very hard. 

David is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to buy spare parts, repair his motorbike, and purchase a helmet. He will use the extra profit from his loan to educate his child. David hopes to provide a wonderful and stable financial future for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, repair his motorbike, and purchase a helmet

loans.name: Rajamo

texts.ru: Рачамо проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Рачамо имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она более 25 лет работает по профессии. Кроме того она занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом Рачамо открыла не большой магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. В этой области она работает уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов питания.
texts.en: Rajamo lives in Kulob. She is 46 years old. She is married. She has five children. Rajamo has a degree in teaching. She has been teaching for more than 25 years. Additionally, she works in trade. Near her home, Rajamo opened a small general store. She has been doing this work for fifteen years. She is taking out a loan to buy groceries.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth and thread.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 49 years old. She lives in the village Kvishilori with her husband, Guram, and their son Abessalom, who is 30 years old. Although Abessalom has health problems and receives a pension from the government, he still helps with the family’s farming activities. 

Madona is the leading businesswoman of the family. She grows flowers in her garden and sells them in Tskaltubo, a nearby town. She also has two milk cows and produces cheese to sell at the same market. The average income of the family is 375 GEL.

Madona is requesting a loan to expand her dairy farm and purchase a milk cow which will help increase her cheese production by 50%. This will significantly increase the family’s income. Once she has more income, Madona plans to renovate her house as it is old and needs improvement.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is a 34-year-old man; he is married and has three sons and two daughters. He is a bus driver, a public transportation service he owns. Also he has another source of income from agriculture. Mohannad wants to make some repairs to the bus and complete part of its purchasing price, but because of the low income he gets from driving and agriculture, he can't afford such expenses. Mohannad wants to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN.

 As Mohannad gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid easily on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay for repairs and complete the price of the vehicle, and that will enable Mohannad to have full ownership of the bus and work extra hours to have more income which will affect family life positively. 

Mohannad is photographed beside the bus he owns.

loans.use: To pay for repairing a bus and complete part of its purchasing price.

loans.name: Nawaogbzanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme Angèle est la représentante du groupe NAWAOGBZANGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 10 ans et le moins âgé à 02ans.03 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle à 5 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des condiments  et légumes depuis 04 ans, les autres membres du groupe son des tisseuses. Mme Angèle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes; les hommes et ses voisins.

Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 01 sac d’oignons,01 sac de tomate fraîche et quelques épices.

Ses économies servent  à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle a comme ambitions assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, se doter d’une moto pour faciliter son déplacement dans le cadre de son activité.
texts.en:
Mme Angèle is the representative of the NAWAOGBZANGA group. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The oldest is 10 and the youngest two years old. Three of her children go to school. She is responsible for supporting five persons. 

She has been selling condiments and vegetables for four years. The other members of this group are weavers. Mme Angèle buys her goods at the Secteur 10 market. Her customers are women, men and her neighbors. 

With the loan she wants to buy one sack of onions, one sack of ripe tomatoes, and some spices. 

Her savings will be used to pay school fees for her children. Her ambitions are to insure the school fees of her children and to buy herself a motorbike to make it easier to get around for her business needs.

loans.use: to buy one sack of onions, one sack of ripe tomatoes, and some spices.

loans.name: Sadafmo

texts.ru:
Садафмо трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она вдова и любящая мать 4 детей. Когда её муж покинули их, им было, очень трудно смерится с этим трудным незабываемым испытание жизни. Она думала, как зарабатывать деньги, чтобы кормит своих детей. Она решила, что купля продажей фрукты и овощи даст ей хороший прибыль и более 16 лет она занимается этим. Её дети помогает ей, и они купили автомашину для перевозкой продуты. Она хотела бы получит займ в размере 2300$ США для покупки бахчевых культур. Она надеется, что кредиторы будет поддерживать её. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Sadafmo is a hardworking and conscientious woman. She is a widow and a loving mother of 4 children. When her husband passed away it was very hard for her family to come to terms with the cruel turn in their lives. Sadafmo worried how to make enough money to feed her children. She decided that selling fruits and vegetables at the market would provide enough income for her family and has been successful in this business for the last 16 years. Her children help her out as well and they purchased a car for easier transport of the produce from the farms to the market. Currently Sadafmo would like to take out a loan of 2300 US dollars to purchase melons and squash to sell. She hopes that the lenders will support her loan.

loans.use: to purchase cucurbits (melon, watermelon, cucumber, squash)

loans.name: Takku Ligguey Group

texts.fr:
TAKKU LIGGUEY est un groupe de cinq femmes mariées, membres d'un grand "mbotaay" (groupe de solidarité) qui compte 50 femmes, habitantes toutes dans la même ville.Ce "mbotaay" se réunit chaque dimanche mais aussi le 05 de chaque mois. Le dimanche, chaque femme cotise 1100F; les 1000f sont remis à tour de rôle comme subvention à une femme soit 50000F pour l'appuyer dans ses activités. Les 100f restants sont bloqués dans la caisse qui a aujourd'hui un solde de 415000F. Le 05 de chaque mois, chaque femme cotise 3000f dont 2500(soit un total de 87000) sont refinancés en crédit revolving et les 500f ( soit 25000), bloqués en caisse.
Les cinq membres du groupe TAKKU LIGGUEY sont toutes mariées.Elles exercent dans le commerce de produits alimentaires et font aussi de la teinture de divers tissus .Les revenus issus de ces activités leur permettent de satisfaire leurs besoins vestimentaires, sanitaires mais aussi et surtout d'améliorer l'alimentation de leurs familles respectives.Le chef de groupe ( qu a la main levée) fait du commerce de draps de lit, de rideaux en plus de la teinture.Elle cultive également un champs d'arachide et un champs de mil.La récolte de mil est consommée par la famille alors que celle d'arachide est vendu sur le marché local.Le groupe sollicite un pret de 100000F pour l'achat de 5 rouleaux de tissu et de produits colorants.Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison et de la mettre en location.
texts.en:
TAKKU LIGGUEY is a group of five married women who are members of a big "mbotaay" (solidarity group) which comprises 50 women who all live in the same town. This "mbotaay" gets together every Sunday but also on the 05th of each month. On Sundays, each woman contributes 1100F; the 1000f are given by turn as a subsidy to a woman i.e. 50000F to help her in her activites.The remaining 100f are retained in the fund which now has a balance of 415000F.The 05th of each month, each woman contributes 3000f of which 2500 (that is a total of 87000) is used to finance the revolving credit and the 500f are retained in the fund.
The five members of the TAKKU LIGGUEY group are all married. They practise the commerce of food products and also the dyeing of various fabrics. The income from these activities enables them to meet their needs in clothing and sanitation but also and above all to improve the staple diet of their respective families. The leader of the group (who has her hand raised) sells bed linen, curtains, and dye. She also cultivates a field of ground nuts and a field of millet. The harvest of the millet crop is consumed by the family whereas that of the groundnut is sold at the local market. She aims to build her own house and to rent it out. The group requests a loan of 100000F for the purchase of 5 rolls of fabric and dye products.

loans.use: To purchase 5 rolls of  fabric and dye products.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo tiene 22 años, es casado y sin hijos, es de la ciudad de Paraguarí. Vive en su casa propia con su esposa. Juntos trabajan para la manutención de la casa y para el sustento diario.
Arnaldo se dedica a la venta ambulante hace más de 6 años, y  hace un año aproximadamente su esposa también comenzó a trabajar en el mismo oficio ya que con el obtienen muy buenos ingresos. Comentan que tienen ya una clientela bien formada. Gracias a su amabilidad con los clientes son muy conocidos en la zona. Uno de los sueños del cliente es poder tener algún día un local propio donde ofrecer los productos que vende.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de frazadas, zapatos, abrigos, para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is 22 years old, married, and has no children. He is from the city of Paraguarí. Arnaldo and his wife live in their own home. They both work in order to maintain their house and provide for their daily needs.

Arnaldo has worked as a traveling merchant for more than six years. A year ago, his wife began working in the same business and this has allowed them to generate very good income. They say that they have a well-established customer base. Thanks to their friendliness, they have become well-known among their customers in the area. One of Arnaldo’s dreams is to someday open a shop of his own where he can sell his products.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy blankets, shoes, and coats for eventual resale. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to him. Obtaining this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy blankets, shoes, and coats for eventual resale.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 47, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a laborer on construction sites. 

Hoa supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater range of products such as sugar, soft drinks and household items to stock her general store.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is from the village of Didi Chkoni. He is 36 years old, married and lives with his family: wife, Tamar; his 4-year-old son, his mother (retired) and his aunt (retired). 

Murad is leading the agro-business of the family. His mother helps him. They own two milk cows, the milk of which is used for cheese production. Cheese is sold on the local market. Also, they have 300 vine trees. Harvested grapes are used for wine-making. Murad sells wine locally. Along with the aforementioned activities, the family grows 300 nut trees and sells approximately 200 kilograms per year. 

Murad plans to purchase nuts with his received credit. The price of nuts is low now because of harvest season. He will sell them after four or five months, when the price increases. Murad plans to use the gained profit in wine-making, for purchasing different materials for wine production.

loans.use: to purchase nuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to create new lotions and increase stock.

loans.name: Wudha

texts.en:
Wudha is a 42-year-old divorced mother of three from the Negev. She has two businesses, a small grocery shop and seamstress services such as hemming and fixing clothes. She manages the two businesses and has learned the seasonal demand in both work well to ensure a constant income. Her clients come from her neighborhood and some from the surrounding areas.

Wudha needed this loan for both businesses to purchase shelves, stock for the grocery, a refrigerator, a sewing machine, and cloth.

Wudha wants to continue and expand her businesses and increase her income but her main goal is to ensure her children stay in school and study.

loans.use: To purchase shelves, stock for the market, a refrigerator, a sewing machine, and cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase office equipment and computer supplies.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is opening a Bridal Salon which will allow clients to rent dresses and undergo makeovers and hair styles for weddings and special events. Asia has business experience and currently sells Herbalife Dietary products. She will continue selling these products in her salon.  

Asia decided to open the salon after completing stylist courses and working with a wedding stylist in Beer Sheva to gain experience. She found a business owner who was looking to sell her dresses and salon furniture.  Asia's village has a definite demand for the bridal salon and no others exist in her area.

She needs this loan to purchase the second-hand salon furnishings, including a stylist chair, a makeover station and rental dresses.

Asia wants to establish a multi-purpose bridal salon in her village which will one day serve outlying areas as well while providing for her three children.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand set of  salon furnishings, including stylist chair, makeover station and rental dresses.

loans.name: Butina

texts.en:
Due to issues of modesty, Butina's brother is pictured here. Butina is a 27-year-old mother of four from the Negev region, with an elementary school education.  She wants to expand her sheep and goat raising business. Right now Butina raises the livestock for sale at the marketplace, specifically for their meat. Her business has seasonal activity and potential, especially during the holiday season. Since the sale of the animals is seasonal, Butina is taking the opportunity during slow times to raise young sheep and goats and increase her herd gradually.

Butina needs this loan to purchase additional sheep and goats, build a shaded pen area, and purchase feed for her livestock.

Butina wants to expand her business with an additional 30 head of livestock. This loan will assist her in executing half of the expansion. Her dream is to ensure her business stays successful and helps her pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional sheep and goats, build a shaded pen area, and to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora tiene 64 años, está casada con el Señor Juan, quien es D. profesión albañil, tienen 2 hijos mayores D. edad, que trabajan en forma independiente, viven en la ciudad D. Paraguarí.
Aurora posee una despensa hace más D. 20 años en su propio domicilio, su marido actualmente se encuentra trabajando en la Argentina, su hijo el mayor trabaja en una empresa privada y su hija es D. profesión docente. Uno D. sus sueños es poder ampliar su negocio y D. esa forma poder ofrecer más comodidades a sus clientes y además tener más capacidad D. almacenamiento.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, carnes y demás que le servirá para abastecer su negocio y D. esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda D. ellos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta les brinda.
texts.en:
Sra. Aurora is 64 years old and married to Sr. Juan, who is a professional mason. They have two grown children who work independently. They live in the city of Paraguarí.

Aurora has managed a food pantry for more than 20 years from her home. Her husband is currently working in Argentina. Her older son works for a private company and her daughter is in the teaching profession. One of her dreams is to expand her business so that she can offer more amenities to her customers and increase her storage capacity.

She is requesting a loan to buy food products, beverages, dairy products, meats, and other items to restock her business. This will allow her to meet the demand for these products. Aurora is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy food products, beverages, dairy products, meats, and other items.

loans.name: Mbootu Diam Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "MBOOTU DIAM" est composé de cinq femmes mariées.Elles vendent des produits alimentaires et du sel et les revenus de ce commerce leur permettent de satisfaire leurs besoins personnels tout en participant aux dépenses d'alimentation de leurs familles.Leur groupe est membre d'un grand " mbotaay" (groupe de solidarité)qui regroupe 50 femmes de leur localité.Les femmes bénéficie de ce "mbotaay" d'une subvention chaque dimanche en plus d'un crédit revolving organisé en début de chaque mois."MBOOTU DIAM" est est dirigé par une femme dont l'activité principale est le commerce de sel.Elle dispose d'un lopin de terre dans la lagune qui ceinture la ville.Elle récolte le sel, le traite avant de le vendre aux boutiquiers détaillants.Son ambition est de construire un magasin un magasin au marché pour stocker et revendre son produit.Le groupe sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 250000F pour acheter du sel, de la patte d'arachide et de l'huile de palm.
texts.en: The "MBOOTU DIAM" group is made up of five married women. They sell food products and salt and the income from this trade enables them to meet their personal needs as well as participating in their families’ food expenditure .Their group is a member of a large “mbotaay" (solidarity group) which brings together 50 women in their neighbourhood. The women benefit from this " mbotaay" in the form of a subsidy each Sunday as well as a revolving credit organised at the beginning of each month. ” MBOOTU DIAM" is led by a woman whose principal activity is the commerce of salt. She has a plot of land in the lagoon which surrounds the town. She collects the salt, treats it, and then sells it to the retail shopkeepers. Her ambition is to build a shop at the market for the storage and sale of her product. The group requests a loan of 250000F from the UIMCEC for the purchase of salt, peanut butter, and palm oil.

loans.use: to puchase  salt,peanut butter and palm oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is an ambitious 30-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. Since the year 2007, she has been operating a retail shop so as to meet the needs of her family. She supplements her income from the earnings she get from dairy farming. In the next five years, she wants to be running a successful business, and her dream is to be a wholesaler. 

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, wheat flour, rice salt and beans. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, rice salt and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is an active 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with a three-year-old child who has begun attending school. Susan earns a living by selling second-hand shoes and would very much like to expand her business over the next five years. She is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more shoes to sell to her customers. She is grateful to all Faulu Kenya supporters for allowing her to start and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Pamela Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Pamela es casada, tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar sus actividades dentro del seno familiar y movilidad propia consistente en una motocicleta.
Ella se dedica al lavado de ropas dentro de toda la ciudad de Pilar. Desarrolla esta actividad hace como 2 años, posee la infraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de esta actividad y su lavandería es muy reconocida por la excelente calidad de los productos utilizados para su actividad. Sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y de esa forma tener más capacidad para atender la demanda de sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima como ser detergentes, aromatizantes, suavizantes y demás utensilios necesarios para la realización de su labor. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Pamela, 20, is married and lives in the city of Pilar.  She has her own house where she has the basic conditions to run her business within the bosom of her family.  She also has her own mode of transportation: a motorcycle.

She washes clothes from throughout the city of Pilar.  She’s been in this occupation for about two years.  She has the necessary infrastructure to carry out this work and her laundry is very well known because of the excellent quality of products she uses.  She dreams with being able to expand the business and be able to have more capacity to meet customer demand.

She is asking for the loan to buy raw materials like detergents, odor eliminators, fabric softener and other necessary utensils to carry out her work.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy laundry supplies.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya, and has been in active farming the last five years. He is age 24 and married. He also engages in a retail shop business to supplement his farming income.

Dominic has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help him venture into horticultural farming. He says he will use the money to purchase horticultural seeds and employ farmhands to till the land. He adds that he hopes to generate enough income and purchase land for a large-scale horticultural farming business.

Dominic says says the challenge in business is the high competition he has experienced lately. He is full of praises for Juhudi Kilimo for its support for smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To pay for horticultural seeds and farmhand labor.

loans.name: Iza

texts.en:
Iza is from the village of Kvishilori, Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is 37 years old and lives with her 19-year-old daughter, her 18-year-old son and her 73-year-old mother-in-law. Both children are students of a high school. 

Iza is leading the agricultural activities of the family. They have three cows from which Iza produces 60 kg of cheese per month and sells it on the local market. Also, the family has one pig and nine piglets. Piglets are sold locally and seasonally. Also, Iza is busy with wine-making. She makes wine by the grapes harvested from 800 family-owned vine-trees. The total average monthly income of the family, including the pension of Iza’s mother-in-law, is 680 Laris. 

Iza requests credit for paying the study fees for her children at the high school. It is very important for her to allow her children to get a quality education for ensuring their sustainable future.

loans.use: to pay high-school study fees for her children.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is a hardworking 43-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children who are school-going. She has been operating a retail shop so as to meet the needs of her family. She makes extra shilling by engaging in dairy farming.  

In the next five years, she wants to have at least seven dairy cows. Her dream is to be financially stable. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals, paraffin and a cow. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals, paraffin and a cow.

loans.name: Ramiro Epifanio

texts.es:
Ramiro de 45 años cuenta con mucho orgullo que quien le heredó su profesión fué su padre. Negocio que ha solventado sus necesidades. Dice que no hace mucho esfuerzo para conseguir clientes ya que ellos mismos se encargan de referir su buen trabajo y así tienen mas ingresos y reconocimiento.
Como todo negocio si no tiene la materia prima para producir se le dificulta el trabajo. Su trabajo requiere máquinas especiales las cuales espera poder comprar en el futuro con un préstamo.
texts.en: Ramiro is 45 years old and is very proud of the profession that was passed on to him by his father.  His business enables him to meet his needs.  He says that it does not take much effort to obtain customers because he gets referrals as a result of doing a good job.  This helps him gain more income and recognition.  Like all businesses, Ramiro does not have materials to be productive, which makes his job difficult.  His work requires special machines, which he hopes to buy in the future with a loan.

loans.use: to buy wood, lacquer, paint, and glue.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a hardworking 34-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children who are going to school. For the last 7 years, Grace has been selling scrap metal to make a living. Previously, she used to cultivate crops.  Grace wants in the next 5 years to have a metal manufacturing plant. Her dream is to own a piece of land. She is requesting for a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy more scrap metal and to renovate her store. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to save.

loans.use: buy scrap metal and renovate her store

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa nace hace más de tres años gracias a la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, en estos más de dos años de intenso trabajo, ellas han crecido tanto social como económicamente. Son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. Su principal objetivo es el desarrollo integral de todas las miembros, dentro de un ambiente de respeto y solidaridad.
La Señora Alicia se dedica a la venta de ropas, gracias a este trabajo ella logra obtener los medios necesarios para mantener su hogar y paliar los gastos diarios. Manifiesta que le gusta lo que hace ya que es un trabajo honesto y humilde. Sueña con tener un local propio donde ofrecer las ropas que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de invierno, pues es temporada fría y tiene mucha demanda. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, pues, le será de gran ayuda en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa communal bank was born more than three years ago through the management and support of another communal bank that was working in the same place.  This communal bank is from the city of San Lorenzo. In these more than two years of intense work, the members have grown as much socially as economically.  They are known in the area for being very hard-working.

They define themselves as fighting, hard-working women. Their main objective is the integral development of all members, in an atmosphere of respect and solidarity.

Alicia sells clothing. Through this work, she has succeeded in obtaining the necessary means to maintain her household. She says that she likes what she does, since it is honest, humble work. She dreams of having her own shop, where she would offer the clothing she sells.

She is asking for the loan to purchase winter clothing, since it's the cold season and she has a lot of demand for it. She is very hopeful regarding the loan, because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Alba Jacqueline

texts.es:
Desde que era muy pequeña Alba se interesó y se inclinó por ser costurera, cuando terminó su primaria estudió en una academía de costura en Guayaquil y actualmente realiza confecciones en general ejerciendo su profesión ya de esto 15 años. Ademas le gusta el comercio por lo cuál vende productos Avon a sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios como costurera.}

Ella empieza su jornada desde las 7H00 am y cierra a las 8H00 de la noche dependiendo mucho de la demanda que tenga la costura sale a ofrecer tambíén sus productos como una ayuda adicional.
Junto a su esposo tienen dos niños de 11 y 9 años los cuales estudian en la escuela fiscal que queda frente a su casa.

Para seguir adelante ellas necesita una máquina industrial de costura, por eso son sus dificultades al terminal sus obras, su sueño es terminar de construir su casa y comprar su máquina industrial para lo que necesita el prestamo y brindarles comodidas al hogar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
As a young girl, Alba was interested in and inclined to becoming a seamstress. When she finished elementary school, she attended a sewing academy in Guayaquil. She now sews full-time as her profession and has been doing this for 15 years. Alba also likes the retail business, so she sells Avon products to her customers who request her services as a seamstress.

Her daily work schedule begins at 7am and ends at 8pm, depending on how much sewing she has to do. She will leave to go offer her products as an additional source of income. Alba and her husband have two children, ages 11 and 9, who attend the public school across from their house.

Looking ahead, Alba needs an industrial sewing machine because she has had difficulties with finishing her jobs. Her dream is to finish the construction of her house and to buy her industrial machine. Therefore, she needs this loan so that she can provide her children the comforts of home.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, cosmetics, and construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter  is a hardworking 38-year-old business man. He is married and blessed with two school-going children. For the last 7 years, he has been operating a grocery store to make a living. He also makes extra income by engaging in farming.  He wants in the next 5 years to have opened up a distribution channel for groceries. His dream is to cultivate his own grocery products.

Peter is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes and carrots. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to learn business management skills and expand his business.

loans.use: buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes and carrots

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hard working 35-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with a 15 year-old-child who is going to school. For the last 3 years, Mary has been engaged in dairy farming to make a living. She also makes extra income by rearing pigs for sale. She wants in the next 5 years to be living her dreams. Her dream is to own a herd of cattle and pigs. 

Mary is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy animal feed and pigs. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has been able to acquire business management skills.

loans.use: buy animal feed and pigs

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 37-year-old married woman with 2 children, one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Dung's husband earns a living as a truck driver. 

Dung earns an income to support her family by selling basic goods such as rice cake, instant noodles, snack foods, shampoos, soaps and soft drinks, from the front of her house. Dung would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of these items directly from wholesalers so that she can sell her products at more competitive prices. She believes that this will help her attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. 

Dung hopes that through this loan she will earn a higher income and be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy sugar, rice and soap

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 43 years old.  She is married and has a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh city. 

Hue's husband earns money as a delivery tricycle driver for hire. Hue supports her family by sewing clothes at her house.  She intends to use her loan to buy fabric and other materials to increase her production.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help to improve her family's living conditions and send her children to school. She also hopes to be able to save to buy a computer for her children's studies.

loans.use: buy fabric and sewing materials

loans.name: Mzinga Group

texts.en:
Ismail, who is in his late 40s, is married and has two children who are going to school.  He has been operating a furniture-mart since 1980.  He works from 8 am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to buy more wood to make more furniture.  His dream is to one day be able to buy a machine to cut and plane wood.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mzinga", which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 45 years old and married. Her husband helps her run a general store in front of their home. They have 3 sons. 

Hue's shop sells a variety of common household goods such as shampoo, soy sauce, sugar, toothbrushes, and soft drinks. Hue started her business in 1991 and it has remained the main source of income for her to cover her family's expenses.

Hue is requesting a loan to purchase stocks of different goods such as cooking oils, detergent and milk to sell in her general store. She hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase her income and support her family.

loans.use: stock merchandise for her store

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
