El presente comité es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, se formó gracias a que una de las miembros oyó hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, entonces lo comentó a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surgió el grupo denominado San Vicente. Actualmente cuenta con 12 integrantes donde todas ellas trabajan de forma responsable y solidaria, dentro de un ambiente de respeto.
La señora Hilda se dedica a la venta de comestibles desde hace ya varios años, se considera una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada, pues su trabajo implica mucho esfuerzo, ya que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para elaborar los alimentos que vende. Gracias a su amabilidad ha logrado formarse una clientela bien definida. Sueña con poder tener un local propio donde vender sus alimentos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y demás. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This committee is from the city of Carapeguá.  It was formed thanks to one of the members hearing about the program for entrepreneurial woman.  She then mentioned it to her friends and neighbors, and from there the group named San Vicente was created.  There are currently 12 members, who all work in a responsible and united manner, and in an atmosphere of respect.

Señora Hilda has been working selling food for the last several years.  She thinks of herself as a striving woman who is willing to make sacrifices.  Her work requires a great deal of effort, as every day she gets up very early to make the food she sells.  Thanks to her friendliness, she has been able to put together a solid customer base.  

She dreams of having her own premises from where she can sell her food.

She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients that she will use in making the foods she sells, such as meat, vegetables, condiments and additional items.  She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it is providing her.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 50 years old and singL.. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past ten years, Ha has run a general store in the local community and earns an income from this business for cover all her expenditures. 

Ha's shop sells mainly food and basic household items for the peopL. in her community, such as instant noodles, confectionery, shampoo, clothes hangers, paper tissues, and cigarrettes. 

Ha is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of basic goods (in particular snacks and confectionery) to sell in her general store. She hopes that through this loan she will be abL. to generate more income and save enough money to cover family emergencies.

loans.use: buy household items to sell in her store

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 40 years old and is the mother of three children. She is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thuy and her husband run a food stall, which they have been operating for over 1 year. They sell noodles and many kinds of dishes for breakfast and lunch. 

Thuy is requesting a loan to buy new furniture for her stall and purchase more types of food to sell. She hopes that will helps her earn more money so she can reinvest in her current business and save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy new furniture and food for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials (such pork and other ingredients) for the production and sale of pies

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc, age 27, operates an Internet shop with her husband. They have been engaged in this business, located in front of their house in Ho Chi Minh City, since 2008. The business is able to generate sufficient income to cover all their family's expenses, as well as to cover the study fees for the IT courses that they are currently enrolled in. They have one daughter. 

Truc would like to request a loan to improve her business by buying more computers and appliances, and to make repairs to her shop so as to attract more customers. She is confident that these additions will help her to run her business smoothly, earn a higher income, and save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy more computers and appliances for her Internet shop, and to make repairs to her shop so as to attract more customers

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Zulfa has operated a fruit and vegetable business since 2010.  She works from 6 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. She is in her early 30s and is single with one child who is enrolled in school.

This will be Zulfa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her business and to pay household expenses, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She intends to use this loan buy more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale. Her dream is someday to be able to buy a plot of land.

She will share this loan with her loan group. The group is called Sarafina and is comprised of a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a businesswoman who owns and operates a cafeteria.  She started the business two years ago and has employed two people. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save money. She has also been trained in business management. This has helped her to run her business well. 
 
Regina hopes to own a big hotel in the future.  

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy vegetables, sugar, and maize flour to use in food preparation.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sugar, and maize flour to use in food preparation

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is from the village Kveda Sakara, Zestaponi district. He is 49 years old and lives with his big family: wife Mary, two sons (24 and 21 years old), daughter-in-law and 2 twin granddaughter twin, 2 years old. 

Malkhaz works as a shepherd in the village. His elder son works as a driver and the younger one works in a security service company. Along with their jobs, all family members are involved in family agricultural activities. In particular, they have 3 milk cows, 2 calves and 3 sheep. Mary produces approximately 60 kg of cheese per month and sells it at the Zestaponi open market. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns 0.8 hectare of land where fruits and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold in the same place, the Zestaponi open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 laris.

Malkhaz requested credit to purchase 1 milk cow and 5-6 sheep. After the purchase of additional domestic animals, they will be able to increase cheese production and sell on average 30-35% more cheese in the market. It will positively impact the income of the family. Malkaz and Mary plan to use the increase in income for purchasing additional household goods in order to improve family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and 5-6 sheep

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is a rice merchant. She’s 37 and married with 2 children. Her husband is a truck driver. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lan sells rice in front of her house and she is open for business the whole day. She is currently asking for a loan to purchase many different varieties of rice in bulk from wholesalers. This will enable her to offer her customers good quality rice at more competitive prices and help her to attract additional customers.

Her goal is to increase her sales and income from her business in order to better meet her family's needs and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: o buy many kinds of rices in bulk to sell to customers

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.  He has been operating a welding workshop for five years.  He has employed three people to assist him in the business.  He has managed to retain his business for five years because of his good services.  David hopes to become financially stable in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy metal bars.

loans.use: to buy metal bars

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 D. Diciembre es D. la ciudad D. Villa Elisa, está integrado por 19 mujeres D. la misma ciudad. Todas ellas trabajan dentro D. un ambiente D. cooperación, respeto y solidaridad. El grupo se encuentra en el noveno ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya.
Toda ellas se definen como mujeres jefas D. familia que tienen como objetivo primordial la obtención D. mayores ingresos para cada una D. la integrantes y el desarrollo integral D. cada una.
La señora Ángela se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, este es su medio D. ingresos económicos. Se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Trabaja todos los días, con mucho sacrificio para poder brindarle a su familia una vida decorosa y digna. Quiere ampliar, algún día su negocio con lo cual podrá almacenar más bebidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. bebidas como ser whiskys, cervezas, vinos, energizantes y demás bebidas para abastecer su local. Con esto podrá atraer a más clientes y ofrecerles más variedad. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito ya que le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The “8 D. Diciembre” committee is from the city of Villa Elisa.  It has 19 women members from that city.  They all work together in a cooperative, respectful and mutually supportive atmosphere.  The group is in Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras Program’s ninth cycle.

They all define themselves as women heads of household whose main objective is to earn higher income for each of the members and for each of their integral development.

Ángela sells beverages.  This is her source of livelihood.  She considers herself to be a very hardworking, tenacious woman.  She works every day with much sacrifice to proviD. her family with a decent, decorous life.  She wants to expand her business someday to be able to store more beverages.

She requests the loan to buy beverages like whiskey, beer, wine, energy drinks and other beverages o stock her store.  With this, she’ll be able to attract more customers and offer more variety.  The loan makes her hopeful because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy whiskey, beer, wine, energy drinks and other stock items.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La señora Betty tiene una ferretería que es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para comprar tornillos, lijas, cables, clavos, y toros insumos propios del negocio para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Betty  se enfermó y tuvo un gasto en los medicamentos y su hospitalización y tuvo que utilizar parte del dinero dedicado a su ferretería para el pago. Es casada tiene dos hijos y vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona de las Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz. Betty está muy satisfecha con los préstamos que le otorgamos anteriormente, pues uno de ellos fue a través de Kiva, ya que pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Betty has a hardware store that serves as a source of income by which she can support her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy screws, sandpaper, cables, nails, and other supplies for her business so that she can meet the demand of her customers. Betty became ill and accumulated bills for hospitalization and medicines. She had to use part of the money designated for her hardware store to pay her medical bills. Betty is married and has two children. She lives at the home of her in-laws in the District of Las Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz.

Betty is very pleased with the loans that she received previously, including the ones issued through Kiva. They have enabled her to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy screws, sandpaper, cables, nails, and other supplies.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, age 23 and unmarried, runs a retail shop where he sells auto spare parts. He has been engaged in this business for three years. He started by selling only motorbike and bicycle spare parts and has successfully expanded into auto parts sales. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management.  This has helped him to improve his business. Christopher hopes to expand his business and attract more clients in the future. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy shocks, springs, and oil.

loans.use: to buy shocks, springs, and oil for his auto parts sales business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La señora Miriam tiene un puesto de venta de maní azucarado; esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para comprar en mayor cantidad maní y azúcar, fabricar el producto, embolsarlo y venderlo. Es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta será la cuarta vez que su solicitud de crédito es enviada a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sra. Miriam has a stand where she sells sugar-coated peanuts. This business provides a source of income by which she can support her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy peanuts and sugar in bulk so that she can assemble, package, and sell her product. Miriam is married and has two children. She lives in a rental property in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time she has requested a loan, which is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sugar.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, age 29, has been practicing mixed farming for the past six years. Previously, she sold furniture to earn a living. She testifies that she has lifted up her standard of living through Faulu Kenya. She and her husband have two children, both enrolled in school.

Rose dreams of having a well-established business in the future. She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: La señora Gisela es dueña de un vehiculo  su esposo es chofer del mismo; el crédito lo necesita para pagar el costo de la reparación del sistema de frenos, que últimamente están dando problemas; esto le ayudara a que su trabajo sea mas seguro para  los pasajeros pues esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tienen para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Gisela is the owner of a vehicle that is driven by her husband. She needs this loan to pay the cost of repairing the brake system, which has been causing problems lately. This will make the vehicle safe for her passengers since this business is the source of income by which she supports her family. Gisela is married and has no children. She lives at her parents’ house in the District of San Martin in the city of La Paz.

This is the fifth time she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of repairing the brake system in her taxi.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar, age 51, is a farmer from the village of Pirveli Sviri. She and her husband Zurab earn a living through a family agricultural business. Specifically, they have three milk cows, three calves and a bull. Tamar produces cheese from the milk and sells it at the local market. The family also has three pigs. They sell approximately 30 piglets per year. Along with keeping domestic animals, Tamar and Zurab own one hectare of land, where they grow various fruits and vegetables. They sell the harvested produce at the local market as well. 

Tamar has requested a loan in order to purchase an additional milk cow. In this way, she will be able to increase the production and sale of cheese and their monthly income will increase. Tamar and Zurab plan to reinvest the received profit into a further expansion of their agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: El señor Rafael es empleado en una empresa de seguridad; trabaja como cajero. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la cancelación de un curso superior en el área de contabilidad. Es soltero y tiene un hijo y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de las Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Rafael is an employee of an insurance company where he works as a cashier.  This job is the source of income by which he can support his family.  The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for a college accounting course.  Rafael is single and has a son.  He lives with his parents in the District of Las Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.  

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a college accounting course so that he can advance in his job.

loans.name: Paraiso Perdido Group

texts.es: L. SRA GUILLIANA D. 36 AÑOS D. EDAD,MADRE SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS EN ETAPA ESCOLAR,ES SOCIA D. GRUPO PARAISO PERDIDO.L. SRA GUILLIANA EN L. ACTUALIDAD SE DEDICA A L.  VENTA D. COMIDA  EN UN PUESTO AMBULATORIO QUE ESTA UBICADO EN L. PLAZA PRINCIPAL D. IZCUCHACA,POR LAS TARDES L. SRA GUILLIANA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A L. VENTA D. BOLLOS Y EMPANADAS.L. SRA GUILLIANA SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA  Y ASI PODER IMPLEMENTAR SU NEGOCIO CON UNA GRAN VARIEDAD D. PRODUCTOS. L. SRA GUILLIANA QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO PODER TENER SU  PROPIO RESTURANTE  PARA ASI PODER OBTENER MAS INGRESOS .L. SRA GUILLIANA SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA A LADO IZQUIERDO D. L. SRA QUE VISTE  UN POLO COLOR CELESTE .L. SRA GUILLIANA  VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR NEGRO Y TIENE LAS MANOS CRUZADAS.
texts.en:
Sra. Guilliana is 36 years old and a single mother with two school-age children. She is a member of the group “Paraíso Perdido” (Paradise Lost). Sra. Guilliana currently sells food in the afternoons from a mobile street cart in the main plaza of Izcuchaca. She also sells buns and turnovers.

Sra. Guilliana is requesting a loan so that she can buy more supplies to keep her business in operation and help her offer a wiD. variety of products. In the future, she wants to have her own restaurant so that she can earn more income.

In the photograph, Sra. Guilliana is the woman who is wearing a black sweater and has her arms crossed.

loans.use: to buy more supplies.

loans.name: Lotus Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a tailor. She has run her tailoring business for five years now and works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily. Through her business, she is able to make a small monthly profit. Joyce is in her late 20s and is single with one small child. 
  
This will be Joyce's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She intends to use her loan to buy a Zig-Zag machine and linning material for her business. 

Her dream is someday to be able to build her own house.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group, "Lotus," which has a total of 18 members. They will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy a Zig-Zag machine and linning material for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a una de las miembros, la cual escuchó del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y luego de eso juntó a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio y de allí surge el grupo denominado Mujeres Trabajadoras, el cual está integrado por 16 miembros. Todas trabajan de forma solidaria y honesta. Ellas se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables en cuanto al cumplimiento de sus obligaciones.
La presidenta es la señora Olga, es una señora muy alegre, responsable, trabajadora, ella vive con sus hijos en su humilde casita. Ella es modista, comenta que tiene mucho trabajo y que día a día lucha con miras hacia un solo objetivo, el cual es brindarle a sus hijos un futuro mejor y una vida digna y decorosa. Su principal sueño es que sus hijos se conviertan en grandes profesionales y que por medio de sus estudios sean alguien en la vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, kits de hilos, agujas y demás que son elementos indispensables para su profesión
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to one of the members who heard about the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Enterprising Women] Program and she gathered a group of friends and neighbors to form a group that they called “Mujeres Trabajadoras” [Working Women] and which has 16 members.  They all work together in an honest, mutually supportive way.  They define themselves as hardworking women who are responsible with respect to their obligations.

Olga is the President.  She’s a cheerful, responsible, hardworking woman living with her children in a humble little house.  She’s a seamstress and she comments that she has quite a bit of work and that she strives day to day with just one goal in mind: to provide her children with a better future and a proper, decent life.  Her main dream is that her children become great professionals and that through their schooling they become someone in life.

She asks for the loan to buy fabric, thread kits, needles and the other indispensable items needed for her profession.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, pins and others.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo, tiene la edad 55 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa cuatro hijos y la suegra. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con un terreno cultivado con café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un  buen cafetal que de buena producción para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Bernardo is 55 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife, their four children and his mother-in-law.  He plans to use his loan for his coffee plantings.  He has some fields planted with coffee and he plans to invest the money in fertilizers and fungicides in order to obtain a better harvest.  He wants to establish a good coffee crop that will yield good production so that he can sell high quality coffee.  Bernardo wants to generate as much income as possible for his own well-being and that of his family.  And wants to grow his coffee business.  This is the first loan that Bernardo has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not previously taken any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with easy payments plans and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: with his coffee crop

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the village of Tuzi, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is 38 years old, married and lives with his family: wife Nana, two daughters (3 and 1 years old) and parents (retired).

David is a joiner and performs different orders for clients. Along with his main job, he is involved in family agriculture. The family owns 2 pigs. They sell approximately 20 piglets per year. Also they own 1 hectare of land where various vegetables and fruits are grown. Along with the aforementioned, the family sells nuts harvested from 60 nut trees. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 laris. 

David requested credit to purchase a milk cow. He will produce cheese and sell it together with fruits and vegetables. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: La señora Rufina se dedica a la venta de comida específicamente sopa de pescado y su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil. Ambas activididades combinadas son la fuente de ingresos que tienen para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de papa, chuño y pescado, que son los ingredientes principales para su sopa de pescado. Es casada y no tiene hijos; vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de las San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Rufina sells food, particularly fish soup, while her husband works as a masonry assistant. Both of these combined activities are the source of income by which they have to maintain their family. Rufina needs this loan to buy potatoes, “chuño” (freeze-dried potatoes), and fish since these are the main ingredients used in preparing her fish soup. She is married and has no children. Rufina lives in her own home in the District of San Martin in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, “chuño” (freeze-dried potatoes), and fish.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, tiene la edad 33 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con una plantación de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar una buena plantación que genere una gran producción para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de producción café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rolando is 33 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and their two children.  Rolando plans to use the loan for his coffee crop.  He has a coffee farm and plans to invest the money in supplies such as fertilizers, labor and fungicides in order to obtain a better harvest.  Rolando wants to establish a good crop that can generate a high yield so that he can sell quality coffee.  He wants to generate as much income as possible for his own well-being and that of his family.  He also wants to grow his coffee business.  This is the first loan that Rolando has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had never before taken out a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with easier payment plans and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: with his coffee crop.

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.ru:
Василь родом из Ивано-Франковска. Он зарабатывает на жизнь транспортными перевозками пассажиров по территории Украины. Он женат и у него двое детей: 11-летний сын и годовалая дочка. У Василя нет проблем с заказами – у него есть и постоянные клиенты и отменная репутация. На этом рынке услуг Василь работает уже 12 лет. Его доход составляет 5 000 гривен. На данный момент он работает на собственном автомобиле Опель Астра 2006 года выпуска, состояние автомобиля – прекрасное. 

Василю необходим кредит на сумму 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы установить газобаллонное оборудование 4-го поколения с впрыскиванием для работы автомобиля на сжиженной газе, а также для текущего ремонта машины. После переоборудования автомобиля для работы на сжиженном газе уменьшатся затраты на заправку, что приведет к увеличению прибыли. Работа Василя – главный источник доходов для семьи клиента. Раньше Василь работал в милиции, но потом рассчитался и начал заниматься пассажирскими перевозками, так как не было других вариантов обеспечить семью. Его главная мечта – дать детям возможность получить высшее образование в свое время. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Vasil was born in Ivano-Frankivsk.  He makes his living driving passengers around the Ukraine.  He's married with two children: an eleven-year-old son, and a one-year-old daughter.  He has no trouble getting business.  He has regular customers and an excellent reputation.  He's been in the business for twelve years and makes 5000 hryvni.  At present he uses his own car, a 2006 Opel Astra.  It's in great condition.

Vasil needs a loan of 10,000 hryvni to install a fourth generation fuel injection system so his car can run on LP gas, and also do some routine repairs. By converting his car to LP gas, he'll lower his fuel  expenses and increase profits. Vasil provides the primary means of transportation for his clients' families.  Earlier he worked for the police, but he left that and got into driving passengers, since there were no other options for supporting his family.  Vasil's biggest dream is give his children a chance for highest possible education when the time comes.

loans.use: to install a 4th generation fuel injection system so his car can run on LP gas, and to make routine repairs on the car.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es: La señora Jeannette se dedica a la venta de ropa y su esposo trabaja en un laboratorio farmacéutico; es así como  obtienen los ingresos para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de chamarras, deportivos, poleras para caballero, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer mayor variedad. Es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia con su madre  ubicada en la zona de  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que canalizamos su crédito a través de los financiadotes en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Jeannette sells clothing and her husband works at a pharmaceutical lab. Their jobs are how they obtain income to support their family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy jackets, sportswear, and men’s t-shirts so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers and offer greater variety. Jeannette is married and has two children. She lives in her own home along with her mother in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that her loan has been referred to Kiva lenders for funding.

loans.use: to buy jackets, sportswear, and men’s t-shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees and to help his wife start a small business.

loans.name: Ngano Group

texts.en: Enock, who is in his late 40s, is married, and has five children who go to school, has been in the charcoal business for three years. He works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and makes a small monthly profit. This will be his third loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy sacks of charcoal, to pay school fees and for household expenses; he has paid back all of his loans successfully. Enock wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. His dream is to one day repair and renovate his house. He will share this loan with his loan group "Ngano", which has a total of 17 members who hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en: Darejan is from the village of Tskratskaro in the Imereti Region of western Georgia. She is 47 years old, married and lives with her husband, Amiran, and 29 year old son, David. Darejan is an agricultural produce trader. She purchases agricultural produce from wholesalers and sells them in Tbilisi, as well as nearby villages for higher prices. Along with the purchased produce, she also sells fruits and vegetables harvested on her family's 0.8 hectare land, as well as nuts harvested from 40 nut trees. Amiran and David are busy with their dairy farm – they have 2 milk cows, 3 calves and a bull. Amiran produces on average of 40 kg of cheese per month, which is sold by Darejan. The family's total average monthly income is 700 Laris. Darejan requested a loan to purchase agricultural produce for resale, which will increase the turnover of her micro-business and increase its profits, thereby allowing her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural produce for resale.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: La señora Verónica tiene un puesto de comida y se dedica a la venta de almuerzos; su esposo es empleado público. Con ambos ingresos logran mantener  a su familia. Verónica necesita el préstamo para comprar papa, arroz, aceite y verduras al por mayor para cocinar sus almuerzos y al mismo tiempo reducir costos. Es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la cuarta vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Verónica has a food stall where she sells breakfast. Her husband is a public employee. Both of these jobs provide income by which they can support their family. Verónica needs a loan to buy potatoes, rice, oil, and vegetables in bulk so that she can prepare breakfast meals and reduce her costs at the same time. She is married, has three children, and lives in a rental property located in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time that her loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, oil, and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Señor Luis es de Ciudad del Este, está casado y tiene dos hijos, uno en edad escolar. Él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Gracias a este trabajo y a la valiosa ayuda de su esposa, ellos pueden salir adelante.
Él se considera una persona honesta, trabajadora y muy responsable a la hora de cumplir con sus obligaciones. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia, ya que desea brindarles todo lo mejor. Su sueño es tener un local donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Además de todo comenta que su trabajo es muy minucioso ya que lleva tiempo y dedicación cuidar las hortalizas y frutas y luego venderlas. Gracias a su trabajo ha logrado formarse una buena clientela que siempre compran de el sus productos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de más frutas y verduras que le servirá para abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Luis is from Ciudad del Este.  He is married and has two children, one who is school-aged.  He makes his living selling fruits and vegetables.  Thanks to this work and valuable help from his wife, the family is able to get ahead.
Señor Luis considers himself to be an honest and hard-working person who is very responsible when it comes time to meet his obligations.  He says that everything he does is for the good of his family, since he wants to offer them the best of everything.  His dream is to have a small store in which to sell his products.  In addition, he says that he very meticulous in his work, since he has been been dedicated to taking care of produce and fruit for re-sale for a long time.  Thanks to his work, he has been able to develop a good clientele that always purchases their produce from him.
Señor Luis is requesting the loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables, which will help him to supply his business and meet his customers demands.  He is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are offering him, since getting the loan will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for re-sale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: La señora Eva elabora una serie de dulces para sahumerio (sahumerio es una tradición campesina donde se ofrecen dulces y otras cosas a la madre tierra) y su esposo es chofer. Así combinan  ingreso para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para comprar harina, azúcar, colorantes para fabricar los dulces. Es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de las San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Eva se encuentra muy satisfecha con su relación con Kiva y esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a canalizarse a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva prepares a series of sweets used for “sahumerio” (a rural tradition in which incense, candy, and other items are offered to Mother Earth). Her husband works as a chauffeur. Through these combined activities, Eva and her husband are able to maintain their family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy flour, sugar, and food coloring for making sweets. Eva is married and has three children. She lives in her own home in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.

Eva is very pleased with her relationship with Kiva. This is the second time that she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and food coloring.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz, también la socia vende fresas y también la socia vende chicha,chicharrones,gaseosas y cervezas, ella es propietaria de una picantería, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de maíz y ampliar el negocio de picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y también para implementar la picantería como para comprar sillas y mesas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “SAYHUA 3.”  The bank is located in Urubamba District, belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

The member is 41 years old, married and has 3 children.  She divides her day between her regular daily activities and her business buying and selling corn.  She also sells strawberries.  And she sells, chicha (maize liquor), cracklings, sodas and beer; she is the proprietor of a "picantería" (a restaurant serving shared plates of traditional food).  She works from 5:00a.m. until 11:00p.m.  Through this business, she is able to help her children to get ahead.  She wants to expand her corn selling business as well as her "picantería."  The member is requesting the loan to purchase corn and also to set up her "picantería" by purchasing chairs and tables. 

The member is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase corn and also to set up her "picantería" (a restaurant serving shared plates of traditional food) by purchasing chairs and tables.

loans.name: Jordin Joan

texts.es:
Jordin es un joven  estudiante de 18 años,  que cursa el tercer semestre en la especialidad de Ingeniería en Computación e Informática en la universidad privada Alas Peruanas (U.A.P.) hace año y medio. Sus padres son quienes le  apoyan en su educación. Desde que estuvo en el colegio le gustó las computadoras y es muy hábil en ello, se dedica casi  a tiempo completo en estudiar para seguir siendo uno de los primeros alumnos en su clase; tal lo demuestra sus notas. Sabe que se necesita mucha lógica en su carrera; por ello que aprovecha en sus cortos tiempo de descanso a jugar fútbol y escuchar música. 
Ser un egresado profesional competitivo es su mayor sueño. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo que le brindan a pesar de las dificultades de su hogar y éstos a la vez están orgullosos de él y sobre todo por el esfuerzo que Jordin les demuestra ya que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad de ser profesionales.
Al finalizar sus estudios en la universidad buscará un empleo que le permita solventar por sí mismo sus siguientes estudios de inglés; requisito indispensable en su profesión. Posteriormente se especializará en redes y telecomunicaciones.
El crédito que requiere lo invertirá en pagar la matrícula del cuarto semestre además de sus pensiones.
texts.en:
Jordin is a teen-age student, 18 years old.  He is in his third semester in the specialty of Computing and Information Engineering at the private university Alas Peruanas (U.A.P.), where he started a year and a half ago.  His parents are the ones who support him in his education.  Since he was in high school, Jordin has enjoyed computers, and he is very skilled with them.  He dedicates practically all of his time to his studies so that he can continue as one of the top students in his class, as shown by his grades.  He knows his field requires a lot of logic, which is why in his brief moments of spare time he takes the opportunity to play soccer and listen to music.
Jordin's greatest dream is to be a professional, competitive graduate.  He is grateful to his parents for the support they offer him in spite of difficulties at home.  And his parents, in turn, are proud of him, especially of the effort he has shown, since they themselves did not have the opportunity to be professionals.  
Upon finishing his studies at the university, Jordin will look for a job that will allow him to pay for his own studies in English, an indispensable requirement in his profession.  At a later date, he will specialize in web telecommunications.
The loan that Jordin needs will be invested in paying his fourth semester tuition and his boarding.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and boarding.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: El joven Domingo es una persona  responsable y  muy  trabajador, el   cual  se  preocupa   enormemente   en brindar  una excelente  calidad de  vida a  su  familia  ya  que  son lo mas  importante  en  su  vida, su  mayor  sueño es  acondicionar  su   domicilio es  por  ello  que  en  este  momento  requiere  pintar  el exterior  de  su  vivienda para   poder  brindar  una  mejor  imagen a su  hogar,agradece  el  apoyo   brindado   para  la realizacion de su proyecto.
texts.en: Young Domingo is a very hardworking and responsible person who is greatly concerned about providing an excellent quality of life for his family since they are what are most important in his life.  His greatest dream is to fix up his home and because of this he needs to paint the exterior of his dwelling now so that it will look better. He is grateful for the help provided him to undertake this project.

loans.use: to paint the exterior of his house.

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es: Marlin, tiene la edad 25 de  años, está casada y vive con su madre y tres hijos. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de novillos para el engorde. Ella cuenta con un potrero a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con pasto  para su engorde más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de novillos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marlin, who is 25 years old, is married and lives with her mother and three children. With this loan she hopes to buy young bulls to fatten up. She has a pasture in her possession and she expects to feed them grass to fatten them up more quickly. She wants her animals to have the ideal weight for their later sale at the local market or in other areas in the region. 

She wants to generate the majority of the profit for her well-being and that of her family, in addition to growing her business of raising young bulls. This is the first loan that she's received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy young bulls.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maura; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artefactos como radios, calculadoras y relojes, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artefactos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos como radios, calculadoras y relojes al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the SAYHUA 3 communal bank. The bank is located in Urubamba district, belonging to Urubamba province and Cusco department.

The member is Sra. Maura. She is 50 years of age and lives with her partner and has 4 children. Her daily activities are devoted to her business selling devices like radios, calculators and watches. She is a street vendor at the Urubamba market from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. She wishes to expand and improve her sales and requests the loan so she can purchase devices such as radios, calculators and watches wholesale. 

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy devices such as radios, calculators and watches wholesale.

loans.name: Puma Group

texts.en:
A., who is in his mid-20s, is married and has one child who is going to school.  He has been selling second-hand clothes for three years now. He works from 5:30 am to 7:30 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to buy more second-hand clothes to sell door-to-door. His dream is to one day own a shop where he can sell new clothes and shoes.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Puma" which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Green Machine Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 49 years old and comes from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is widowed and has three children, aged 23, 25 and 28. She also cares for two dependents. 

Rosemary runs a retail cross-border business selling clothes, blankets, duvets and stoves. Her business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenges she faces are import duties and high transport costs. 

Rosemary has requested a loan of $400 to buy DVDs, blankets and stoves. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her family members and neighborhood orphans to school. In the future, Rosemary plans to open several shops in Gweru town centre.

loans.use: To buy clothes, blankets, duvets and stoves to sell

loans.name: Ginelba

texts.es: La señora Ginelba se dedica a la venta de cd`s y también de videos musicales y de películas; su esposo es chofer y es dueño de un vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros. El crédito lo necesita para la reparación del motor de la movilidad del esposo, para que siga trabajando y ayude con los ingresos del hogar.  Ginelba es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz.  Ginelba se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, pues esta es la quinta vez que Kiva y sus financiadotes serán parte de este crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Ginelba sells CDs, music videos, and movies.  Her husband is a driver of a passenger transport vehicle that he owns.  Ginelba needs this loan to repair the motor of her husband’s vehicle so that he can continue working and helping with the household income.  She is married and has a son.  Ginelba lives in the home of her parents in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.  
	
She is very pleased with the previous loans she received.  This is the fifth time that Kiva and its lenders will be able to participate in her loan.

loans.use: to pay the cost of repairing the motor in her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay  for her children’s school fees

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo es una persona emprendedora  y   muy  trabajadora  que junto con    su esposa  atienden un puesto  de  tacos  que   tienen afuera  de  un  hospital  de la ciudad, contando  con  cinco  años  de  antigüedad  y  teniendo  ya   sus clientes  que  acuden  frecuentemente   a  su  negocio, es  por  ello   que  ellos  necesitan  realizar  la compra de mercancía  que  les permita  seguir  ofertando a sus  clientes el  excelente  servicio y  el  buen  sazón  que  los  caracteriza, ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio y  obtener  mayores  ingresos  que  le  permitan brindar a  su  familia  una  excelente   calidad  de   vida.
texts.en: Hugo is a very hardworking entrepreneur who works with his wife at a taco stand outside a city hospital.  They have been there  for 5 years and  customers stop frequently at his business.  It is  for the customers that they need to buy supplies, allowing them to offer the excellent service and great flavor that they are known for.  The loan will give them the possibility of growing their business and giving them greater earnings so that they can offer their family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies to sell the food

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa Antonia tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su pareja y con su hija de 13 años de edad en el  Ventanas perteneciente al Cantón Mocache Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul . Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol dandul, para la compra de abonos y semillas  fertilizantes abonos agrícolas para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es superarse y trabajar mas para poderse comprar una finca y un carro. 

Se considera una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, en sus tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Rosa Antonia is 32 years old and lives with her common law partner and with their 13 year old daughter in Ventanas, belonging to Mocache canton in Los Rios Province.

The members of the NUEVA ESPERANZA communal bank are located in JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER precinct belonging to Ventanas canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn, rice and gandul beans.

Rosa works in agriculture cultivating corn, rice and gandul beans. She purchases her products in the Roca Market in Ventanas and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is requesting this loan in order to plant corn, rice and gandul beans, for the purchase of fertilizers and seeds for agricultural production. Support from this loan will help her to economically provide for her needs. She confronts challenges such as infestations  and plant diseases. Her dream is to do extremely well and to work even harder in order to be able to buy a farm and a car. 

She is considered an enterprising and hard working woman. In her free time she likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for agricultural production

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celsa; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pollos y pescados, ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia también tiene sus tierras de cultiva donde siembra hortalizas, repollo y culantro y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pollos y pescados y también para mejorar las tierras de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y pescados y también para comprar semillas para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This loan applicant belongs to the “SAYHUA 3” Community Bank. This bank is located in the Urubamaba district in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. This member is named Mrs. Celsa. She is 47 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. This member varies her daily activities between businesses. One of the businesses is selling chickens and fish. She sells these in the Urubamba market from 6:00am until 6:00pm. She also has cultivated farmland where she grows plants like cabbage and cilantro. She sells these items in various markets. She would like to increase her fish and poultry sales business and also improve her farmland. She is asking for this loan in order to buy chickens and fish and also buy seeds for her farmland.
This member is happy to have the opportunity to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chicken and fish and also seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Yhonni

texts.es: El señor Yhonni trabaja con su movilidad pues es taxista independiente y esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de llantas nuevas para su movilidad. Es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Anteriormente ya obtuvo dos préstamos a través de Kiva y esta será la tercera solicitud.
texts.en:
Sr. Yhonni is an independent taxi driver and works with his own vehicle. This business is the source of income by which he can support his family. He is requesting a loan in order to buy new tires for his vehicle. Yhonni is married and has a son. He lives in a rented house in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.

He previously received two loans through Kiva and this will be his third request.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas y también vende choclos, ella tiene un puesto en la puerta del mercado de Urubamba donde trabaja desde las 3:00 p.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,y en las mañanas la socia trabaja en la municipalidad de Urubamba en el área de guardería, por medio de este trabajo y negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas y venta de choclos y mejorar e su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como chupetes, caramelos, galletas y gaseosas y también para comprar choclos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This loan applicant belongs to the “SAYHUA 3” Community Bank. This bank is located in the Urubamaba district in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. This member is named Mrs. Dominga. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. She varies her daily activities between a business selling candy and another one selling corn. She has a booth at the entryway of the market in Urubamba, where she works from 3:00pm until 9:00pm. In the mornings she works near a school in the town of Urumbamba. Because of these businesses she is able to help her children progress. She would like to expand her businesses and thereby improve her sales. She is asking for a loan to buy candies such as lollipops, caramels, cookies and soda. She would also buy corn wholesale. She is happy to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy candies such as lollipops, caramels, cookies and sodas and also to buy wholesale corn.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo es chofer dueño de taxi Toyota Corolla con el que trabaja transportando pasajeros dentro la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de un motor para su taxi para su mejor funcionamiento en el trabajo que desempeña y sobre todo con mayor seguridad. Es casado, no tiene hijos y vive en anticretico  en una casa ubicada en la zona de las San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo is the owner of a Toyota Corolla taxi that he uses for transporting passengers around the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a motor for his taxi that will improve its performance and above all provide greater safety. Ricardo is married and has no children. He lives in a rental home in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his taxi.

loans.name: Gladis Sylver

texts.fr:
Client  âgé de 37  ans, marié et père de  trois (3) enfants dont l’âge varie entre  10 et 16 ans. 
N’ayant pas d’appui considérable  pour poursuivre ses études, il a crée une micro-entreprise axée sur la vente du ciment en détail.
Avec une demande aussi  forte, l’octroi du crédit lui permettra de renforcer ses capacités de vente. Il envisage beaucoup épargner dans le but de réaliser l’ambition de devenir distributeur agrée des cimenteries au niveau national.
 Responsable et exemplaire dans ses attributs de chef de famille, il entreprend des relations d’amitié et de bonne coopération dans sa communauté.
texts.en:
The client is 37 years old, married and father of three children aged between 10 and 16 years.
Not having sufficient support to pursue his studies, he created a micro-enterprise centred on the retail sale of cement.
Credit granted will enable him to strengthen his retail capacity to match strong demand. He is saving in order to achieve his goal of becoming an accredited distibutor in the national cement industry.
Responsible and exemplary with regard to his attributes as head of the family, he maintains friendships and strong cooperative relationships with people in his community.

loans.use: increase his stock with 3 tonnes of cement

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Jose Francisco, tiene la edad 26 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con su conyugue e hija. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de alimento para el engorde de cerdos. El cuenta con cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere lograr  que sus animales alcancen un peso ideal para su venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jose Francisco, who is 26 years old, lives with his common-law wife and their daughter. With this loan, he intends to buy concentrated feed to fatten up his pigs. He owns a herd of pigs and plans to feed them concentrated feed so that they fatten up faster. He wants his animals to reach the ideal weight for their subsequent sale in the local market or in neighboring communities. Jose Francisco wants to generate the maximum profit for his well-being and that of his family, and also to help expand his pig-raising project.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously, he did not have any other loans from state banks. However, FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan under better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for pigs.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: The picture above belongs to Matilda. She sell groceries in Kwaprow near Abura. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a welder.  Matilda's grocery shop is about 6 years old. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to obtain additional groceries for resale. Her future plans for her business is to establish another shop in a different locality.

loans.use: buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: improve his games centre business

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es:
María Emperatriz tiene 54 años, Es viuda vive con el hijo de catorce años de edad, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es poder viajar.

En su tiempo libre le gusta compartir con la familia salir de paseo, le gusta las fiestas del Catón ventans, se considera una persona emprendedora y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old. She is a widow with a 14-year-old son. She lives in the Cantón of Ventanas in the Province of Los Rios. 
The members of the “V.R.C. Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) live in the precinct of “Jesús Del Gran Poder” (Jesús, The Great Power), which is in the Cantón of Ventanas (Windows). This area is an agricultural zone that has a short growing season. They grow corn, rice and beans.
María works as a farmer and grows corn, rice and beans. She buys her products in the commercial zone of Ventanas and she sells her products in the wholesale market in Ventanas.
She is requesting this loan in order to grow corn, rice and beans. She would like to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicides, urea, organic fertilizers and corn, bean and rice seeds. With the economic assistance from this loan she can provide for the necessities of her family. She will be able to confront the challenges of plagues and diseases that affect her crops. Her dream is to travel.
In her free time she likes to go out with her family. She likes the fiestas in the Ventanas Canton. Maria is considered a hardworking and enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celestina; ella tiene 76 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picantería y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas y en el negocio de picantería vende cerveza y chicha y los animales los vende en las diferentes ferias que se realizan en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de picantería y ampliar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como pollos y cuyes y también comprar cerveza al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This loan applicant belongs to the “SAYHUA 3” Community Bank. This bank is located in the Urubamaba district in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.
This member is named Mrs. Celestina. She is 76 years old, a widow with two children. She varies her daily activities between a small cantina and raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. In her cantina she sells beer and chicha (a fermented corn drink). She sells her animals at different markets in the Urubamba District. She would like to expand her restaurant and animal sales businesses. She is asking for this loan in order to buy animals such as chickens and guinea pigs and she would also buy beer wholesale. 
She is happy for the opportunity this loan provides and promises to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens and guinea pigs and also buy beer wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells children’s undergarments in Abura as a peddler.  The tray in the picture above has some of the underwear items displayed. Adjoa has attained a junior high level of education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. Adjoa has been selling underwear for 9 years. She assists her partner in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to acquire more underwear to sell.

loans.use: buy underwear to resell

loans.name: Juvin Prisla

texts.fr:
Client  âgé 30 ans et marié sans enfant. Par manque d’appui considérable pour ses études, il s’est lancé dans la vente des produits de santé. Au regard de la fréquence des clients et la rareté des produits, le crédit octroyé lui permettra de renforcer son stock.
Pour assurer la croissance de son activité et la réalisation de l’ambition  de devenir Grossiste, il envisage beaucoup épargner. Très entrepreneur, il fait face aux obligations de son statut et fait l’objet de bon témoignage dans sa communauté.
texts.en:
The client is 30 years old and married without children. Due to lack of sufficient support for his studies, he began a business selling health products. Given the frequency of clients and the scarcity of products, the credit granted will enable him to reinforce his stock.
To ensure the growth of his business and to achieve his goal of becoming a wholesaler, he hopes to save alot. Very entrepreneurial, he lives up to his obligations and is well regarded in the community.

loans.use: renforcer le stock des produits pharmaceutiques

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells provisions like soaps, polythene bags, spices and other items at Abura. She is married. Her husband is a security man. Efua has been in this trade for 6 years. She responsibly helps her husband pay the utility bills and other household expenses.  Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build another shop.

loans.use: buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Alpha, a small business  entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to invest in his business.

Alpha sells provisions such as milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, bottled water, etc.  He has been a businessman for 4 years now.  A husband and a father of 3 children – 1 in primary school and 2 in secondary school, this 48-year-old was born in Port Loko town in northern Sierra Leone. 

Alpha has requested this loan in order to buy bottled water, milk and sugar in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: stock provisions to resell

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
S., who is in his early 50s, is married and has one child who is going to school.  He has been running a small fruit and vegetable farm for five years now.  He works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This will be his 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy an irrigation machine and expanded his small farm and pay his house expenses.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a new loan to expand his small farm further and plant more vegetables to sell. His dream is to one day be able to buy a big irrigation machine and to send his child to good schools.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Tunaweza", which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To expand his small farm and plant more vegetables.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela ha estado ampliando poco  a poco  su  domicilio  a  base  de  mucho  esfuerzo  para que  su vivienda  brinde  una  mejor  imagen y  que  su  familia  se   sienta  mas   cómoda  en   su  hogar, es  por  ello  que  en esta  ocasión desea ponerle techo a la construcción que tiene al frente del domicilio ya  que   le  permitirá  protegerse  del  sol  y  de la  lluvia y cuando  sus  familiares  y  amigos  la  visiten  pueda   darle  una  mejor   estancia, agradece  el apoyo para  la  realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en: Mrs. Gabriela is building her home little by little. With much effort she is providing her family with a better place to live. Her family feels very comfortable in their home. She would like to use this loan to put a roof on the front of her home. It will protect her family from the sun and rain. When her friends and family visit she will be able to have a better place for them to be. Because of this support, she is able to finish this project.

loans.use: to put a roof on the front of her home.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells eggs, bread, and tea in Abura. She is married to a mason and has five children. She is requesting a loan to expand her sale of bread and eggs. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, and other baking ingredients. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Makepesi Business Association Group

texts.en:
Aubrey is 40 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  He also cares for one dependent. He resides in Gweru.   Aubrey runs a retail business selling beverages and employs one person. The business has been in operation for five years. The main challenges he faces are low stock due to lack of capital, electricity cuts, and cost of operating a generator. 

Aubrey is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase stocks of beer. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve his family's standard of living by having more disposable income. In the future, Aubrey plans to have a bigger and better business with more employees.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of liquor for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua a divorced mother of four children, sells provisions and food items such as oil, rice, biscuits, soaps and sugar from a small kiosk in Abura.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell, and plans to reinvest for further growth the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua has 7 children. She has received a junior high education. Efua sells cooked beans (red-red) and cooked rice at Abura, which she has done for 20 years. Her husband is a cleaner. Efua uses her income to support her husband to take care of their home expenditures.  Efua will use this loan to purchase rice and beans to cook and sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: buy rice and beans to cook and sell

loans.name: Miguel Estuardo

texts.es:
Miguel Estuardo tiene 48 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto a su pareja y con sus dos hijos de catorce y tres años de edad, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para poder trabajar ampliamente y obtener mejores utilidades.

En su tiempo libre le gusta compartir con la familia salir de paseo, le gusta las fiestas del Catón ventans.
texts.en:
Miguel Estuardo is 48 years old and lives in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province with his common-law wife and their two children who are 14 and three years old.

The members of the "Nueva Esperanza" ["New Hope"] communal bank are located in the precinct of Jesús del Gran Poder, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Miguel works in agriculture. He plants corn, rice and pigeon peas. He buys his products at the Roca trading post in Ventanas and sells his products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to plant corn, rice and pigeon peas. He will buy manure, fertilizer, herbicides, urea, and corn and rice seeds. The support from this loan will help him and his entire family economically, so that they can cover their necessities. He faces challenges like insect plagues and plant illnesses. His dream is to buy a plot of land where he can work enough to be more profitable.

In his free time, Miguel likes to go for walks with his family. He also likes the festivals of Ventanas canton.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, urea and seeds

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells food items and other things like canned tomatoes, onions, pepper, diapers, rice, matches and eggs at Abura. She is a single parent taking care of 4 children. Her business is about 7 years old. Her loan will be used to obtain provisions to sell. She hopes to use the latest profits from her business to save towards buying a piece of land.

loans.use: obtain provisions to sell

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 40 ans, marié et Père de trois 3 enfants dont l’age varie entre 2 et 9 ans.
Par manque d’appui pour soutenir son cursus scolaire à partir du cycle secondaire, il juge mieux de créer une micro-entreprise dont la vocation est la vente en détail des Cassettes et CD.
Vu la croissance démographique de sa zone de vente et  la rareté de certains produits de musique, le microcrédit permettra d’appuyer l’activité pour assurer sa croissance et la réalisation de sa vision qui n’est autre que devenir Grossiste distributeur agrée des entreprises de production. Faisant face aux obligations liées à son statut, il est exemplaire dans sa communauté.
texts.en:
The client is 40 years old, married and father of 3 children aged between 2 and 9 years.
As he didn't have the means to continue his secondary studies, he decided it would be best to start a micro-enterprise specialising in the retail sale of tapes and CDs.
Given the population growth in his area and the scarcity of certain music items, microcredit allows him to grow his business and to realise his vision of becoming  an authorized wholesale distributor for production companies. He lives up to his obligations and is a model citizen in his community.

loans.use: to buy tapes, CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: The picture above shows Esi displaying some loaves of bread and crates of eggs. She is a baker.  Esi is married to a driver and has 3 children. She attained a junior high level of education. Comfort, with the income she makes, assists her husband to educate her children. Comfort will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar, gas and crates of eggs. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, gas and crates of eggs

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
Cecilia is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Cecilia was born in Makeni city about 49 years ago.  She is married to a public worker and the couple has 5 children, 3 of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For 15 years now, Cecilia has been selling cotton cloths, gara lappers (locally dyed cloths), and shoes. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Cecilia will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,200,000) to expand her business.  She will buy cotton cloths and a dozen pairs of shoes to add to her business.

loans.use: buy cloths and shoes to resell

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлане 60 лет, она родилась в городе Капан. После окончания средней школы, она поступила в Капанское музыкальное училище. 
Светлана вдова, у нее трое детей: сын и две дочери. Все дети имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно от матери. 
Предпринимательской деятельностью Светлана занимается  с 1996г. Она торгует одеждой, бельем и обувью в арендованном помещение Капанской городской ярмарки. Товары Светлана приобретает в Ереване раз в месяц. Светлана работает без выходных, а недавно она начала торговать цветами, которые она ежедневно приобретает у оптовиков. Благодаря помощи младшей дочери на ярмарке, Светлана успевает заниматься и продажей одежды, и продажей цветов. Цветочный бизнес приносит ей дополнительный доход и она по мере своих возможностей помогает семьям своих дочерей.   
	Кредит на сумму 400.000 драм необходим Светлане для приобретения осенней одежды и обуви в преддверии начала нового учебного года, а также для расширения цветочного бизнеса. 
Данный кредит является 7-ым по счету и Светлана всегда выплачивает кредит без просрочек.
texts.en: Svetlana is 60 years old, she was born in the city of Kapan. After finishing high school she was accepted to Kapan's musical academy. Svetlana is a widow and has three children: a son and two daughters. All of her children have their own families and live separately from their mother. Since 1996 Svetlana has been working in retail. She sells clothes, lingerie and shoes at a rented stall at the Kapan City Market. She purchases her inventory every month in Erevan and she works without weekends. Recently Svetlana also started to sell fresh flowers which she purchases every morning from whole-sellers. With the help of her youngest daughter Svetlana can manage both the clothing and the flower sale businesses. Flower sales bring them additional profit and allow Svetlana to financially help out her daughters' families. Svetalana is asking for a loan of 400,000 dram to purchase fall season clothing and shoes before the start of the new school year and to expand her flower business. This is Svetlana's 7th loan and she has always paid back her loans on time.

loans.use: To buy autumn season clothes to resell and also to develop her flower trading business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells kenkey, provisions and food items at Abura.  She has been in her trade for 11 years.  Mary has been through junior high school. She is married and has 4 children.
