Her husband is a cleaner.  She supports her husband in providing for the general needs of their home. Her loan will be used to buy food items such as garden eggs, okra, palm oil, etc.  to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Katy Belen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katy Belen; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes y también vende radios y relojes, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Urubamba, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes como pelotas, rompecabezas y muñecas y también para comprar relojes y radios al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Katy belongs to the "Sayhua 3" community bank in the district of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 23 years old, married and has a son. She makes a living selling toys as well as radios and watches at a sales post in the Urubamba market. She works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., and the businesses help her make headway for her son. Katy wants to expand her business selling toys and is requesting the loan to purchase items such as balls, puzzles and dolls, as well as buy watches and radios at wholesale. She feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase toys such as balls, puzzles and dolls as well as watches and radio at wholesale.

loans.name: Victor  Manuel

texts.es: Victor Manuel, tiene la edad 51 de  años, está en soltero y vive con su madre. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de novillos para el engorde. El cuenta con un potrero apto para la crianza de novillos y lo que pretende es darle alimentación  para su engorde más rápido. El quiere lograr  que sus animales alcancen un peso ideal para su venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su madre y crecer con el proyecto de cría de novillos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is 51 years old, single, and lives with his mother. He intends to use this loan to buy young cows for fattening. He currently has a paddock fit to raise young cows. He hopes to provide them with feed so that they will fatten up more quickly. He wants his animals to reach the ideal weight for their sale at the local market or in the surrounding areas. He wants to generate the best possible earnings for his well-being and that of his mother, as well as to grow his venture raising young cows.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Victor Manuel has not had any other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua operates a food kiosk, a place where a variety of items are cooked to sell at Abura. She cooks food such as kenkey with fish and banku with okra stew. 

Ekua is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband take care of their home. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients to cook food to sell. She hopes to use the profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: buy ingredients to cook food to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has 3 children. She has received a junior high level of education. She sells food items like tomatoes, okra, eggs, groundnut pastes and others. Having to take care of her children has not been easy, and so a loan will enable her to expand her business to be able to take proper care of her family.  Ekua will use the loan to purchase food items to sell. Her future plan towards her business is to build a better shop.

loans.use: purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells beans and rice at Abura. She is divorced and has 4 children.  She has been in her business for 10 years. She uses the income she makes from her sales to educate, feed, clothe and shelter her children. Her loan will be used to get more bags of rice and beans to cook for the business. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: buy rice and beans

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos y también venta de cds de música y de pelicula,ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Urubamba y trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de desayunos y venta de cds de música y películas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para preparar los desayunos como quinua, leche y panes y también para comprar cds al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Carmen belongs to the "Sayhua 3" community bank in the district of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 26 years old, married and has one son. She makes a living selling breakfasts as wells as music and movie CDs at a post in the Urubamba market. She works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. These businesses have helped her make headway for her son. Carmen wants to expand her businesses and is requesting the loan to purchase products to make her breakfasts, such as quinoa, milk and bread, and to also buy CDs at wholesale. She feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase products to make breakfasts, such as quinoa, milk and bread, as well as to buy CDs at wholesale.

loans.name: Porvenir Femenino Group

texts.en:
Flavia belongs to the “Porvenir Femenino” (Future Women group). The group is comprised of ten members who work day-to-day at their business activities. The group is located in the Peninsula of Samana, a nascent tourist city where much of the citizenry live in rural areas surrounded by mountains and the Atlantic ocean. They mostly sell clothes, footwear, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Flavia’s family is made up of herself and her five children, 2 of whom still live with her in her home. They live in a wooden house that Flavia wants to upgrade into a concrete block structure.  This is her most difficult challenge.  But she says this is not impossible because with her work and God´s will, she will makes this dream come true and give her children all the support and anything they need. 

Flavia has a business selling gasoline from the front of her house.  She lives on the edge of one of the main roads.  Many people drive through it and stop at her gasoline stand. She has been engaged in this business for 8 years. She tells us that she started this business thanks to some savings she had, then she was able to apply for loans from Esperanza and was able to invest further.  Flavia has accessed and repaid 11 loans with Esperanza Internacional. She will use this new loan to buy gasoline and motor oil.

Flavia and her group thank you all for your support!!!

loans.use: buy gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy flour and sugar to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Faigh Florent

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 56 ans, marié et Père de quatre (4) enfants dont l’âge varie entre 11 ans et 28 ans.
N’ayant pas un salaire consistant à la fonction publique, il a crée une micro-entreprise dont la vocation est la vente en détail des valises. Il a des ventes de 10.000 frs a 80.000frs par jour.
Au regard de la fréquence des clients et la rareté des marchandises de bonne qualité , le microcrédit permettra d’appuyer l’activité pour assurer sa croissance et la réalisation de sa vision qui n’est autre que devenir Importateur – Grossiste.
 Faisant face aux obligations liées à son statut, il est exemplaire dans sa communauté.
texts.en:
This client is 56 years old, married and the father of four children from 11 to 28 years of age. Not having a public servant’s salary to rely on, he created a small business to retail luggage. His receipts are from 10,000 to 80,000 West African francs per day.

Given the high volume of customers and the dearth of quality merchandise, this microloan will allow him to grow his business further and continue his work towards implementing his vision of becoming an importer and wholesaler one day. Honoring his social obligations, he serves as a role model in his community.

loans.use: to buy various types of suitcases, handbags and backpacks

loans.name: Kushinga Group

texts.en:
Esnut, a 50-year-old married mother of four, lives in Gweru, where she also cares for two dependents. For the past five years Esnut has been operating a manufacturing business producing candles. She says the main challenge faced is high competition from well-established manufacturers.

Esnut has requested a loan of $400 to purchase wax, dye and string. The extra income arising from this loan will allow her to finish building her rural home and feed her family an improved diet. In the future, Esnut plans to open a small manufacturing company.

loans.use: to buy wax for candle making.

loans.name: Patricia Lorena

texts.es:
Patricia Lorena tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre junto a su pareja y con sus dos hijos de once y nueve años de edad, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.
Patricia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl. Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y un carro.

En su tiempo libre le gusta compartir con la familia salir de paseo, le gusta el deporte y las fiestas del Catón ventanas, se considera una persona emprendedor y trabajador.
texts.en: Patricia Lorena is 28 years old and lives with her partner and her two children, ages 11 and 9, in the town of Ventanas, province of Los Rios, Ecuador. She belongs to the Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) community bank located in a neighborhood in Ventanas. This community bank is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural workers who harvest corn, rice and beans. Patricia makes a living harvesting these crops. She buys her products at Comercial Guzman in Ventanas and sells her produce at the wholesale market in Ventanas. She is requesting the loan to plant corn, rice and beans by purchasing manure, fertilizers, herbicides, urea (chemical fertilizer), organic fertilizers, and corn, bean and rice seeds. The support of the loan will help her whole family by providing them with necessities. She confronts challenges such as plagues and diseases for her crops. Her dream is to buy some land and a car. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her family on walks, sports and festivals in Ventanas. She considers herself to be an enterprising and hard-working person.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, herbicides, urea (chemical fertilizer), organic fertilizers and corn seeds.

loans.name: Lucie Elviath

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, célibataire sans enfant, a l’arrêt de ses études en classe de terminal , elle se lance dans la vente des grillades de poissons, des viandes et des cotes de porcs.Elle a des recettes de 35000 a 55000frs par jour,comme elle exerce a cote d'un bar, ses clients sont les gens qui viennent boire tous les soirs.

A l'octroi de ce prêt elle va acheter 2  cartons de cotes de porcs ,4 des cartons de cuisses et ailes de poulet 
2 cartons de saucisses.
Tres entreprenante , elle veut a la longue ouvrir un restaurant , c'est pour cela qu'avec ses bénéfices elle est entrain d’épargner pour qu'elle puisse s'acheter des chaises et tables en plastique, des couverts et des marmites pour mener a bout son projet.
texts.en:
Our client is 48 years old, unmarried, and without children. She dropped out of her last year of high school and then began selling grilled fish, meats, and pork chops. Her receipts range from 35,000 to 55,000 francs a day. Since she operates next to a bar, her customers are people who come to drink every evening. 

Upon being granted this loan, she is going to buy 2 boxes of pork chops, 4 boxes of chicken thighs and wings, and 2 boxes of sausages. A very entrepreneurial woman, she wants to open a restaurant in the future. For this reason, she is in the process of saving money, so that she may buy plastic chairs and tables, some place settings, and cooking pots to carry out her project.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken thighs, chinchards (fish), chops, and sausages

loans.name: Kakakuona Group

texts.en:
Rahel, who is in her mid-20s, married, and the mother of a small child, has had a general store business for three years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rahel's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, having used her previous loan, since repaid, to purchase 20 bags of rice. She will use this loan to buy another 20 bags of rice and some fabrics to sell door to door. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Rahel will share this loan with her loan group "Kakakuona," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of rice and some fabrics to sell door to door.

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35 year-old Nitta from Gweru, with hand raised. She is married with four children, two attending school and also cares for one dependent. Nitta runs a retail cross-border business selling clothes and accessories. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are crossing the border, import duty and late payments from clients as she usually sells on credit. Nitta has requested a loan of $400 to buy African attire, weaves, jeans and braids. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's lifestyle in term of more disposable income and better living conditions. In the future Nitta plans to own her own shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married to a farmer and has two children. She sells slippers by moving from one place to another at Kwaprow near Abura, which she has done for 5 years. She will add the loan to her initial income to acquire different kinds of soap to sell in addition to the slippers. Ekua plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded back into her business.

loans.use: to add different kinds of soap to to her slipper-sales business.

loans.name: Carmen Olga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Olga; ella tiene 39 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo D. una empresa que realiza encomiendas, documentos a diferentes lugares del mundo, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio D. este trabajo la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere terminar D. construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción como cemento, arena y yeso para que termine D. construir su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Olga is a member of the Communal Bank “Sayhua 3” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old, married, and has three children. Carmen divides her time between her daily activities and her job at a company that that sends parcels and documents to different parts of the world. She works from 8am to 6pm. Through her job, Carmen wants to help her children get ahead. She wishes to finish the construction of her house, so she is requesting a loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand, and plaster so that the work can be completed.

Carmen is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and plaster in order to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells tomatoes, kontommire (used in making a popular Ghanaian stew), cabbage, eggs, and salted fish at Abura. She is married to a cleaner. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bolivar

texts.es: Bolivar, tiene la edad 53 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa. El pretende con el crédito dar la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con una plantación de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar una buena plantación  para obtener una buena producción para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su esposa y crecer con el proyecto de producción café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.

loans.use: Asistencia de cafe

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Lisbeth; la socia es casada y tiene 42 años de edad, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad; la socia trabaja con su esposo desde hace 10 años en el área administrativo y venta de tractores y maquinaria pesada así como repuestos y partes para tractores y maquinarias pesadas, la socia es la mano derecha del esposo y ella particularmente se dedica  a la administración del negocio. La socia requiere le préstamo para invertir y poder apoyar al esposo que también es socio en el pago inicial de la compra de repuestos de tractores y repuestos de maquinarias pesadas, la socia trae el pedido de la ciudad de Lima y ella gira un monto base para la entrega de las diferentes partes y repuestos para la implementación de su negocio familiar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago inicial de sus pedido de repuestos para tractores y repuestos de maquinarias pesadas.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sra. Lisbeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 42 years old, married, and has a seven-year-old son. For the past 10 years, Lisbeth and her husband have been managing a business that sells tractors and heavy machinery, as well as spare parts for this type of equipment. Lisbeth serves as her husband’s right hand and is responsible for managing the business. She needs a loan to invest and help her husband, as well as make the down payment toward the purchase of tractor and heavy machinery parts. Lisbeth brings her order to the city of Lima and pays a base amount so that different parts can be delivered and keep her family business in operation. She is requesting a loan to invest in the down payment for her order of tractor and heavy machinery parts.

Lisbeth is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to make a down payment on an order of tractor and heavy machinery parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing and footwear for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is standing next to the ovens she uses to bake the bread she sells. She has been baking for six years. Comfort  is married and has two children. Her husband is a security man. She has been through junior high school. Esi uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. A loan will help to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients to bake bread to distribute to her customers. She plans to reinvest the new profit back into the business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients to bake bread to distribute to her customers.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has two children. She graduated from senior high school.

For the past five years Efua has sold cooked rice with tomato sauce in Abura. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in feeding, clothing and educating their children.

Efua will use her loan of 730 GHS to purchase bags of rice and the ingredients for her tomato sauce. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and the ingredients for her tomato sauce.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married, has four children and has received a junior high education. Her husband is an electrician.

Ekua sells assorted products such as canned fish, boxed drinks, powdered milk, milk, soap and other items in Abura. Her loan of 630 GHS will be used to buy more of the same to resell.

Ekua hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to resell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has five children. Her husband is a carpenter. She helps him in the general upkeep of the home.

Ama sells different types of soap. She uses a metal bell to draw the attention of customers to herself.

Ama plans to use her loan of 530 GHS to purchase more soap to expand her business. With any new profits, Ama wants to build a shop for herself.

loans.use: to purchase more soap to sell.

loans.name: Camino De Victoria 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Zenaida is the coordinator of her group, Camino D. Victoria (Road to Victory) 1, 2 & 3. She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that in the past her most difficult challenge was developing her own business. She said she is now working hard to meet her next challenge: to own her own home. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy watching television.

Zenaida is excited to be taking her second loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes, sandals, slippers and jewelry. She will save her profits to help her family build a house. Her husband's income only provides for basic expenses, so she is helping him change their life with better meals, immediate care when they get sick and for many other needs.

Zenaida dreams of having her own home, a good structure, safe and beautiful. Thanks to her business and to Esperanza loans, she feels that her dream will come true.

There are two pictures of this group so as to show as many faces as possible. The group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. Zenaida and her group thank you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals, slippers and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Kusile 2 Red Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  Edward  is 74 years old and comes from Gweru. He is married with nine children. He also cares for one dependent.

 Edward runs a retail business selling cement and maize. The business has been in operation for two years. He says the main challenges faced are transport to the rural areas, slow turnover and high purchasing costs.

 Edward has requested a loan of $400 to buy more cement and maize. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to have more disposable income and therefore a better quality of life. In the future Edward plans to own a bigger shop and employ staff.

loans.use: to buy cement and maize for the store.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria, tiene la edad 65 de  años, está viuda y vive con un hijo y un nieto. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar insumos para la asistencia de su plantación de café. Ella cuenta con una plantación de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor producción. Ella quiere implantar una buena plantación  que genere producción para vender un café de calidad. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su hijo y nieto y crecer con el proyecto de producción de café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria, age 65, is a widow and lives with one son and one grandson. She intends to use the loan to buy supplies to assist her in planting coffee. She has one coffee field and intends to invest in supplies such as manure and fungicides, along with paying laborers, in order to obtain better production. 

She wants to plant a good crop that will generate production in order to to sell quality coffee. She wants to generate the majority of her earnings for her well-being and that of her son and grandson, and to grow her coffee production endeavor.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan with better terms and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the production of coffee.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena has three children and is married to a gardener. She has received junior high education. Abena sells fish and local medicine. She has on her lap the local medicine. She moves around with it in the vicinity of Abura. 

Abena assists her husband to take care of the home. She will use the loan to obtain more local medicines to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to obtain more local medicines to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Esther;  la socia es soltera y tiene 39 años de edad, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 18 años de edad; la socia trabaja en una institución y ella específicamente cuida a adultos mayores, la socia disfruta mucho de la compañía de los adultos mayores y de toda la experiencia enriquecedora que vivieron y que comparten con ella, la socia suele trabajar para dar lo mejor a su hijo y en esta ocasión ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en los pagos de estudio de sus hijo, la socia pagara la universidad de sus hijo para esto la socia desea poder contar con el crédito, ella tiene un hijo que estudia psicología en la universidad privada en la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de los estudios en la universidad de su hijo. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sra. Esther is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old, single, and has an 18-year-old son. Esther works at an institution where she takes care of older adults. She greatly enjoys being in the company of elderly people and being enriched by all of the life experiences that they have shared with her. Esther works in order to provide the best for her son and on this occasion she is requesting a loan to invest in his studies. She wants to obtain this loan so that she can pay for his university classes. Her son is studying psychology at a private university in the city of Cusco, so she is requesting this loan so that she can invest in his studies.

Esther is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university studies.

loans.name: Prekelo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Kereen from Gweru. She is married with three children aged 11, 22 and 24. The youngest is attending school.  

Kereen runs a hair salon boutique. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are financial constraints. Kereen has requested a loan of $400 to buy hair weaves. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family’s cash flow and quality of life. In the future Kereen plans to have significantly expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves for resale.

loans.name: Shahen

texts.ru:
Шаген родился в 1965 г. в Баку, получил высшее образование в Бакинском инженерно-строительном институте. В 1990 году он переехал в Армения и поселился в поселке городского типа Шхаршик (Shgharshik), Сюникского региона. 
Шаген женат, у него двое сыновей и дочь. Старший сын Шагена учится в Капанском политехническом институте на инженера-строителя, дочь и младший сын учатся в Капанской средней школе. Жена Шагена преподает в той же школе, где учатся их дети. Сам Шаген работает в «Фонде сохранения здоровья» Сюникского региона. 
Параллельно со своей работой в Фонде, Шаген занимается сельским хозяйством:  разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур, а также выращивает овощи и фрукты на своем огороде. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию: овощи, фрукты, говядину, молоко и яйца продает скупщикам с Капанского городского рынка. Жена Шагена помогает ему на ферме и благодаря совместным усилиям они содержат свою семью. 
Шагену необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для покупки 7 быков, а также для покупки  сена.
texts.en: Shahen was born in 1956 in Baku, and received his bachelor's degree from Baku's Civil Engineering College. In 1990 he moved to Armenia and is living in Shgharshik town in the Syunik province. Shahen is married and has two sons and a daughter. Shahen's oldest son is studying to become a civil engineer at Kapan Polytechnic Institute, while his youngest son and daughter are still attending school. Shahen's wife is a teacher at the same school their children are attending. Shahen himself works at the "Health Preservation Fund" of the Syunik province. In parallel with his day job, Shahen raises cattle, chickens and grows fruits and vegetables for the local market. He then sells his products: vegetables, fruits, beef, milk and eggs to the re-sellers from Kapan's City Market. Shahen's wife helps him with his farm and their efforts allow them to provide for their large family. Shahen would like to take out a loan of 1,000,000 dram to purchase 7 more bulls for his herd as well as hey for them.

loans.use: To buy 7 bulls and hay for his farm animals

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. Adjoa sells food items like canned tomatoes, salt, palm oil and others at Abura, which she has done for eight years. She uses her income to assist her husband to educate her children. She will use the loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for house expansion.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wood, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells panties and cosmetics at Abura. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. She wishes to acquire a loan to buy more panties and cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more panties and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es:
Angélica es integrante D. L.  Alcancía Comunal “Luchando por un Sueño” L. cual es un grupo que está conformado por 7 socios que trabajan responsablemente. 
Angélica tiene 60 años es casada con 6 hijos las cuales son mayores D. edad. Angélica cuenta con un negocio D. renovadora D. calzados ubicado en un mercado cerca D. su comunidad, este negocio nació ya que su esposo trabaja en una fábrica D. calzados y con sus conocimientos  ayudo Angélica a emprender  su propio negocio, es así como Angélica a podido aportar con los gastos del hogar. El deseo D. Angélica es D. instalar una tienda D. abarrotes en su domicilio donD. pueda ofrecer productos D. primera necesidad. Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar sueL., clavos, tapillas D. calzados, tintes, y carnaza para su puesto D. calzados. Angélica junto a L. Alcancía Comunal “Luchando por un Sueño” L. cual elL. L. integra están contentos y comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad. 
L. señora Marithza no pudo estar presente por motivo D. salud D. su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the communal bank "Luchando por un Sueño" which is comprised of seven members who work responsibly.

Angélica, 60, is married and has six children who are all adults.  She has her own shoe repair business in the market close to her community.  Her husband works in a shoe factory and it was his expertise that helped Angélica set up her own business allowing her to help cover household expenses.  Angélica's goal is to set up a grocery shop in her house so she can sell basic needs products.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoe soles, tacks, heels, dyes and leather for her repair shop.  Angélica and her communal bank are happy and committed to the Prosperity Program.

Mrs. Marithza is not in the photo because her daughter was ill.

loans.use: To buy  dyes, tacks, soles and heels.

loans.name: Pleg Group

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Gertrude from Gweru, the capital of the Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is married with four children. Three of her children are attending school.  Gertrude runs a clothing business selling clothes and shoes. The business has been in operation for 14 years. She says the main challenges faced are high competition, seasonal sales, transport costs and low demand. Gertrude has requested a loan of $400 to buy winter wear such as jackets, boots and blankets. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay her children’s school fees, and improve her family's standard of living in terms of better food and more disposable income. In the future, Gertrude plans to have a shop at another flea market and venture into the poultry business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant ella trabaja junto con su hermana, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para el restaurant como arroz, azúcar, carne y pollo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SAYHUA 3", which is located in the district and province of urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She is 41, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business where she works with her sister from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. preparing breakfast, lunch and dinner.  With the income she earns she has been able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand the restaurant in the future.  She is requesting a loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, mean and chicken for the restaurant.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy restaurant items such as rice, sugar, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Kaltumi

texts.en: Kaltumi is into multiple businesses such as being a seamstress, selling waakye and selling plastic blows at Abura. Kaltumi has been to junior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a plumber. She assists her spouse in providing the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy plastic bowls to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls to resell.

loans.name: Yris Madeleini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Yris; la socia es casada y tiene 35 años de edad, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad; la socia trabaja en una institución  pública ella es asistenta social; la socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de su casa de campo que tiene entre Pisac y Calca y para ello la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en los acabados de esta casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de su casa de campo.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "GRANITO DE MOSTAZA" communal bank which is located in the Huanchac District in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Yris, 35, is married and has two children, 19 and 12.  She is a social worker at a public institution.  She is requesting a loan for the construction of her country home between Pisac and Calca.  She plans to use it to finish the house.  

She is grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To finish construction of her country home.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia sells plastic containers and aluminium bowls at Abura, moving from one place to another. Emelia has received junior high education. She is married to an electrician. The loan she hopes to get will be used to buy plastic bowls to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls to expand her business.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Abel; el socio tiene 41 años de edad, el socio es soltero y tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 5, 4 años de edad, el socio es de profesión carpintero y el requiere el préstamo para poder comprar madera para la realización de sus trabajos, el socio tiene su taller desde hace 18 años y el socio es muy solicitado, por lo que muchas veces se le acaba el acopio de madera que suele tener, el socio desea poder comprar madera al por mayor por pies cúbicos para poder trabajar y entregar sus muebles a pedido. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "GRANITO DE MOSTAZA" communal bank which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Abel, 41, is single and has four children, ages 11, 9, 5 and 4.  He is a carpenter by trade and is requesting a loan to buy wood for his business.  He has been running a shop for 18 years and he has many customers.  He often runs out of wood because of all the orders he has, so he wants to buy wood by the cubic foot, wholesale, in order to avoid this problem.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant turístico, ella preparar desayunos, almuerzos y cenas y también prepara platos típicos como cuy al horno, pollo al horno, tallarines entre otros platos típicos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, al socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la atención de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne, verduras y arroz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Sayhua 3” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 30 years old, single, and has one child. The member divides her time between her daily activities and managing a tourist restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She also prepares traditional dishes such as oven-roasted guinea pig, baked chicken, Peruvian noodles, and other foods. The member works between the hours of 8am and 7pm. Through her business, she is able to help her child move forward. She wants to expand and improve her restaurant, so she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for cooking such as chicken, meat, vegetables, and rice in bulk.

The member is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells several varieties of vegetables as shown in the photograph above. These vegetables are "konkomirre" (African spinach), fresh tomatoes, green beans, cucumber and others. Esi lives in Abura and has received junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. 

Esi has been selling these foodstuffs for 25 years. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy varieties of vegetables to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy varieties of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.es: La Sra. Eunice es una persona  muy trabajadora,  la cual  acudió  con nosotros  para   realizar  su proyecto,  el cual  consiste  en la construcción  de una  barda en su  domicilio , ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad  de  hacer  realidad   su  sueño   logrando   ofrecer a  su  familia  una  mayor  seguridad, esta muy  agradecida  con la  institución por  apoyar  de manera  incondicional  a  familias  como  la   suya.
texts.en:
Sra. Eunice is a hardworking individual who came to Credituyo for assistance with completing her project, the construction of a wall around her home. She views this loan as a possibility for achieving her dream of offering her family greater security.

Eunice is grateful to Credituyo for the unconditional support it provides to families like hers.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a security wall around her home.

loans.name: Rising Group

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Lydia from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, two attending school. Her son works in South Africa. She also cares for one dependent. 

Lydia runs a cross-border clothing business selling clothes and shoes. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenges faced are late payments and competition. Lydia has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothes from South Africa. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase disposable income and improve family's quality of life. In the future Lydia plans to have her own shop and employ people.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yonny; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Yonny is a member of the Communal Bank “Sayhua 3” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, single, and has one child. Yonny divides her time between her daily activities and managing her restaurant business. She works from 7am to 7pm, preparing breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Through this business, she is able to help her child get ahead. Yonny wants to expand and improve her restaurant, so she is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for cooking such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

Yonny is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: El Sr. Saúl  desea terminar de construir  la barda de su domicilio, ya  que  anteriormente   tuvo  que  posponer  la construcción ya  que  no  contaba  con  el capital suficiente  para   concluir  con su proyecto, es  por  ello  que requiere de  nuestra  ayuda  para  terminar su proyecto,  agradece el apoyo  brindado por la institución para la realización de  su proyecto  ya que   ve  en el  crédito  la posibilidad   de  brindar   mayor  seguridad  a  su familia ya  que   tienen  un  pequeño  hijo   y  temen  de  que  alguien pueda  entrar  a  su  domicilio  y  puedan  hacer  algún  daño  tanto  a la  vivienda  como a  su pequeño.
texts.en:
Sr. Saúl wants to finish the construction of a wall around his home. He previously had to postpone the construction because he did not have enough capital to complete the job. For this reason, he is requesting assistance from Credituyo in order to finish the project.

Saúl is grateful for the support being provided to complete this job. He views this loan as a possibility for providing greater security for his family. Saúl has a young son and is concerned that someone could break into his house and do some damage to both his home and to his little one.

loans.use: to finish the construction of a security wall around his home.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells used clothing at Abura. Efua has received junior high education.  She is a single parent taking care of three children. Her business is six years old. She hopes to acquire a loan from Kiva to expand the sale of used clothing. Any profit that would be realized from the sales will be reinvesting into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to expand the sale of used clothing.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells yams and slippers at Abura. The picture shows the slippers she sells by moving from one area to another. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an electrician. Her loan will be used to buy more slippers to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu is sitting close to the millet porridge she sells to her customers. She is married and has four children. She has been in this business for five years. Her husband is an electrician. Zenabu uses her income to assist her husband to provide the basic needs of the home. She will use the loan to obtain ingredients (millet, sugar, pepper) to prepare porridge. With the new profits from her expanded business, Zenabu plans to save to build a house. 

To prepare her porridge, she first gets her millet, removes unwanted particles from it, and washes it. She adds local spices such as ginger and pepper to taste. She sends the millet to the mill to be milled into powder. After returning from the mill, she adds water to the resulting flour to make dough. She leaves it for a couple of hours before using the dough to make porridge. She heats water to a boiling point and mixes the dough into the water to get a porridge-like consistency. She gradually pours the dough into the heated water stirring continuously to prevent it from forming lumps. The porridge only has to cook for a couple of minutes and then it is ready to be served. Millet porridge goes with bread of any kind and fried doughnuts.

loans.use: to obtain ingredients (millet, sugar, pepper) to prepare porridge.

loans.name: Vidal Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Vidal; el socio tiene 40 años de edad y es socio es soltero, el socio se dedica principalmente a la construcción a él lo llaman de diferentes ciudades y trata de abastecerse y está en todo, el socio también tiene un internet llamado “Talita Cumi”; el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir en la implementación de sus internet que lo tiene desde hace 4 años y poder mejores algunos equipos y accesorios de este. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación de sus negocio de internet, el socio comprara cámaras web, monitores plasma y teclados nuevos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios para su negocio de internet.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sr. Vidal is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 40 years old and single. Vidal works primarily in construction and is called to work in different cities, so he tries to be prepared for everything. He also manages an Internet café called “Talita Cumi”. On this occasion, he wants to invest in his Internet business so that it will stay in operation. He started this business four years ago and wants to improve it with some equipment and accessories. Vidal is requesting a loan to invest in the operation of his Internet business, so he will use the funds to buy web cameras, plasma monitors, and new keyboards.

He is grateful for the support being provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy web cameras, plasma monitors, and new keyboards.

loans.name: Eugenia Raquel

texts.es:
Doña Eugenia es comerciante en la venta de ropa, cosmeticos y venta de prenda de plata, trabajando hace cuatro años para el bien comun de la familia, casada, su esposo labora en fontaneria en la empresa de Enacal. Sus tres pequeños hijos estudian.
Al inicio lo hizo vendiendo hielo, y fresco de chicha, lo que luego recurre al financiamiento para comprar ropa y cosmeticos, en donde ha captado cleintela y trabaja por encargos.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo quiere reparar parte del techo de su casa, a si como hacer ventana el cual solo la tiene con verja y plycem, dando mejor seguridad a su  vivienda, al comprar ventana, que hara posible mediante el financiamiento en Afodenic.
texts.en:
Doña Eugenia is a merchant who sells clothing, cosmetics, and silver jewelry. For the past four years, she has worked for the common good of her family. Her husband works as plumber for the Enacal Company. Her three young children are in school.

Eugenia started out selling ice and fresh “chicha” (a beverage made from corn). Later she obtained financing in order to buy clothing and cosmetics. She was able to attract customers and obtain orders.

Today with the new loan, Eugenia hopes to repair a section of the roof of her house. She also needs to buy windows because the only coverings she has are fiberboards and metal grating. With the funding from AFODENIC, Eugenia hopes to make her home safer.

loans.use: to buy windows and repair a section of her roof in order to make her home safer.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has received a junior high level of education. Ama sells rice porridge and serves it with bread, milk and sugar at Abura as a peddler. She has been doing this for five years.  She helps to feed, clothe and educate her children with the help of the husband. Ama will use the loan to promote the sale of rice porridge by purchasing rice and other items to cook to sell. With the new earnings from her extended business, Ama plans to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and other items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 43 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz, ella compra maíz al por mayor y lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Sayhua 3” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, widowed, and has three children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling corn. She buys corn in bulk and then sells it at the market in Urubamba between the hours of 6am and 7pm. Through her work, she is able to help her children get ahead. The member wants to expand and improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Marcial Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Marcial tiene 45 años de edad,  el socio es soltero; el socio trabaja como personal administrativo en una institución pública, el socio en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para comprar una laptop, el socio irá pagando con el pago de sus honorarios mes a mes el crédito que se le otorgara para lo cual el solicita el préstamo en esta oportunidad. El socio solicita e préstamo para la compra de sus laptop para poder mejorar su trabajo y tener sus informes a tiempo. 

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Marcial is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 45 years old and single. Marcial works as a human resources manager at a public institution. On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer so that he can process the monthly payroll. This is why he is requesting a loan at this time. By purchasing a laptop computer with this loan, he will be able to improve his work and have his reports ready on time.

Marcial is grateful for the support being provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for his job.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: The picture above show Aba displaying some smoked fish for sale. She is a fishmonger at Abura. She is married to a cleaner and has been in the business for five years. She responsibly assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to smoke to re-sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke and then sell

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Osvaldo es una  persona  muy  responsable el  cual se  preocupa  por  brindarle  lo mejor a  su  familia,   ya  que  es lo mas  importante  que   tiene  en  su  vida, el  desea  lograr  que  su  hogar tenga  una mejor   imagen  y  a su  vez ofrecer una mayor  comodidad  a  su  familia, es  por  ello  que  acudió con nosotros  para  apoyarlo  en llevar  acabo su proyecto,  el cual consiste  en  realizar  arreglos en la  fachada   de  su  vivienda, así  como   pintar  su   domicilio, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la  realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Sr. Osvaldo is a responsible individual who is concerned about providing the best for his family since they are the most important part of his life. He wants his home to have a better appearance and be more comfortable for his family. For this reason, he approached Credituyo for assistance with finishing his project, which consists of repairing the façade of his house, as well as painting it.

Osvaldo is grateful for the support that has been given to him so that he can complete his project.

loans.use: to repair and paint the façade of his house.

loans.name: Edik

texts.ru:
Эдику 35 лет, он живет в селе Ужанис, Сюникского региона, вместе со своей женой, тремя сыновьями и родителями-пенсионерами. Старшие сыновья Эдика учатся в сельской средней школе, младшему сыну 4 годика. Жена Эдика занимается домашним хозяйством и помагает мужу на ферме. 
С 1990 года Эдик занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Ужанис: разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур, овец и пчел. А также выращивает овощи и фрукты, пшеницу, ячмень на собственной земле, а арендованный участок земли служит пастбищем для коров и овец. Эдик реализует выращенные овощи, фрукты, пшеницу, а также говядину, баранину, молоко, яйца и мед своим постоянным покупателям в городе Капан. 
Кредит на сумму 500.000 драм необходим Эдику для проведения посевных работ:  покупки нового сорта зерна, дизельного топлива, удобрений и т.д.
texts.en: Edik is 35 years old, he lives in the village of Uzhanis, Syunik province together with his wife, three sons and his retired parents. Edik's older sons are studying at the village's school and his youngest is 4 years old. Edik's wife is a homemaker and helps her husband on the farm as well. Edik had his farm since 1990 and raises cattle, chickens, sheep and bees. He also grows fruits, vegetables, wheat and oats on his own land and rents a pasture where he grazes his sheep and cattle. Edik sells produce as well as beef, lamb, milk eggs and honey to longtime customers in the city of Kapan. He requires a loan of 500,000 dram for the winter growing season in order to purchase new seed varieties, diesel fuel, fertilizer etc.

loans.use: To buy new sort of seeds, diesel fuel, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Camino Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Nuevo Camino” lo conforman 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran peluquería, artesanía en greda, venta de ropa, artesanía en lana, venta de verduras, venta de ropa interior, de perfumes, venta de carbón, criadero de chanchos, preparación y venta de comida rápida. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán. 
Carolina integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo al lado derecho en primer lugar, ella usa anteojos y viste un sweater color plomo, se dedica al comercio específicamente venta de ropa nueva de temporada. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace un año. Comenta que le ha ido muy bien.
Su mercadería la compra en el barrio Patronato en la ciudad de Santiago, lugar conveniente económicamente en la compra de mercadería para comerciantes.
Carolina vende puerta a puerta, cobra y deja mercadería también.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de temporada primavera verano para niños y adultos, además ropa de casa (artículos de cocina).  
Sus metas son seguir trabajando, de manera de generar mayores ganancias, su motivación es ahorrar para postular al subsidio habitacional. 
Carolina vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad. Sus sueños son poder costear los estudios profesionales de sus hijos, especialmente de su hija mayor.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios obtenidos por Fondo Esperanza, ya que la ayuda le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y que éste prospere. Las capacitaciones también le han servido para administrar la contabilidad de su negocio. Con los demás emprendedores tiene una buena relación, ya que se conocen y son comprometidos. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Nuevo Camino” (New Road) and consists of 17 entrepreneurs. They engage in different business activities such as managing a beauty parlor, making works of clay, selling clothes, making crafts out of wool, selling vegetables, selling undergarments, selling perfumes, selling charcoal, raising pigs, and preparing and selling fast food. All of the members are from the city of Chillán.

Carolina is a member of the Communal Bank. In the photograph, she is seated on the first row, wearing glasses and a dark-colored sweater. Carolina is a merchant who specifically sells new seasonal clothing. She has been in this business for one year and has done very well. Her merchandise is purchased in the neighborhood of Patronato in the city of Santiago, a convenient place where merchants can buy their inventory. Carolina sells door-to-door, delivering merchandise and collecting payments. With this loan, she will buy spring and summer clothing for children and adults, as well as kitchen linens. Her goals include continuing to work so that she can generate higher profits. She is motivated to save so that she can apply for a housing subsidy. Carolina lives with her husband and two children, ages 16 and 10. Her dream is to be able to afford the cost of her children’s professional studies, especially those of her older daughter.

Carolina is very pleased with and grateful for the services offered by Fondo Esperanza. The support has allowed her to invest in her business and prosper. The training seminars have also helped her manage the cash flow of her business. She has a good relationship with the other members because they know one another and are committed.

Chillán is a community in south-central Chile. Its name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuche people. Chillán is also known as “The Cradle of the Nation” and “Land of Artists” because many leading figures in Chilean history were born here, such as the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy spring and summer clothing for children and adults, as well as kitchen linens.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra es  una persona  muy trabajadora,  ella  actualmente   tiene  una tienda de abarrotes  en su domicilio la cual atiende  personalmente   y  le permite   sacar  adelante  día  con día a  su  familia, ella  se  preocupa  por  ofertarles  a sus  clientes  un excelente  servicio  así como  también una  gran  variedad de  productos,  es  por  ello  que  ella  necesita  realizar  la  compra  de mercancía para   contar   con inventario  suficiente  para  ofrecer  a  sus  clientes, ve  en el  crédito la  posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio , además  de  atraer  a  un mayor  numero de  clientes los  cuales  le permitirán   generar  mayores  ingresos, agradece  el  apoyo    brindado para  la  realización de   su proyecto.
texts.en: Sandra is a very hardworking person. She has a small grocery store in her home that she runs personally. It allows her to get her family ahead day by day. She is concerned with giving her customers excellent service as well as a variety of products. That is why she needs to buy merchandise to have enough inventory to offer her customers. She sees in the loan the possibility of growing her business, as well as attracting more customers which will allow her to generate more income. SHe is grateful for the support offered for this project.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy natural medicine and products

loans.name: Ameriko Group

texts.en: Given is 24 years old and stays in Kwekwe. He is married with no children but cares for one dependent. Given runs a retail business selling cell phones and is also a commodity broker. The retail business has been in operation for two years. He says the main challenge he faces is theft resulting in him making losses. Given has requested a loan of $400 to boost the business by buying more cell phones and accessories. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to purchase new furniture for the family home. In the future, Given plans to own his own house and business as well as to employ other people.

loans.use: to purchase more cell phones

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en:
Gorreti is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has four children.  All of her children are currently in school. Gorreti has a poultry farm business, which she has had for eight years. She also has a second business of a small retail shop that sells soft drinks.         

To help expand her business, Gorreti has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Gorreti hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Gorreti hopes to expand her business. Gorreti is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children. Three of her children are currently in school. Sylvia has a business selling clothes, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to expand her business. Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Rose has a poultry firm, which she has had for 10 years.    

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business. Rose is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal “Las Palomitas” es un grupo conformada por  07 personas responsables y dispuestas a seguir trabajando.
Norma es natural de   Cerro de Pasco pero con la idea de surgir llego a Lima desde muy joven, actualmente tiene 38 años de edad y su familia está conformada por ella su esposo y 4 hijos. Norma se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza la cual lleva más de 01 año dedicándose a dicho rubro, ella se inicio en ese negocio gracias a que una amiga la animara a emprender su propio negocio, también nos cuenta que vende artefactos la cual trabajo sobre pedidos que le hacen sus conocidos y familiares, este trabajo le ha ayudado a tener una estabilidad económica para su hogar, es por ello que sigue apoyando a sus dos menores hijos en su educación. El anhelo de Norma es de comprar su propia vivienda ya que por momento vive en casa de su suegra. Con el crédito que solicito va invertir comprando productos de belleza como talco, perfumes, cremas, colonias. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Palomitas” agradece y están comprometidos a seguir trabajando bien. La señora Paulina no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The "Little Doves" community bank is comprised by seven individuals who are very responsible and willing to continue working. Norma is originally from Cerro de Pasco but she arrived in Lima at a young age to get ahead. She is currently 38 years old. In her family there's herself, her husband and their 4 children. 

Norma sells beauty products. She has been in this line of business for over a year. She started when a friend encouraged her to start her own business. She also explains that she sells items on demand, based on the orders placed by friends and family. The business has helped her achieve financial stability for her home and enabled her to continue to support the education of her two youngest children. 

Norma's goal is to buy her own home, as she's living under her mother-in-law's roof at the moment. With the requested loan she invest in the purchase of beauty products such as talcum powder, perfumes, lotions and colognes. The "Little Doves" community bank is grateful for the loan an is committed to keeping up the hard work. Paulina wasn't able to attend due to work reasons.

loans.use: to buy talc, perfumes, lotions and colognes.

loans.name: Cesar  Augusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar es  un cliente antiguo antes era socio del grupo solidario raza de bronce, es un cliente  puntual  en sus pagos por tal motivo no se dudo en darle otro crédito.  El cliente se dedica a la venta de comida  en una pensión que es  de su propiedad en la zona  Villa Victoria de la ciudad de la paz. El crédito se destinara en la compra de un televisor de pantalla plana y víveres para su actividad que realiza tiene dos hijos que están en la edad escolar, tiene  gran visión para  los negocios y quiere superarse  y fortalecerse con su  negocio que es la venta de  comidas y en el futuro desea tener otro negocio de un café internet.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar is a long term client, who was previously a member of the 'Raza de Bronce' solidarity group. He is a client who is punctual with his repayments,  therefore there has been no hesitation in giving him another loan. Cesar sells food in a small cafe, which is his own property located in the Villa Victoria district in the city of La Paz. The intended use of this loan is to buy a flat screen TV and provisions for his business. 

Cesar has two school-age children. He possesses strong business acumen, and wants to improve himself and become stronger through his business selling food. In future he would also like to run an internet cafe business.

loans.use: to buy provisions and a flat screen television for his business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school.  Rose has a wholesale shop that sells soft drinks, which she has had for five years.    

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sodas and beer for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.  Rose is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase sodas and beer for resale.

loans.name: Dzingenhamo Group

texts.en:
This is Florence from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. This is her second Kiva loan. Florence raises chickens and also runs a flea market business selling pots, clothes, and fruit. She says the main challenge she faces is competition, but recently the business has significantly improved and she now has managed to employ one person. 

Florence has requested a loan of $400 to buy pots from South Africa where she visits regularly for procurement. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to build her own house and have a shop.

loans.use: to buy pots, clothes and fruit

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Rose has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar and salt, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business and make it a wholesale shop. Rose is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Elena Petrona

texts.es: La Sra. Elena vive en la zona de la Villa Primero de mayo junto con su esposo en la casa de su madre. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y de cosméticos la cual vende al contado y a crédito su esposo es consultor independiente. El crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar su capital de trabajo con la compra de mercadería ropa de temporada ya que tiene muchos pedidos porque ha aumentado sus clientes tanto de ropa como de cosméticos. La Sra. Elena se fijo como meta tener su propia casa y por eso con los créditos que le esta otorgando Emprender y Kiva ella esta saliendo adelante.
texts.en: Elena lives in an area called Villa Primero de Mayo with her husband. They currently live in her mother's house. Elena sells clothing and cosmetics. She offers her customers the option of paying in cash or on credit. Her husband is an independent consultant. The loan Elena is requesting will provide her with working capital to increase her inventory of seasonal clothing. She has a growing number of customers and demand is high. Elena hopes to be able to afford her own house, and the loans she is receiving from Emprender and Kiva are helping her reach this goal.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Juan vive en la zona del gallito del plan 3000 el es soltero vive en la casa de sus padres su punto de internet esta funcionando desde hace dos años y medio, este es su segundo crédito en el primer crédito demostró un buen comportamiento de pago. Por la gran demanda de clientes en su barrio esta solicitando este segundo crédito para comprar otro equipo de computación con el cual podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. El sr. Juan  es un joven trabajador con ganas de superación ya que también estudia en la universidad y uno de sus deseos es el de terminar sus estudios y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida de el y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives in an area called Gallito del Plan 3000. He is single and lives with his parents. He owns an internet cafe, which he started two and a half years ago. This will be his second business loan. Juan established good credit history from the prompt repayment of his first loan. His business is growing due to high demand in his neighborhood, and this loan will allow him to buy additional computer equipment to meet customer demand. 

Juan is a hardworking young man with ambitious goals. He is also studying at the university. His goals are to graduate with a degree and to improve quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: To buy computer equipment.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda.  He is married and has two children. Both of his children are currently in school.  Elisa has a business selling clothes, which he has had for four years.         

To help expand his business, Elisa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Elisa hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Elisa hopes to expand his business. Elisa is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped him prospects for the future by improving his business

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 25 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Stella has a small retail shop that sells soap and sugar, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Stella hopes to expand her business. Stella is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Maria has a small retail shop that sells sugar, salt, etc. She has had this business for six years.
