loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic composts, and seeds.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 33 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

Juan carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y construir la casa para los hijos.


Le gusta hacer deporte y jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) meet in the neighborhood of “Jesús del Gran Poder” (Jesus of Great Power) in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-term farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Juan Carlos is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his supplies at the Roca Commercial Center in Ventanas and sells his products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Juan Carlos is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He plans to buy fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic composts, and seeds (corn, beans, and rice) for producing his crops. With the financial assistance given to his entire family, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include pests and diseases that could impact his crops. His dream is to buy land and build a house for his children.

Juan Carlos enjoys sports and playing with his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic composts, and seeds.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
La Sra. Damaris  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y 01  hijo de 09 años;  estudiante del nivel primario.
Ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos económicos  inicia  su negocio con un capital de  S/. 300.00  nuevos soles, ella se dedica al servicio de lavado de vehículos menores; como motocicletas, y motocarros, ésta actividad es muy rentable y no genera muchos gastos. Actualmente cuenta con un mejor servicio  de atención a sus clientes, su clientela son amigos y público en general.
Con este préstamo de/. 1200.00  nuevos soles, comprará su motobomba, cajas de escobilllas, toallas, caja de detergentes, cajas de jabones, baldes plásticos y silicona a granel en litros, con ello brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Damaris es una mujer emprendedora y activa,  su sueño es contar con un espacio más grande y poder brindar servicios de lavado a vehículos  pesados; está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Damaris is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalypti) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 30 years old and has a nine-year-old son who is an elementary school student.

Since she needed to generate her own income, Damaris started a business with capital of 300 PEN. She provides a service of washing smaller vehicles, such as motorcycles and motorcars. This business is very profitable and has few expenses. She now offers the best service to her customers, which consists of friends and the general public. With this loan of 1200 PEN, she will buy a power washer, brushes, towels, boxes of detergents, boxes of soap, plastic buckets, and silicone glaze by the liter. This will allow her to provide better service to her customers.

Damaris is a hardworking and active woman. Her dream is to have more space so that she can provide washing services for larger vehicles. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a power washer, brushes, towels, boxes of detergents, boxes of soap, plastic buckets, and silicone glaze by the liter.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La Sra. Irene pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 49  años  y tiene dos  hijos de 22 y 15 años, el mayor es estudiante en la carrera de técnico en electricidad industrial y el menor es un niño especial con problemas mentales el cual demanda mucha atención.
Inicia su negocio de venta de abarrotes, pero todo era pérdida no generaba muchas ganancias, debido a que su negocio está ubicado en una zona alejada, de esta manera opta y decide cambiar de giro y comprar un motocarro con un capital  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que  le sirvió de cuota inicial, vehículo que es utilizado para transporte de pasajeros dentro de la ciudad, por lo que está muy contenta ya que las ganancias le sirven para ir pagando poco a poco el precio del vehículo. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, financiará la compra de un motocarro  más, que le servirá para mejorar sus ingresos  a través del alquiler diario de estos vehículos.
Irene es una  mujer trabajadora, su sueño es tener un puesto de venta de abarrotes en el mercado. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder mejorar sus ingresos  y mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia. .
texts.en:
Sra. Irene is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalypti) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 49 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children (ages 22 and 15). Her older child is studying for a technical degree in order to become an industrial electrician. The younger one is a special needs child who experiences mental problems and requires a great deal of attention.

Irene started selling groceries, but this business was a total loss since she was not able to generate much income as a result of being located in a remote area. She decided to change businesses and purchased a motorcar. Irene used capital of 300 PEN as a down payment. She uses the vehicle for transporting passengers around the city. Irene is very pleased with the income it has generated and it has allowed her to gradually pay off the vehicle. With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy another motorcar so that she can improve her income by making it available for rent.

Irene is a hardworking woman. Her dream is to have a vending stall at the market where she can sell groceries. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to earn more income and improve the quality of life of their families.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcar.

loans.name: Ana Segia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad  y dos de 15 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y son los que aun  viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que para ganarse algo propio y con esto contribuir a los gastos que genera el hogar hace mas de 5 años emprendió un negocio, vende  ceviches, encebollados y pescado apanado con arroz ensalada y patacones, platos que son muy degustados por turistas y personas de la localidad que visitan su local. Además de esto su esposo tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres que atiende en un local de su casa. Ella trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de una persona a quien  le paga un sueldo mensual y su esposo le ayuda cuando hay mucho trabajo y el está desocupado.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, yuca, sodas, cervazas y víveres en general para preparar estos deliciosos platos así como también frutas y legumbres para el negocio del esposo. Para ella este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por el orden, la puntualidad y por los beneficios que brinda el banco.

 Sus sueños son salir adelante y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Empresarias Con Futuro” (Businesswomen with a Future) meets every 15 days in El Palmar in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. This city has unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Ana. She is 49 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has six children. Four of them are grown and the other two (ages 15 and 12) are high school students who still live with her. Her husband is a merchant.

Ana is a hardworking woman. Five years ago, she started a business in order to earn her own income and contribute toward the household expenses. She sells “ceviche” (marinated seafood), fried onions, battered fish with rice, salads, and fried plantains. Tourists and locals visit her establishment because her dishes are quite tasty. Her husband has a business selling fruits and legumes from a vending stall in their home. Ana works every day with the help of an employee who is paid a monthly salary. Her husband helps out whenever there is plenty of work and he is not busy.

This loan will be used to buy fish, cassava, sodas, beer, and general ingredients for her delicious dishes. She will also buy fruits and legumes for her husband’s business. This is her sixth loan with the Communal Bank. Ana likes the orderliness, promptness, and benefits offered by her Communal Bank. Her dreams are to move forward and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy fish, cassava, sodas, beer, fruits, and legumes.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Talentosas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 34 años, y tres hijos varones 02  son estudiantes de nivel secundario y el menor está incapacitado.
Lilly es una mujer luchadora y sacrificada, trabaja siempre pensando en el futuro de sus hijos y ante la  necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos  y contando con un capital de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, que le brindó inicialmente el Banco Comunal en Manuela Ramos, decide dedicarse  a la elaboración de chupetes de frutas regionales (helados de hielo), siguió trabajando e incrementó su negocio, actualmente cuenta con un puesto de venta de refrigeR. como juanes, papa rellena, huevos cocidos, humitas, tamales y otros platos típicos de la región; trabaja junto a su hermana; los platos que ofrece son muy agradables  y del deleite de sus consumidores.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles  comprará  mas frutas de la región al por mayor y esencias naturales para la elaboración de chupetes;  insumos como sacos de arroz, sacos de papa, carnes de pollo, utensilios de cocina como sartenes, ollas, y platos.
La Sra. Lilly es una mujer fuerte y tiene como sueño contar con una heladería, además de vender sus refrigeR..  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de crecimiento personal.
texts.en:
Lilly belongs to the communal bank  “Las Mujeres Talentosas II”, in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martin.  She is 34, lives with a partner and has three sons.  Two of her sons are in middle school and the youngest is disabled.  

Lilly is a tenacious woman who makes many sacrifices; she always works thinking of the future of her sons and the need to generate her own income.  Starting with capital of 300 Peruvian soles that was provided initially by her communal bank and Manuela Ramos, she decided to make popsicles from regional fruits (frozen ice treats.)  She continued working and expanding her business, and now she has a sales post where she sells snacks such as juanes (a tamale-type dish that comes wrapped in a banana leaf), stuffed potatoes, cooked eggs, humitas (a corn-based dish), tamales and other dishes that are typical of the region.  She works with her sister, and the dishes that they offer are very nice and are the delight of her customers.

With this new loan of 2,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy more regional fruit at wholesale, and fruit extracts to make her popsicles, and supplies such as sacks of rice, sacks of potatoes, chicken, and kitchen utensils such as frying pans, pots and plates.

Lilly is a strong woman who dreams of having an ice cream shop where she could also sell her snacks.  She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for helping women like her to have opportunities for personal growth.

loans.use: to buy supplies: fruit, natural fruit essences,rice, potatoes, pots, plates, etc.

loans.name: Kalaytu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Kalaytu. She is married and has four children, ages 5, 10, 12, and 20. All of her children attend school. She has one additional dependent who lives with her: her niece. 

In 2000, Kalaytu established her business doing tailoring and selling football game materials. She gained business experience from her husband; since he is a business man, he coached her on how to run her business. He gave her some starting capital to begin her business. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,140,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Kalaytu  has already received and successfully repaid one loan. She will use the new loan to buy wool thread (20 bundles @ 30,000 SLL), footballs (5 doz @ 60,000 SLL), padlocks (20 doz @ 7,000 SLL), and nylon thread (10 bundles @ 30,000 SLL). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 225,000 SLL.  

Kalaytu is quite sure that this money will help her improve her business gradually. In the future, she plans to educate her children to the university level with the support of her husband. She wants her children to be able to take care of them when they retire. 

The rainy season is a threat to her business. Competition is average, but she normally overcomes her competitors due to her customer service. She serves the entire Makeni community. Her suppliers are located at Guinea Conakry and Freetown, where she travels by vehicle twice a week. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase wool thread, footballs, padlocks, and nylon thread

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro  se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Aquí vive la señora Rosa, tiene 61 años de edad, ella es madre soltera de 6 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores  de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y además porque los créditos le han brindado una gran ayuda en su negocio y en su vida personal.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora que para ganarse el sustento diari se dedica al comercio, vende diversos productos y le encanta realizar sus ventas, ella vende productos Yanbal, Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), también ropa y productos para el hogar. Trabaja de lunes a viernes unas tres a cuatro horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto pudo sacar sola a sus hijos adelante.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y ciertos productos para el hogar.
 
Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The Empresarias Con Futuro [Entrepreneurs with a Future] community bank meets every two weeks in el Palmar in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches visited year round and for its unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.  

Rosa lives there. She is 61 year old and a single mother of 6 children. They are all grown and two of them still llive with her. Since the community bank started she has liked it because the group is very close and also the loans it has given her have been a big help for her business and personal life. 

She is a hardworking fighter who works  as a merchant to make her living. She sells various products and she loves making sales. She sells Yanbal products, Esika (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She also sells clothing and products for the home. She works Monday through Friday three or four hours a day. She sells on credit and collects every week or every two weeks according to what her customers want. She has been doing this for more than 10 years and thanks to that she has been able to get her children ahead.
	
The loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothing and certain products for the home.
 
Her dreams are to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothing and products for the home.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La Sra. Betty pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 39 años y 02 hijas de 8 y 7 años, estudiantes del nivel primario.
A partir de los 16 años empezó a trabajar con la venta de chupetes (helados de hielo), golosinas y kekes en las afueras de su casa, esto le permitió contar con independencia económica, desde entonces, la idea del negocio fue su inquietud.  Decidió solicitar un préstamo a Manuela Ramos por S/. 500.00 nuevos soles y vender abarrotes en su casa, actualmente ha incrementado nuevos productos como carnes, huevos, verduras, frutas, todo tipo de bebidas, cereales y cosméticos, cuenta con una buena clientela, pues brinda una buena atención y se esmera por proporcionar a sus clientes lo que ellos necesitan.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará  insumos como productos enlatados, conservas, cajas de leche, sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, aceites en litros, golosinas, sacos verduras, galletas en cajas, perfumes, talcos desodorantes y carnes de vacunos, de aves, y porcinos.
Betty es una mujer creativa y emprendedora,  su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener un minimarket, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Betty, 39,  belongs to the communal bank “Los Eucaliptos”, The Eucalypses, from the Tarapoto district, province and department of San Martín.  She is married and has two daughter, 8 and 7, who are in primary school.
16 years ago she began selling “chupetes” (popsicles), candies and cakes outsides of her house.  This gave her some economic independence and since then she had been eager to start a business.  She decided to request a loan from Manuela Ramos of 500 new sols and sell groceries in her house.  She has now added new products such as meats, eggs, vegetables, fruit, all kinds of drinks, cereals, and cosmetics.  She has a good customer bases because she gives good service and she wants to offer her customers all that they need.
With this loan of 2,500 new sols, she will buy products such as canned goods, conserves, boxes of milk, sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, liters of oil, cookies, sacks of vegetables, boxes of cookies, perfumes, talcum powder, deoderants, beef, poultry and pork.
Betty is a creative and entrepreneurial woman whose dream is to increase her business and have a minimarket.  She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering the opportunity to women like her to be able to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as canned goods, conserves, milk, etc

loans.name: Sara Magdalena

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer emprendedora de 34 años, que se vio en la necesidad de emprender un negocio propio para apoyar en los ingresos de su hogar ya que debido a la crisis que aumenta cada día no se abastecían con los gastos que se generan en el diario vivir. Junto a su hermana con la que trabajan desde las 7:00 hasta las 15:00 haciendo comida y  recorriendo el sector vendiendo ropa. La competencia es dura indica pero no hay que desfallecer.

Tienen 2 hijos cada uno de 15 y 9 años que estudian en instituciones públicas y está casada con Jorge quien trabaja como asalariado en una compañía. Desea un préstamo para comprar más mercadería y ropa , para así poder poner un local propio que lleve su nombre.
texts.en: Sara is an enterprising 34 year-old woman who saw the need to start her own business so that she could contribute to the household income, because due to the economic crisis the cost of living has been rising each day.  She works with her sister from 7am until 3pm making food and going out in the neighborhood selling clothing.  The competition is stiff, but she doesn't lose heart.  They each have 2 children aged 15 and 9 who are in public school.  Sara is married to Jorge, who works as an employee for a company.  She wants a loan to purchase more merchandise and clothing so that she can have her own store that carries her name.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Chowana

texts.es:
La Sra. Chowana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos, de 16 y 02 años de edad, el mayor es estudiante de nivel superior.
Inicialmente trabajaba como técnica en secretariado ejecutivo en la municipalidad y con el cambio de gobierno pierde su estabilidad laboral.
Con seguridad y gran entrega e independencia decide vender en el terminal terrestre sus comidas preparadas, de esta manera consigue poder solventar sus gastos familiares. Inició con un capital de  S/ 300.00  nuevos soles,  y actualmente vende en su propia casa,  brinda pensión de desayunos, almuerzos y cenas a los estudiantes universitaR. e institutos privados, el  trabajo que viene desarrollando le facilita estar más tiempo con sus hijos y se siente muy satisfecha.
Con este nuevo crédito de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como verduras, huevos, pollos, carnes  sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar,  aceites en litros, variedades de menestras, frutas y verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra platos, cucharas, vasos, utensilios de cocina, mesas y sillas.
Desea tener su propio restaurante y ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Chowana belongs to the communal bank "Sembrando Futuro," in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martin.  She is 36, lives with a partner, and is the mother of 2 children aged 16 and 2.  The oldest child is in high school.

Initially she was working as a technician in the executive secretariat of the municipality, and with the change in government she lost her job security.  

With confidence and great dedication and independence, she decided to sell her prepared meals in the bus terminal and in this way cover her family's expenses.  She started with capital of 300 Peruvian soles, and now she sells from her own house, providing a service where she prepares pre-ordered breakfasts to regular customers and lunches and dinners to university students and private institutes.  This business that she has been developing allows her to have more time with her children, so she feels very satisfied.

With this new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy supplies such as vegetables, eggs, chicken, meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, liters of cooking oil, and a variety of beans, fruits and vegetables.  Also, she will use part of the money to buy plates, spoons, glasses, kitchen utensils, tables and chairs.

She wants to have her own restaurant and see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies including: vegetables, eggs. chicken, meat, plates, spoons, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Betty Gisella

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro  se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 9 y 2 años y medio, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo son socios de una cadena de locales donde venden pollos asados, ellos administran uno de esos locales, allí trabajan todos los días desde las 12 del día hasta las 12 de la noche y cuentan con personal para la atención de los clientes, todos los locales de  esta cadena de asadero de pollos es muy reconocida dentro de la provincia por la calidad de los alimentos que brinda a sus clientes. Ellos llevan seis años trabajando como socios de esta marca y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para invertir en su negocio, van a comprar pollos, papas, arroz, sodas, cervezas y otros productos que se comercializan en su local. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy agradable y las socias son buenas amigas.
 
Sus sueños son seguir mejorando en su negocio y creciendo más con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
The communal bank Empresarias con Futuro (Businesswomen with a Future) meets twice a month in El Palmar in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are well visited in every season of the year, and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Señora Betty, who is 34 years old, lives in this place. She is married and has three children, ages 10, 9, and 2 and a half. The two older children are in school. Her husband is a businessman.

She and her husband are members a chain of locations where they sell roasted chicken. They administer one of the locations. They work there every day from noon until midnight, and they have a staff to attend to the customers. All the locations of this chain of chicken-roasting stands are well known within the province for the quality of the foods that they offer their customers. They have been working as members of this chain for six years, and it is going very well for them.

This loan will be invested in their business. They are going to buy chickens, potatoes, rice, sodas, beer, and other products that they sell in their stand. This is their third loan cycle in the communal bank, and they like it because the group is very pleasant and the members are good friends.
 
Their dreams are to continue improving their business and growing more as time goes on.

loans.use: to buy chickens, potatoes, rice, sodas, beer, etc.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Isabel empezó dando clases a los niños de su barrio, cuando una vecina le explicó la venta de mercadería por catálogo, lo que la emocionó y se inscribió en el negocio, le resultó mejor que dar clases.
Actualmente vende productos Avon y otros cosmeticos.

Trabaja sola y sus clientes la llaman para hacer lo pedidos por teléfono.Su dificultad al momento de vender es que por su sector rondan muchos ladrones por lo que ya le ha robado en alguna ocasión. Casada y madre de 2 hijos que estudian. Desea obtener un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, pero en el futuro desea establecer un local de ropa, zapatos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isabel began giving classes to the children in her neighborhood, when a neighbor explained the sale of merchandise by catalog to her. This excited her and she signed up for the business, which turned out to be better than giving classes. Now she sells Avon products and other cosmetics.

She works alone, and her customers call her to place their orders by telephone. Her difficulty at time of selling is that many thieves hand around her district and thus she has been robbed a few times. She is married and is the mother of two children who are in school. She wants to obtain a loan to invest in her business, but it the future she wants to establish a shop with clothing and shoes and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy perfunes, creams, lotions, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 42 años y 02 hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad estudiantes de nivel superior y primario.
Rosa es una mujer con una personalidad fuerte, luchadora, independiente con la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos a pesar de las adversidades.  Debido a problemas familiares, decidió dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes por iniciativa propia sacrificando sus ahorros y con el apoyo del banco comunal de Manuela Ramos con un inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles empezó a implementar su negocio. 
La separación con su pareja  no la amilanó, todo lo contrario, se dedicó a hacer crecer su negocio, actualmente continúa desarrollando esta actividad, con la cual ha logrado sacar adelante a sus  hijos. También cuenta con una buena clientela como son: los vecinos y moradores de la zona pues les brinda un trato amable.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00, nuevos soles comprará productos que tienen más salida para implementar su negocio como golosinas, sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche y aceite por cajas, conservas, paquetes de gaseosas y refrescos  en cajas, paquetes de galletas y otros.
Rosa Victoria es una mujer trabajadora,  su sueño es implmentar su negocio de venta de refrigerios en su casa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de crecer como mujer y micro empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Victoria belongs to the communal bank "Los Eucaliptos" (The Eucalyptuses) in the district of Tarapoto in the province and department of San Martín. She is single and is 42 years old. She has two children, ages 17 and 10, who are students in secondary and primary school.

Rosa is a woman with a strong, hard-working, independent personality and the need to raise her children in spite of the adversities. As a result of family problems, she decided on her own initiative to work selling groceries, sacrificing her savings and with the help of the Manuela Ramos communal bank. With an initial loan of 500 PEN, she began to set up her business.

The separation from her husband did not intimidate her; on the contrary, she worked to make her business grow. Now she continues developing her business, with which she has managed to raise her children. She also has a good clientele, who are neighbors and residents of the area, since she treats them kindly.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN she will buy products that sell well to stock her business, such as candies, bags of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, oil by the box, canned foods, packages of soft drinks and beverages in boxes, packages of crackers, and other items. 

Rosa Victoria is a hard-working woman. Her dream is to set up a business selling refreshments in her house. She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering her the opportunity to grow as a woman and micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as candies, rice, sugar, etc., for her store

loans.name: Santa Griselda

texts.es:
Santa D. 31 años, tiene muchas aspiraciones para ser una microempresaria por eso que tiene una pequeña tienda para mejorar sus ingresos. Poco a poco ha venido incrementando L. mercadería con ayuda D. su esposo que es maestro constructor. 
Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital D. trabajo. En L. actualidad trabaja en su propia tienda vendiendo víveres D. primera necesidad como granos, bebidas, enlatados etc.  Para mejorar su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc.
texts.en:
Santa is 31 years old and has many aspirations of becoming a micro-entrepreneur. For this reason, she opened a small store in her home so that she could improve her income. Little by little, she was able to increase her inventory of merchandise with the help of her husband who is a master builder.

Santa was also able to increase her operating capital gradually. At the moment, she works in her store and sells basic necessities such as grain, beverages, canned goods, and other items. To improve her store, she wants to use this loan to buy rice, canned goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: María Antonieta

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 59 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y todos viven en su casa pero en departamentos independientes con sus respectivas familias.
 
Ella tiene un negocio de internet y cabinas telefónicas, allí ofrece el servicio de llamadas tanto nacionales como al extranjero así como el de internet, en este lugar además de prestar estos servicios también vende golosinas, bocadillos de picar, sodas, energizantes, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 22h00 que se va a descansar, son muchos años que tiene su negocio y son muchas las personas que llegan a su local.
 
Este crédito es para comprar golosinas, sodas y pagar la cuenta del servicio telefónico y de internet. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque estos créditos son un impulso para personas como ella en sus negocios.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Empresarias Con Futuro” (Businesswomen with a Future) meets every 15 days in El Palmar in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. This city has unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Sra. María lives in this area. She is 59 years old and currently single, but has been in a relationship for several years. María has three children who are all adults and live at home. They reside in separate areas of her house with their respective families.

María has a business consisting of an Internet café and phone booths. She offers national and international calls, as well as Internet service. In addition to providing these services, she also sells candy, snacks, sodas, energy drinks, calling cards, and rechargeable phone credits. María works every day from 8am to 10pm, leaving her fatigued. She has been in business for several years and many people come to her establishment.

This loan will be used to buy candy and sodas, as well as pay her telephone and Internet bills. María has participated in two loan cycles with her Communal Bank. She enjoys being a member because the loans have been a boost to people like her who need the money to run their businesses.

Her dreams include moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to pay her telephone and Internet bills and to buy candy and sodas.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Exito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Madeleine vive en la zona D. Puente Piedra al norte D. Lima Perú, ella aun siendo muy joven es muy trabajadora,  tiene un minimarket  que lleva por nombre “RAQUELITA” cuando inicio su negocio era una tienda pequeña que solo ocupaba una parte D. su casa, al transcurrir el tiempo su negocio ha crecido y mejorado su minimarket es completo y  abastece a sus clientes con todo tipo D. productos entre frutas, verduras como abarrotes diversos como azúcar, arroz, fideos etc. sus ventas son buenas y eso la ayuda para seguir mejorando, lo que hace es seguir invirtiendo en su mismo negocio, en esta oportunidad su préstamo le servirá para la  compra D. licores algo que sus clientes le piden y D. esa manera su negocio será completo,  también extenderá su negocio  para hacerlo mas granD. para la comodidad D. sus clientela, con el grupo “PROSPERIDAD Y ÉXITO” ya tiene 03 años son  08 socias que conforman el grupo.

 La Sra. Madeleine viste pantalon color guinda esta al final D. todas.
texts.en:
Sra. Madeleine lives in the District of Puente Piedra, which is north of Lima in Peru. Although she is a very young woman, she is a hard worker and owns a mini-market called “Raquelita”. When she started her business, it was a small stO. but it has grown and improved. Her mini-market is completely stocked. Her customers come to buy all types of products such as fruits, vegetables, and different groceries such as sugar, rice, noodles, and other items that sell well. This helps her to continue improving and reinvesting in her business.

On this occasion, her loan will be used to buy liquors that her customers have requested so that her business will be complete. She will also expand her business to make it larger and mO. comfortable for her customers. Madeleine has been a member of the group “Prosperidad y Éxito” (Prosperity and Success) for three years. There are eight members in the group.

In the photograph, Sra. Madeline is wearing maroon-colored trousers and seated at the end of the row.

loans.use: to buy liquor to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora de mariscos. Vende pescados y camarones a sus vecinos y conocidos. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso desea mejorar su estilo de vida vendiendo mas mariscos. 

Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales tres sol mayores de edad y los otros estudian su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiares ya que es maestro albañil. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en el futuro por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para su casa como zinc, cemento, etc.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 44 years old and works hard at her job as a seafood vendor. She sells fish and shrimp to her neighbors and acquaintances. Alexandra works from 7am to 12pm every day. She has many aspirations for her business, such as selling more seafood in order to improve her lifestyle.

Alexandra has six children, three of whom are adults while the rest are in school. Her husband helps with the family expenses through his job as a master stonemason. Alexandra has many aspirations for the future, so she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials for her home such as zinc, cement, and other items.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home such as zinc, cement, and other items.

loans.name: Eufemia Catalina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro  se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

La señora Eufemia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la responsabilidad tanto de sus compañeras como de la institución. Tiene 54 años de edad, hace 5 años su compañero de toda la vida falleció, sus hijos son mayores de edad y dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Desde muy pequeña aprendió corte y confección.

Ella para ganarse la vida hace mas de 30 años puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura en el cual confecciona todo tipo de ropa especialmente de mujer y de niños, también realizar arreglos a prendas de vestir que sus clientes le llevan para que les haga las correcciones del caso. Nuestra amiga les cose a personas y vecinos que llegan hasta su casa para que les realice sus obras. Además de esto también vende ropa y sabanas y esto lo hace en su mismo local al mismo tiempo que realiza su trabajo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, sabanas y ciertos materiales de costura como telas, hilos, botones, etc.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran taller de costura y salud sobretodo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Empresarias Con Futuro” (Businesswomen with a Future) meets every 15 days in El Palmar in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. This city has unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Sra. Eufemia is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys having responsibility for her fellow group members and the organization. She is 54 years old and became a widow five years ago when her life partner passed away. Her children are grown and two of them still live with her. As a young girl, Eufemia learned how to sew and make clothes.

She has been earning her living in this manner for more than 30 years. Eufemia has a small sewing workshop in her home where she makes all types of clothing, especially for women and children. She also performs alterations for her customers who bring to her garments that need to be mended. Eufemia sews for people and neighbors who come to her house so that she can perform the required work. In addition to sewing, she also sells clothing and bed sheets from the same place where she engages in her work.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, bed sheets, and sewing materials such as fabric, thread, buttons, and other items. Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and to be in overall good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bed sheets, and sewing materials such as fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria forma parte del Banco comunal “Antu Domo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas por catalogo, desde hace 10 años, comenzó vendiendo en una empresa que tenía una sucursal en la ciudad de Temuco, actualmente trabaja directamente con una empresa de joyas de la ciudad de Santiago, por lo que en ésta compra su mercadería, que además exhibe sus joyas en la ciudad de Temuco una vez al mes. En estos catálogos ofrece diferentes productos. Paralelamente también cuenta con otro negocio que es la venta de productos de mar preparados, listos para servir, estos productos los compra en la ciudad de Puerto Montt, posteriormente los envasa, etiqueta y entrega en locales, eventos y restaurantes. Estos productos son exclusivos. Su horario en ambos negocios es flexible.
Con el crédito comprará específicamente cadenas, pendientes, pulseras, colgantes y anillos, joyas de la temporada primavera verano.
Sus metas para su negocio son cursar un curso de orfebrería para realizar sus propios e innovadores diseños y espera también abrir un taller que ofrezca sus joyas. 
Gloria vive junto a su hijo menor, el trabaja de manera independiente. Sus sueños son poder independizarse económicamente y que pueda solventar sus gastos solo con el negocio de la joyería. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con los créditos y servicios entregados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha brindado la oportunidad y confianza. Las capacitaciones y reuniones le han permitido conocer experiencias de sus compañeras del grupo del Banco comunal. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the "Antu Domo" community bank which is located in the city of Temuco.  She has been selling jewelry through catalogs for 10 years.

Gloria started out selling jewelry in a company that had a branch in the city of Temuco.  She currently works directly with a jewelry company in the city of Santiago.  She buys her merchandise from them and displays her jewelry in the city of Temuco once a month.  She sells different products from the catalogs.  In parallel with this, Gloria also has another business selling seafood which is prepared and ready to serve.  She buys these products in the town of Puerto Montt and then packages them, puts labels on them and delivers them to stores, events and restaurants.  These products are exclusive.  Her working hours for both businesses are flexible.

Gloria will use her loan to buy chains, earrings, bracelets, pendants and rings: Spring and Summer season jewelry.

Gloria's goal for her business is to attend a course to learn how to work precious metals so that she can make her own, innovative designs.  She also hopes to open a store where she can sell her jewelry.

Gloria lives together with her youngest son who works independently.  Her dreams is to be able to become financially independent so that she can cover her expenses herself through her jewelry business.  The training sessions and meetings have allowed her to learn from the experiences of her fellow community bank members.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the area there are a number of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very colorful native flora and fauna which can be found in nearby nature reserves.  We should point out that 50% of the Mapuche (the native people of our country) live in this region.

loans.use: to buy chains, earrings, bracelets, pendants and rings - Spring and Summer season jewelry

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Talentosas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 27 años y es madre de 02 niñas; la mayor tiene 10 años estudiante de primaria y la menor tiene 05 años estudiante de inicial.
Ella inició su negocio con S/.300.00 nuevos soles, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, viéndose en la necesidad de cubrir sus gastos familiares y gracias al Banco Comunal de Manuela Ramos y muy motivada por su familia, decide incrementar su negocio con gaseosas, esto en asociación con su hermana, ambas se ayudan mutuamente, poco a poco fue ganando clientela de los diferentes talleres cercanos y transeúntes a quienes atiende con la amabilidad que le caracteriza.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará baldes plásticos grandes, vasos de vidrio, mesas, sillas, paquetes de gaseosas de las diferentes  marcas, tamaños y sabores, sacos de azúcar y diversidad de frutas de la región para surtir su negocio.
Elizabeth sueña con tener un local propio para su negocio, de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y birndar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan. Está muy agradecida por los préstamos del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mujeres Talentosas” (The Talented Women) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two daughters. The older child is a ten-year-old student in elementary school and the younger one is a five-year-old kindergarten student.

Elizabeth started her business with 300 PEN. She sells soft drinks because she needs to cover her family expenses. Thanks to her Communal Bank and Manuela Ramos, she is very motivated to work on behalf of her family. She decided to increase her business by adding sodas. Elizabeth works with her sister and they both help one another. Gradually over time, she has gained customers who include workers from nearby factories and pedestrians off the street. She attends to them in a friendly manner.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, Elizabeth will buy large plastic buckets, glasses, tables, chairs, packets of sodas (of various brands, sizes, and flavors), sacks of sugar, and different regional fruits so that she can restock her business. She dreams of having her own location for her business so that she can improve her income and provide her children everything they need. Elizabeth is very grateful for the loans from Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to buy buy large plastic buckets, glasses, tables, chairs, packets of sodas, sacks of sugar, and different regional fruits.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Del Algodonal Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Cirila  es madre soltera tiene 05 hijos y es por ellos que  trabaja incansablemente durante algún tiempo se dedicaba a vender ollas y utensilios D. cocina esto lo hacia informalmente, para eso recorría a pie varios mercados D. la zona esto implicaba mucho sacrificio debido a la fatiga y al  peligro en las calles,  en uno D. sus tantos recorridos vio la forma D. cambiar D. negocio  alquilo un puesto D. venta en un mercado y empezó con  la a venta D. D. condimentos y especerías, con muy pocos productos a duras penas  sacaba para el pago del alquiler del puesto pero  durante el paso del tiempo ha surgido y mejorado tal es así que ha podido comprar el puesto que antes alquilaba su negocio ha crecido mucho ahora tiene mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientas, lo que mas venD. son especerías, leches, aceites etc. su actual préstamo le será D. gran utilidad para comprar  embutidos y huevos, su inversión mas importante es la educación para sus hijos, la Sra. Cirila es parte del grupo “ LOS GIRASOLES DEL ALGODONAL” que esta formado por 10 socias.

   * La Sra. Cirila viste chompa marron es la 3ra D. la derecha.
texts.en:
Sra. Cirila is a single mother with five children. For this reason, she had worked tirelessly for some time selling pots and cooking utensils on an informal basis. Cirila traveled on foot to the various markets in the area. The work required great sacrifice because the effort caused her fatigue and she also had to endure the danger in the streets. During one of her trips, she saw the opportunity to change her business by renting a vending stall at a market. Cirila began selling condiments and spices. With very few products, she barely earned enough money to pay the rent on her vending stall. As time passed, her business improved to the point that she was able to buy the vending stall she previously rented. Her business has grown tremendously and now she has more products to offer to her customers. The products she sells most are spices, milk, oil, and other items.

Her current loan will be useful for buying sausages and eggs. This investment is very important because it will help her proviD. an education for her children. Sra. Cirila is a member of the group “Los Girasoles del Algodonal” (The Sunflowers in the Cotton Field), which consists of 10 members.

*Sra. Cirila is seated third from the right, wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy sausages and eggs.

loans.name: Debora Angela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Aquí vive la señora Debora, tiene 57 años  de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad pero aun vive con ella. Lleva en el Banco Comunal dos ciclos y le gusta porque en las reuniones se entretiene y se olvida de sus problemas con sus amigas del grupo.

Ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual se dedica a la venta de repuestos para bicicletas y artículos de ferretería. También se dedica a las bienes raíces pues se encarga de vender terrenos y viviendas en toda la ciudad de Manta por lo cual recibe buenas comisiones por las ventas realizadas. Trabaja todos los días en ambas  actividades desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, trabaja sola a pesar de que este es un trabajo un poco pesado, pero esto le sirvió de mucho para salir adelante sola con su hijo.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos pqara bicicletas y artículos de ferretería.
 
Sus sueños son seguir en sus negocios ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se alegra la vida.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Empresarias Con Futuro” (Businesswomen with a Future) meets every 15 days in El Palmar in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. This city has unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Sra. Debora lives in this area. She is 57 years old and a single mother of an adult son who still lives with her. Debora has participated in two loan cycles with her Communal Bank. She enjoys the meetings because they are entertaining and allow her to forget her problems since she gets to be with her friends in the group.

Debora has a shop in her home where she sells bicycle parts and hardware. She is also involved in real estate, having responsibility for selling land and homes throughout the city of Manta. Debora earns good commissions from her completed sales. She works every day in both activities from 8am to 6pm. Debora works alone even though her job has many duties. However, her work has enabled her to move on successfully along with her son.

This loan will be used to buy bicycle parts and hardware goods. Her dreams are to continue in her businesses and to have an entertaining and happy life.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts and hardware goods.

loans.name: Monica Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Mónica Maribel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 38  años y tiene  01 niña de 05 años.
Mónica es de profesión Técnica en Enfermería y Computación, triunfadora y muy activa, laboró en Lima 7 años ejerciendo su carrera y por motivos de salud tuvo que renunciar y regresó a la ciudad de Tarapoto, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.  Obtuvo un préstamo inicial de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, actualmente viene ofreciendo productos de belleza de otras líneas así como prendas intimas de damas y caballeros, colonias cítricas, perfumes y accesorios de belleza, cuenta con una importante cartera de clientes que le permite obtener buenas ganancias.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles comprará productos de belleza para su stock como: perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos para adultos y bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas, prendas de vestir y otros productos a pedido de sus clientes.
Mónica es una  mujer muy alegre y emprendedora le pone muchas ganas a su negocio es por esta razón que su sueño es tener su propia boutique, está trabajando para ello.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por permitirle hacer posible su sueño.
texts.en:
Sra. Mónica Maribel is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalypti) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 38 years old, single, and has a five-year-old daughter.

Mónica has a professional degree in nursing and computer science and was a successful and active woman. She worked in jobs related to her field for seven years in the city of Lima, but she had to quit for health reasons and returned to the city of Tarapoto. At that point, she decided to sell cosmetics. Mónica obtained her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 PEN. She currently offers beauty products from different brands as well as undergarments for women and men, citrus-scented colognes, perfumes, and beauty accessories. Mónica maintains a clientele of important customers, which helps her earn a good income.

With this new loan of 3000 PEN, she will buy beauty products to restock her inventory such as men’s and women’s perfumes, crèmes, press powders, talcum powders for adults and babies, lip pencils, nail polishes, clothing, and other products that her customers have ordered.

Mónica is a cheerful and enterprising woman who has plenty to gain from her business. For this reason, she dreams of opening a boutique and is working toward that goal. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for making her dream possible.

loans.use: to buy men’s and women’s perfumes, crèmes, press powders, talcum powders for adults and babies, lip pencils, nail polishes, clothing, and other products.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Osman. He is married to an experienced salesperson and has six children, ages 5, 8, 10, 12, 15 and 18. He has two additional dependents who live with him and help in his business. 

In 1996, Osman established his butcher shop. He started his business with money from the sale of a piece of land. He can now maintain his savings.  Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL.   Osman has already received and successfully repaid one loan. He will use the new loan to buy cows (4 @ 900,000 SLL), goats (6 @ 50,000 SLL), and sheep (3 @ 120,000 SLL). He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. In the future, Osman plans to open another butcher shop, support his children's education, and buy a vehicle to transport animals he has purchased. Transportation costs for the animals is his primary business challenge. He support 70% of the community with his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats, and sheep

loans.name: Jenny Patricia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 21 años de edad y hace pocos meses mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no ha tenido hijos, aunque espera que lleguen pronto para formar su familia. El marido trabaja en Quito es comerciante. 

Ella para ganarse algo propio y para el bien de su futura familia desde hace 6 meses atrás se dedica al comercio, ella vende zapatos, productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y ropa por catálogos de varias marcas. Trabaja todos los días más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esas horas es más fresco para salir a realizar su recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que estos son muy buenos.
p>
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por el trato que les da la promotora de crédito.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en: The Empresarias Con Futuro Community Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, Ecuador, which is known for its beautiful beaches and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. It is here we find Jenny, who is 21 years old and recently married. Although she has no children, she hopes to have some soon to start a family. Her husband works as a merchant in the city of Quito. To make her own income and for the good of her future family, Jenny decided six months ago to start making a living in commerce. She sells shoes, Yanbal-brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories) and clothing of various brands via catalog. She works every day mostly during the mornings, since these are when she is freshest to go out and make her routes. She leaves the products on credit and collects every weekend. The products she sells the most are perfumes, since they are very good. She plans to use the loan to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and shoes. She has been with the community bank for two years and likes how she is treated by the loan agent. Her dreams are to keep making progress with her business and in life.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La Sra. Anita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 01 hija de 15 años, estudiante de nivel secundario.
Aficionada al comercio toda su vida, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños con la finalidad de apoyar en los gastos económicos de su hogar, inicia esta actividad con mucho entusiasmo y motivada, brinda facilidades de pago a sus clientes fijos, amigos, familiares y vecinos. 
Actualmente incrementó su mercadería, ha ampliado su negocio con la venta de plásticos en general, ollas y artefactos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará más prendas de vestir como faldas, blusas, pantalones, prendas íntimas, polos y camisas, también comprará baldes plásticos de diferentes tamaños, bandejas, reposteros, ollas de diferentes tamaños y marcas.
Anita es una mujer luchadora, anhela tener su propia casa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en: Anita belongs to “Las Aguerridas II” Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martin, Peru. She is 35 years old, married and has a 15-year-old daughter who is in high school. She has been around commerce all of her life and makes a living selling clothing for men, women and children to help support her household's finances. She started this activity with a lot of motivation and enthusiasm, providing payment plans to her steady customers, friends, relatives and neighbors. Currently she has increased her inventory and expanded her business by offering plastic items, pots and other products. With this loan, she plans to purchase more garments, such as skirts, blouses, pants, underwear, polos and shirts, as well as plastic buckets of different sizes, pastry trays, and pots of different sizes and brands. Anita is a fighter whose goal is to have her own home. She is very grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing this opportunity to women like herself so they can realize their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, plastic products and general items.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Luz, tiene 31 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene 5 hijos, uno mayor de edad y cuatro que estudian en colegio y escuela, todos sus hijos viven en Colombia país en el cual vivió por muchos años pero que por motivos personales dejo y regreso a esta linda ciudad. 

Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario y así poder salir delante de una forma honrada hace más de dos años decidió instalar un pequeño restaurante en la ciudad de Manta, en el cual prepara variedad de platos que son degustados por sus clientes que día a día acuden a su local, vende almuerzos y platos a la carta. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de una persona a quien le paga un sueldo. Ella está muy contenta con su negocio ya que le encanta la cocina y todo lo que prepara lo hace con mucho amor por eso le quedan mucho más deliciosos sus platos.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos así como también sodas, aguas, jugos, cervezas y otros productos que vende en su local. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos a pesar que se le hace complicado ir  a las reuniones quincenales.
 
Sus sueños son tener una casa y local propio ya que donde esta es alquilado.
texts.en: The Empresarias Con Futuro Community Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, Ecuador, which is known for its beautiful beaches and for being a city of unmatched beauty with many tourist attractions. It is here we find Luz, who is 31 and single, but has five children from a long-term relationship. One is full grown, while the other four are still in school. They all live in Colombia, where she lived for many years but for personal reasons left to return to this beautiful city. Luz, to earn her daily bread and to make headway in a honorable way, decided to open a small restaurant in the city more than two years ago. She prepares a variety of meals enjoyed by the customers who day-to-day visit her restaurant, selling lunches and dishes a la carte. She works every day and is helped by another person whom she pays. Luz is very content with her business since she loves to cook, and everything she prepares is done with a lot of love, which make her meals even more delicious. She plans the use the loan to purchase supplies to make her meals as well as sodas, waters, juices, beers and other items to sell at her restaurant. This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank, and she enjoys the loans even though it's hard to make the meetings every 15 days. Her dream is to have her own home and storefront since she currently rents.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, sodas, waters, juices, beers, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed A.

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Mohamed.  He is married to an experienced small-scale retailer and has seven children aged 3, 6, 9, 11, 15, 18 and 21 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he helps him with his business.  

In 1999, Mohamed established his photography and photocopying equipment and accessories business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,450,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed  has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy film (2 packets @ Le450,000), batteries (2 cartons  @ Le150,000), 1 camera at Le700,000, duplicating papers (2 cartons @ Le500,000) and photocopy ink (3 cartons  @ Le600,000). He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to buy a vehicle, establish a bar with a cinema, and educate his children to the highest level they wish to achieve. High customs duties and rise in cost of goods are his business challenges.  He serves a majority of the Makeni community in photocopying and photography. He is very serious and hard-working in his business.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for supplies for photography and photocopying.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
Jorge de 22 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar en el servicio de guardianía.  Poco a poco a incrementado su capacidad de pago debido a su trabajo y perseverancia. En la actualidad tiene un hijo y su esposa que es ama de casa. 

Poco a poco ha trabajado para darle une mejor vida a su familia. Para mejorar su vivienda él quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, zinc, arena y asi darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 22 years old and a hardworking gentleman. From a very young age, he has worked as a security guard. Over time, he has gradually increased his capacity to pay through work and perseverance. He now has a son and his wife is a homemaker.

Little by little, Jorge has worked in order to provide a better life for his family. In order to improve his home, he will use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, zinc, and sand so that his family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy cement, zinc, and sand for home improvements.

loans.name: Ginger Alcira

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Ginger, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 7 y 2 años, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es chofer profesional y trabaja en un bus de la ciudad. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de ganarse algo y con esto contribuir a los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende productos Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ropa interior de damas de la marca Leonisa. Ella también realiza trabajos de arreglo y pintado de uñas, trabajo que realiza al mismo tiempo que realiza sus ventas ya que estos los hace a domicilio. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana.Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los cosméticos y esto porque ella también los utiliza en sus trabajos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia pues alquila donde vive.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Empresarias con Futuro", meaning "Entrepreneurs with a Future", meets every 15 days in the district of Palmar of the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are very well-visited throughout the entire year. It is a beautiful city without compare and it has many tourist attractions. 

Here we meet Ginger. She is 28 years old and she is married common-law. She has three children, aged 10, 7, and 2 years old. The two eldest of her children are in school. Her husband is a professional driver and he works with the city bus lines. She has been with her communal bank for two years and she appreciates it for the benefits provided by the institution.

Our friend's goal is to earn an income for herself and to contribute to the household expenses. She is a merchant who sells Esika brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories), and she also sells Leonisa brand ladies' undergarments. She also provides manicure treatments, work that she realizes at the same time as she carries out her sales, especially because everything is done from her home. She completes her sales on credit and she collects payments every week. She has been in business for two years and it has done very well. Her best sellers are cosmetics, especially because she also uses these products in the services she provides. 

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and undergarments.

Her dream is to have a house of her own. She currently rents.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and undergarments.

loans.name: Lauratu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Lauratu.  She is married to a trader and has four children aged 5, 8, 12 and 15 years. In 1999, Lauratu established her "gara" (locally dyed)  textiles business. She began this business because she wanted to be self-employed and believed that she could get enough income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. 

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Lauratu requires a loan in order to buy "brilliant" fabric (1 bale @ Le 4,000,000). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le200,000.

 In the future, Lauratu plans to construct a house, open a saving account and pay her way for the pilgrimage to Mecca (Holy Land), and she also wants to support her children's education. She makes good quality "gara" clothing and does her business by public transport twice in a month.  

Lauratu is very determined and hopes to continue working hard to pay off her loans so that she can access more loans.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for "brilliant" fabric to dye and sell.

loans.name: Carolina Gabriela

texts.es:
Carolina, de30 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, esta casada, ella es comerciante se dedica ala venta de mercadería en general, este ha sido su primer negocio, lo  empezó cuando tenia 28 años de edad con capital propio, comenzó  vendiendo ropa, perfumes, zapatos de manera ambulante, además de este negocio ella es estilista que es su otra fuente de ingresos. Ella trabaja todos los días con el objetivo de dar a conocer su negocio, expandirse por toda la ciudad de León.  
Requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como ropa y joyas de plata. De esta manera podrá adquirir mas mercadería para vender y en lo futuro poner una tienda de mercadería en general. Su próxima meta es ir a comprar nueva mercadería a Panamá.
texts.en:
Carolina is 30 years old and resides in the city of León. She is married and has a seven-year-old son. Carolina is a merchant who sells general merchandise. This is her first business and she started it when she was 28 years old and with her own capital. Carolina started out selling clothing, perfumes, and shoes as a street vendor. In addition to this business, she works as a stylist to earn more income. She works every day with the goal of promoting her business. Carolina hopes to expand throughout the entire city of León.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as clothing and silver jewelry. The funds will allow her to acquire more merchandise to sell and she hopes to open a general merchandise store in the future. Her next goal is to buy new merchandise from Panama.

loans.use: to buy clothing and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Isha.  She is married and has 3 children aged 1 month, and 10 and 14 years who are school-going children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her mother and her uncle and they help her with her business; the other one is her niece who lives with her to attend school in the city. 

 In 2000, Isha established her food business. She began her business because  as a teenager she usually accompanied her mother to sell at the market, and since then she became fond of doing business. After she left school, she began her own little business and has one till now.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. 

 Isha has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy eggs: 25 cartons @ Le210,000, vegetable oil:  100 gallons @ Le34,000 Maggi: 30 cartons @ Le150,000, and tinned tomatoes: 40 cartons @ Le40,000.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le1,250,000.  In the future, Isha plans to build a house and open a textile shop and support her children to get the best education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for eggs: 25 cartons @ Le210,000, vegetable oil: 100 gallons @ Le34,000, Maggi: 30 cartons @ Le150,000, and tinned tomatoes: 40 cartons @ Le40,000.

loans.name: Shirley Yaqueline

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Bartolo.

En este lugar vive la señora Shirley, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos de 18, 17, 12,  11 y 9 años de edad, los tres menores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Ella para generar recursos económicos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace algún tiempo atrás decidió construir una pequeña granja en la cual criar aves de corral, allí se dedica a la cría de pollos aprovechando que cuenta con el espacio físico adecuado y además que esto también lo puede hacer sin tener que descuidar el hogar y sus hijos. Estos pollos los compra cuando están pequeños, los mantiene por espacio de tres meses y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y por libras a las personas que viven por su localidad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos y alimento para los mismos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque el grupo es unido y ordenado.

Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
In the Parish of Ayacucho of the canton of Santa Ana the communal bank San Bartolo meets every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful fresh water pools which are a great tourist attraction in the canton as well as the province.

Here we meet Shirley. She is 37 years of age and she is married common-law. She has five children, aged 18, 17, 12, 11, and 9 years old. The three youngest of her children are in high school and primary school. Her husband is an agriculturist.

Some time ago she built a small poultry farm in order to generate an income and to help her husband with the household expenses. She raises poultry because she has adequate space to do so and because she can also manage her business without having to neglect her home and her children. She buys the poultry when they are chicks and she keeps them for three months before she sells them to the merchants who visit her house. She also sells meat by the pound to the people in her community. 

This loan will be used to purchase poultry and feed. She has been a member of her communal bank since its inception and she is the treasurer. She appreciates it because the group is very unified and orderly.

Her dream is for her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and feed.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Zainab.  She is a widow and has 3 children aged 7, 10 and 14 years who are school-going children. In 2002, Zainab established her textiles business.  She learnt from her mother after dropping out of school how to do business. Her business assisted her before and after she got married to her late husband. 

She earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  Zainab has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy  different types of clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  In the future, Zainab plans to open a larger shop and also see her children through their education. 

Zainab serves customers around Makeni City and the surrounding villages.  She offers quality materials; that’s why her business is popular.  Zainab travels by public transport to Guinea Conakry once a month and Freetown twice a month. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for different types of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
This is 24 year-old Amie, who is married to a trader and has four children aged 6, 8, 10, and 12 years, all attending school. In 2000, Amie established her used clothing business, selling used clothing, bags, shoes and tops after having worked with her mother in the same field before she got married.

Competition is high, but her stock of quality goods attracts many customers, all of whom she serves in the centre and outskirts of Makeni City. Her major business challenges are the rainy season and rising transportation costs. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le Le940,000 every month.

Having already received and repaid two loans, Amie is now requesting a loan of Le Le5,000,000 to buy more ladies' used tops, vests, bags and clothing for her business.
