She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le Le250,000, and in the future plans to open additional outlets by accessing more loans. She also wants to give her children a good education. Amie thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for ladies' tops, vests and bags.

loans.name: Juana Iralda

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Bartolo.

En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, todos son mayores de edad, viven con ella y estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es mecánico.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que además de dedicarse al hogar también se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene una granja en la cual mete hasta doscientos pollos por temporada la misma que es de dos a tres meses, tiempo que mantiene  a sus pollos hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para poder venderlos en pie o por libras a comerciantes, tiendas de Ayacucho y personas que llegan hasta su casa. Lleva tres años dedicada a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos y alimentos para los mismos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the Parish of Ayacucho of the canton of Santa Ana the communal bank San Bartolo meets every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful fresh water pools which are a great tourist attraction in the canton as well as the province.

Here we meet Juana. She is 57 years old, married, and from her relationship she has six children. They are all grown and they live with her and attend university or high school. Her husband is a mechanic. 

She is a wonderful housewife and in addition to taking care of the home she also raises poultry. She has a coop where she can keep up to two hundred poultry at a time, keeping them for two or three months. She keeps her poultry until that time that they have reached an adequate weight to be able to sell them live or as meat to merchants, stores in Ayacucho, and to the general public who come to her house. She has been in business for three years.

With this loan she will purchase poultry and feed. She has been with her communal bank for the past two loan cycles and she appreciates partaking because the loans are a great help.

Her dream is to keep moving forward and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and feed.

loans.name: Maria Luzmila

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un pequeño negocio de legumbres, que poco a poco ha trabajado para mantener su hogar. Trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo tomates, cebollas, legumbres etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando y darles una mejor vida a sus dos hijos que aun estudian. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, zinc, hierro para su negocio y mejorar asi la vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking woman who has a small business selling legumes. Gradually over time, she has worked to maintain her home. Maria begins her work very early selling tomatoes, onions, legumes, and other products. She has many aspirations for her business. For this reason, she wants to continue working and provide a better life for her two children who are in school.

Maria wants to use this loan to buy cement, zinc, and iron for her business and to improve the life of her children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for improvements to her business.

loans.name: 3.2 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy makes a living by farming and raising poultry and cattle, and is applying for this loan to expand her businesses. She is 30 years old, married and has two children. She also leads a four-person loan group called the 3.2 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which is located in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. This is the first time the group has applied for a loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Thúy has been operating her business for five years and is handicapped mostly by a lack of capital. With the profits made possible by this loan, she hopes to earn enough money to provide for her kids and expand and improve her business by buying new supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to expand several small businesses.

loans.name: Daylen

texts.en: Daylen is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has two children and has for the last five years made a living by running a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and breads. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Daylen is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leonicia

texts.en: Leoncia is 50 years old, married and has eight children. Three of her children are married, three are still in school and two are not yet working. For the past 15 years, she has earned a living by running a retail store and by selling furniture. She earns about PHP 2,000 a month from her retail shop and another PHP 7,000 a month by selling furniture.  She is grateful because her businesses have allowed her to meet her family's needs and pay her children's tuition bills. She is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy soft drinks and biscuits for her retail store, and varnish and woods for her furniture business. She hopes to improve and expand both businesses in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for two small businesses.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old and married.  She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been farming vegetables for 2 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 3 times in the past to sustain her business.

Evelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. Dorcas has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and breads. She has had this business for five years, and she is a new member of HSPFI.

Dorcas requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.  In the future, Dorcas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: 12.7 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo is 44-years-old and married with two children. She lives in Thanh Hoa City, which is a semi-urban area in the Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 12.7 Nam Ngan solidarity group, which has three members.  

Mrs Thảo operates a food stall selling snacks, and she has been involved in this business for five years. Her main hardship is that she has a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. Lydia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads and snacks. She has had this business for two years. 

Lydia requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods and rice for sale.  She is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and rice for sale

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children.   Jenny works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running this store for 5 years and also earns an income from scrap iron.

Jenny requested a loan for PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan.   

Jenny aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 63 years old, married and has five children.

Felisa is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Felisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Felisa has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 47 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Rosalina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. Vicenta is married and has a convenience store business in the Philippines.

Vicenta requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, groceries, fried pork rinds, etc.

Vicenta has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, groceries, fried pork rinds, etc.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 63 years old and married.

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Anecita has borrowed and repaid 8 loans to NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns income from fish vending.

Anecita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Grace has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads and canned goods. She has had this business for five years, and she is a new member of HSPFI.

Grace requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a client who is 30-years-old, married and has three children. His family lives in the village of Maligaya Echague, and they are known as good personal references in their community.

Alex offers a motorcycle service, and at the same time he raises pigs. His motorcycle is a public transportation service in their community and surrounding area, and he has done this for three years. 

He is asking for a loan of P10,000. He will invest in motorcycle maintenance, particularly in changing the wheels and old sprocket of his motorcycle. Some of the proceeds will be also be used to buy feed for his pigs. This loan will help him improve his business, give his children a good education and provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy a wheel and sprocket for his motorcycle and feed for his hog raising business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. Beatriz is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her fishing business.

Beatriz has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Beatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a convenience store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her convenience store like toothpaste, groceries, etc.

Susan has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, spices, chips, bread, etc. 

In the future Susan would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her convenience store.

loans.name: Marisel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marisel works hard to support her family.

She has a junk (used materials) shop in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Marisel is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more used materials to sell in her junk shop.

Marisel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used materials to sell.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.  He and his wife have had a furniture shop business for six months. The couple works hard to improve the services they offer. The business has a monthly income of about 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which Orlando uses to pay for motorcycle transport, his family's daily needs, and allowances for his children.

Orlando hopes to improve the quality of the chairs, tables, cabinets and and beds he makes.  He plans to use this loan of 15,000 PHP to buy wood, varnish, and iron to repair the furniture and shop to make it more comfortable to work at.  He wishes to be able to give his children a good education and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase wood, varnish, and iron for a furniture shop business

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 46 years old, married, and has seven children.  She has a small retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and bread. She has had this business for six years.

Anabel plans to use this loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell at her shop. Anabel is a new member of Kiva field partner HSPFI.  In the future, Anabel hopes to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 59 years old and married with seven children.

Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Margie has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and earns additional income from rice retailing & food vending.

Margie aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Altangul

texts.en: Mrs. Altangul is 24 years old and lives with her mother, sister, brother and younger sister in rental house in Darkhan-the second largest city in Mongolia. Her mother is retired, sister is a cook in a electric plant, brother works at construction by part time and younger sister studies at university. Just in this year she started a clothes selling business at market. But currently it is not running so successful and she needs to raise her business current asset. It’s very beneficial to her business and family income. Because she pays her younger sister’s school payment and house rental. She is planning to purchase more muchness clothes ever than she sells before. Therefore Altangul is taking a loan to purchase some casual clothes from Ereen-a border city of China for increase her business output.

loans.use: To purchase some casual clothes from Ereen-a border city of China for increase her business output.

loans.name: Altantsog

texts.en:
Mr. Altantsog is a 30-year-old taxi driver. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar--the capital city of Mongolia. He started a taxi business this year. His daily income is not yet sufficient to purchase the new ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) which his family needs. They currently live in a small, old ger. It has become old and uncomfortable to live in. 
Altantsog is taking a loan to purchase a new ger to improve his family's life.

loans.use: To purchase a new ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent) for his family to live in

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Irene has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Irene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Irene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
With her patience and determination, Angelita strives hard to generate income and support the education of her five children. She doesn't want to laze at home. Together with her husband, she plants and harvests rice twice a year. They usually sell it to local traders in the village. They have been doing this for almost 20 years. 

Last harvest season, in May, she earned P30,000. According to her, the amount of profit she earned was not enough to cover all their expenses. But she was still thankful for all the blessings she received. For the next planting season, the couple needs additional laborers to help till, sow, pull and transplant the rice crop in the field. This is an additional expense for them. But they need to hire the help because they cannot do all this work themselves.

Angelita is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and pay for farm laborers. With the help of this loan, she believes she would achieve an abundant harvest and earn constant profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for farm laborers for land preparation and harvesting.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 28-year-old woman. She lives with her family in the village of Maligaya Echague. The couple has been blessed with two children who are school-aged. 

Two years ago Josephine began her furniture shop. She earns about P3,000 a month. Josephine uses her income to pay their electric bills, their children's expenses and their daily needs. She needs to buy some raw materials such as wood, nails and varnish to fulfill her customers' orders. She has requested a loan amount of P15,000. She is hoping that she can make her business more productive by giving her customers a quality product. For this, many customers will return for her furniture products.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and varnish for her furniture business.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Dolgorsuren is 66 and is a retiree and widow. Her husband died just one year ago. Now she lives only with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is divorced from her husband. 

Mrs. Dolgorsuren and her daughter own a house which is built from ceramic. The house has been going bad and becoming stale, so Mrs. Dolgorsuren needs to make some repairs or adjustments to her house including patching the roof and adding insulation to the walls. The loan Dolgorsuren is taking will be used to purchase some building materials for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Neddelyn

texts.en:
Neddelyn is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Neddelyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Neddelyn has been raising pigs for 11 years and earns additional income from buying & selling rice grains and peanuts.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat is 41 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her lovely four children. Khat is a farmer who grows rice. According to the rainy season, Khat needs some funds to support her farming business. The loan she is requesting will be used for planting rice. She plans to buy seeds and compost for her rice crop. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crop and the lack of money to pay for farming. Her dreams include making improvements to her house and providing for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost for her rice crop.

loans.name: Gleza

texts.en:
Gleza is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Gleza has a food shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue.

Gleza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gleza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue.

loans.name: Khurelchuluun

texts.en:
Khurelchuluun is 27 years old.  Since last year, he has been working as a plumber in a company. When he has days off, he runs a taxi business. 

Khurelchuluun lives with his father and younger brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger--a Mongolian nomadic tent--which is broken and became stale during the last July heavy rains. Khurelchuluun needs to change the covering, and possibly other parts, of his ger.  He is taking a loan to purchase a new covering for the ger or other parts needed to make repairs to it. 

Khurelchuluun plans to marry his girlfriend within the year, if he can.

loans.use: To purchase a new covering or other parts for his ger in order to repair it.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other equipment for the shop.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Mary Jane has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

Mary Jane is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Suvdaa

texts.en: Suvdaa is 52 years old and lives with her husband, daughter, and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is a student and her husband, Mr. Galbadrakh, is ill with kidney failure and must stay under constant medical care in the hospital. Suvdaa has been managing a business of used clothing sales since 2009, and she has a good experience in this business field. Once she said that “All I want at this moment is just to heal my husband."  She needs a lot of money to do it. Therefore, she is taking a loan to purchase clothes from wholesalers in the USA, in order to raise her business range and output. She loves her family very much.

loans.use: to purchase clothes from wholesalers in the USA in order to raise her business range and output.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rosario has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks for her store.

Rosario is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks.

loans.name: Nor-Aina

texts.en:
Nor-Aina is thirty-three years old and has five children. Nor-Aina is married and has four children who are in school.

Nor-Aina is in the agricultural business farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Nor-Aina requested a 13,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nor-Aina has been farming rice and vegetables for seven years now, and has borrowed twenty times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nor-Aina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is married with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sauda is 57 years old and has one child who is in school.

Sauda has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Sauda requested a 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

Sauda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Sauda would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 24 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Rosana is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosana has been farming rice and vegetables for four years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros has been managing a transportation business that provides services, particularly motorcycle transport, for more than three years. Her husband is responsible for driving the motorcycle from their village to the market and school.

Milagros is a 38-year-old woman and very responsible mother to her six children. Aside from the transportation business, she is also engaged in the hog raising business. She is thankful because, little by little, her income improves. However, because she has a large number of family members, she is in need of additional capital to sustain all their daily needs. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to use in paying the franchise for the motorcycle transport business, and to buy more pigs and feeds for their daily maintenance. She hopes that she can maintain and increase the income she generates from her two business, because her profit will really help her in sending her children to school and in sustaining the financial and basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to pay the franchise for the motorcycle transport and also buy pigs and feeds for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, beverages, and canned goods for her store.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her business buying and selling bananas.

Artemia has been in this business for five years. Artemia earns more income from the general store.

Artemia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell.
